loans.name: Davaadorj

texts.en:
Davaadorj S. is 47 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her two eldest children work full time in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, and the youngest son is a student in a local university.

Davaadorj has a small retail business in dairy products. She sells various dairy products including milk, cheese, cream, etc. She started this dairy retail business in 2005 and, since the beginning, she has been working on this business with her husband. The business has been quite successful and is now the main source of income for the family.

Since the start in 2005 Davaadorj’s business capital has increased from 80,000 MNT to 600,000 MNT (1 USD = 1.450 MNT). She says that she would like to grow his business into a sustainable family business.

Davaadorj requests a loan to purchase more dairy products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products for her business

loans.name: Flaviana

texts.en:
Mrs. Flaviana P. is from the village of Guinabot, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is married and blessed with four children.

She joined PMPC on April 14, 2009 in order to access their programs and services. Recently, she's obtaining her 2nd loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 as additional capital for her business and in order for her to buy new cow as additional livestock for one of her other businesses.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Odsuren

texts.en:
Odsuren D. is married and lives with his two children in Arhangai province, one of the central provinces of Mongolia. His two sons are both high school students.

Odsuren sells various clothes for women and men. He rents a small stall in the local market called Hasu Center and sells the clothes at his stall. He mostly purchases clothes for his business from the wholesale markets in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

Since the start in 2007, he has been in the clothing retail business and, within two years, his business capital has increased from 200,000 MNT to 600,000 MNT (1 USD = 1,450 MNT).

Odsuren requests a loan to purchase more clothes for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of materials to make shoes

loans.name: Boldbaatar

texts.en:
Boldbaatar is 42 years old and lives with his wife and 17-year-old daughter in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His daughter attends high school and his wife is a custodian at the local theater.

Boldbaatar operates a water delivery service to the nearby ger districts in his town. He began his business in 2005 with only one horse and one cart. Since then, he has managed to add nine more horses and ten more employees to his company. This success has meant that not only has Boldbaatar’s family’s financial situation been improved by his business, but nine other family’s financial situations have been improved as well.

Boldbaatar’s personal goal for the near future is to be able to pay for his daughter’s university tuition fees and keep his family comfortable and well fed. He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase five more horses and one more cart in order to expand his delivery area even further and to keep growing his customer base.

loans.use: To purchase five more horses and one more cart

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette is engaged in cradle weaving. Her desire to improve her business led her to seek the financial support of Kiva lenders.

She is now requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 that she will use to purchase raw materials needed in cradle weaving. Janette is looking forward for the success of her business.

Janette is 43 years old, married to Federick Sr. The couple was blessed with six children: Mary Jane-15 years old, high school student; Fredelin-13 years old, high school student; Federick-10 years old, grade-III; Frednaline-7 years old, grade-II; Federick-5 years old and Jericho-9 months old.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials

loans.name: Um

texts.en: Um C. is 26; she is married and has two children. To earn a living, she sells a variety of flowers that she buys in bulk from her wholesale supplier. She sells to people who need flowers to decorate parties or ceremonies. She also plants a type of flower on her garden around her home. Her husband helps her sell flowers. Um C. finds it hard to picking up her flower to sell at the market, because she doesn't have her own vehicle, so that she is looking for a loan on Kiva through HKl to be used to buy a motorcycle which she will use them to support her business.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle which she will use them to support her business

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita has managed a typical retail store for almost twenty-one years and she is earning a weekly net income of PHP 600. She wants her business to become productive so she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 that she can use as additional business capital. The amount will be of great help in purchasing different grocery items for her store that will also result in increased income.

Nenita is married to Medardo Sr., a farmer. They have three children: Ebony - 28 years old, already working in Manila; Medardo Jr. - 26 years old, an auditor, also working in Manila; and their youngest is Angelica - 21 years old, a college graduate. They are living in Salay, Angadanan, Isabela, a rural and peaceful area.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de matériels de travail

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
S. is a 31-year-old widowed woman and mother. She has two school-aged kids who are still dependent on her income. She lives in her own small home in Phnom Penh, the capital.

S. owns a piece of land that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows different kinds of flowers on her land, which she will harvest when they are ready and sell them at the market. In addition, she owns a barbering shop where she cuts her neighbor's hair for a fee.

S. will be using her loan to buy more barbering tools.

loans.use: To buy more barbering tools

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
“God is merciful to those who are working". This is the guiding principle of Mrs. Dorothy B.. She is 49 years old, married, and blessed with four children. Two of her children are still studying while two of them have already finished their studies. She is trying her best to support her children with their daily school allowance.

Dorothy wanted to borrow PHP 10,000 that will serve as additional capital for her sari-sari store business (community based general store). She will use the loan to purchase different merchandise she needs for the improvement of her store.

Dorothy has operated her business for almost eleven years and it has been a great help in supporting the education of her children and also in providing for the immediate needs of their family. However, her income is still not enough so she keeps on working hard and hoping to reach her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for her store

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is married to Leonardo, a tricycle driver.  They have a ten year old son named Ceasar and he is already in grade 5.  Their family is living in Sillawit, Cauayan City, Isabela. 

Leticia manages a retail store in their village and she is glad that she is earning a weekly net income of PHP2,500.00.  She is now planning to borrow a loan of PHP27,000.00 from the KIVA lenders for her business expansion and as additional working capital. This will be of great for her store to grow by purchasing different commodities that she can offer to her customers.  She hopes that her loan request will be granted as soon as possible. Leticia is very patient in keeping her business to become profitable.

loans.use: To purchase different commodities for her store

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: S. is 52 years old married woman and mother. To earn a living, S. sells rice and soup to sewing workers from her shop nearby garment factory and is normally earning $5 per day. She is married to Samouen, age 51, who is a vehicle repairer. This older couple has given birth to four children, most of who are garment worker. S. requests a loan to buy necessary ingredient to cook food for sale. Note: S.'s husband is shown in the picture here.

loans.use: To buy necessary ingredient to cook food for sale

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
“Time is gold”, this is the guiding principle of Bernadette which also motivates her to work hard so she can help her husband to earn a living for her family. She is 32 years old, married and gifted with two children. His husband is a tricycle driver while she sells ice and iced candy in their village.  She is also engaged in the hog raising business.  

Bernadeth wanted to borrow the amount of PHP5,000 for the maintenance of their tricycle and their piggery. Her wish is to expand her business to improve their living condition and help his husband in sending their children to school.

loans.use: For the maintenance of her piggery and tricycle business

loans.name: Doung

texts.en: S. is a widowed woman, 42 years old, who lives in Phnom Penh City. She was married, but divorced her husband since her kids are very young. She now has two teenage children who are local students and under her care. Currently, S. is an internal shipping staff for a garment industry. S. has been building a new house for months ago, but the construction is temporarily postponed because of the lacking money. Therefore, she would like a loan from Kiva’s partner HKL and she will use to finish building her house.

loans.use: To finish building her house

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is 53 years old. She is married and they were blessed with five children: Liberty - 29 years old ,college graduate; Christina Marie - 28 years old, is also a college graduate;Afredo - 26 years old, college graduate; Adam - 24 years old, college graduate and Brandon - 21 years old, is a 3rd year college student.  Four of them are already married and living with their own families.  The three of them are living in the simple village of Baculud, Amulung, Cagayan. She is very proud for having responsible and hardworking children. She is happy for their achievements and she hopes that her youngest will also finish his studies.  

Laura is a food vendor in their village.  Her desire to improve her business motivated her to ask for financial support from the KIVA lenders amounting to PHP8, 000. Despite of the difficulties in life, she still manage to maintain her business and very determined to make it a success.  She is hoping that the lenders will approve her loan request for it will be very helpful for her to develop her food vending.

loans.use: Additionla capital for the development of her food vending business

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is engaged in a rice retailing business. She is 53 years old and married to Faustino, a carpenter in their village. Since her husband does not have regular work, she started her own business as another source of income. Together they are helping one another provide for the needs of their family. They have four children: Floreante, George, Maryrose, and Joshua.

Mila wants her business to improve and this is the reason she is asking to borrow 10,000 pesos from Kiva lenders. She plans to buy sacks of rice and other commodities that she can offer to her customers. She is hoping that her business will continue to improve.

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice and other commodities

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en: Jenny is a taho vendor in her village. Taho is a snack in the Philippines made of fresh soft/silken tofu with arnibal (brown sugar and vanilla syrup) and pearl sago. She usually carries two large aluminum buckets that hang from each end of a yoke. The bigger bucket carries the tofu base while the smaller one holds the arnibal and sago "pearls". She keeps working hard so that she can continue to send her children to school, since they are only at the elementary level. Jenny is 29 years old and blessed with two children. She is married and her husband works as a farmer. Their income is just enough for their daily needs. With a dream to improve her business, Jenny wants a loan of 6,000 pesos from the Kiva lenders. This money will help make her business productive.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Doul

texts.en: Doul Y, 45, lives in the province of Pursat, Cambodia, where she owns and works a plot of land next to her house, growing both rice and vegetables. She can plant her crops twice a year, and she was taught this by her grandfather. She is currently a good mother of six children, half of whom are married, with the others single and in school. She is married to Kham Ly, age 59, who helps her on the farm. In the past, Doul Y hired her nearby neighbor's buffalo to help plow her farmland during the farming season. She is currently hoping to reduce this cost; therefore, she would like a loan on Kiva in order to buy a pair of water buffalo.

loans.use: To buy a pair of water buffalo

loans.name: Palmyra

texts.en:
Palmyra is engaged in dressmaking business. She is 57 years old and she has been doing the business for 37 years. Farming is their source of income that supported the needs of their family.  

In order to help her husband in providing the daily needs of their family, she then decided to put up her own business which she knows best.  In God's help, she was able to start her sewing business which helps her in supporting the educational needs of her children.  She now wanted to borrow a loan amount of PHP8,000 for the maintenance of her business.

loans.use: Maintenance of her business

loans.name: Guljan

texts.en: Guljan is 35 years old and lives with her husband and two sons, ages 7 and 8, in a house in the Bayan-Ulgii province of western Mongolia. Her two children both attend a local secondary school and her husband works at a private company in town. Guljan is very busy running two businesses. During the day, she runs a clothing retail business located in a rented stall in the local market and at night she sews household goods like blankets, sheets and pillow cases. She started her retail clothing business in 2006 after working at her friend’s stall for three years. Guljan works hard so that she and her husband can afford their children’s school tuition and so that her children will learn to be self reliant when they get older. She is requesting a 600,000 tugrug (~420 USD) loan to import more clothing from both China and Kazakhstan.

loans.use: loan to import more clothing from both China and Kazakhstan.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 59 years old and married to Luis, a farmer.  They were blessed with six children, three of them are married. They are residing in the village of Salay, Angadanan Isabela, where most of the residents are farmers. 

She manages a typical retail store in their village and her weekly net income is PHP500.00.  She plans to avail a loan amount of PHP5,000.00 from the KIVA lenders for additional capital and for her business expansion. Their sources of income are farming and tailoring business. She is a dressmaker for almost 32 years, and enjoys her life on dressmaking and retailing. She believed that "challenges are the greatest part of success"

loans.use: Additional capital of her retail store

loans.name: Chou

texts.en: Chou C., 40 years old, is a rice and vegetable grower from the Pursat Province. She runs her business on her own farmland where she grows different kinds of crop like cabbages, rice, potatoes, and morning glories, which she will sell to a buyer when they have matured. She currently earns an average of $4/day and has been running the business for years. Her husband who helps her with the farmwork, stands next to her in the picture. Chou C. has two school-aged children. Chou C. and her family are also facing difficulties with transportation because they have no vehicle to get around. Chou C. is therefore pursuing a loan to buy a used motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 26 years old and have a strong determination in fulfilling her dreams in life. She is happily married to Julius, a tricycle driver. They have three children: Johnson-5 years old; John Paul-4 years old and Jilian-2 years old. Her family is peacefully living in the village of Sta. Rosa, Santiago City.

Analiza is tricycle operator and at the same time she is making some accessories for cell phones. She wanted to improve their way of living through the business she manage. The couple strives hard to provide the needs of their family especially the needs of their children.  Analiza would like to borrow additional capital to the ASKI KIVA lenders amounting to PHP5,000.00.  The loan will be used for the maintenance of their tricycle. She really hopes that her request will be granted.

loans.use: For the maintenance of their tricycle transport business

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan K. is a 44-year-old farmer who lives in Pursat Province. Chan K. is married to Mr. Chan Sie, age 44, who works with her in the farming business. This couple currently owns a cultivating machine that they use for their farming. In addition, they use their machine to plow a nearby farmer’s farmland for profit. In addition, Chan K. hopes to raise animal in order to sell their mature but she is not enough money to buy it, so she has decided to seek a loan from Kiva's partner HKL to buy piglet, chicken, and duck to breed.

loans.use: To buy piglet, chicken, and duck to breed

loans.name: Enhtuya

texts.en: Enhtuya T. is a 33 years old and lives with her three children in an apartment in Khar-khorin sum, ancient capital city of Mongolian empire. Her oldest two children attend University in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia and youngest one goes to local secondary school. She operates a clothing trading business at a rented stall on the market in her town. She manages her business all by herself and established herself in the business community. She says " My only wish is to support my children to be a better person in the future". She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~1400 USD) loan to pay the tuition fee of her children.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee of her children.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is 32 years old and married to Enrique. They have four children: Cliford, who is 13 and in 3rd year high school; Nica, who is 10 and in grade IV; Kristine Joy, who is 6 and in grade I, and Rica Mae, who is 1. Merlina has a direct selling business, offering cosmetic products. She hopes that she will be able to sustain her children's needs through her business.

Merlina and her husband work hard to earn a living for their family. They are thankful because they have unity and each of them knows their responsibilities in their house. Merlina is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders and is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP. She will use the loan to purchase more products to offer her customers. She is praying that her business will enable her to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: To purchase additional products

loans.name: Yoem

texts.en: H., 39, lives in the rural area of Pursat province, where she has owned a small plot of land since 1979. She grows rice and has two crops per year, in both the dry and rainy seasons. She is married and has two teenage children who attend school. Her husband, Kosal, 31, works with her in the farming business and this is their main source of income. Because the rainy season is coming, H. needs a loan of $400 USD to buy her nearby neighbor's farmland, on which she will plant rice.

loans.use: To buy her nearby farmland to plant rice

loans.name: Badamsuren

texts.en:
B. Badamsuren is 27 years old and lives with his parents and siblings in Hovd province in western Mongolia. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.

Badamsuren operates a transport business in his province. He owns a large truck and is hired by people and businesses to transport goods throughout the province. Badamsuren started his business in 2006 and has found success as a truck driver. Today, he transports a variety of imported and exported goods, such as animal skin, construction materials, consumer goods, etc., back and forth between the Chinese border. In the winter, Badamsuren also purchases and transports coal which he sells to local residents and businesses, with many of whom he has contracts. In the future, he hopes to continue to expand and improve his business so that he can provide for his family. He is requesting a 1,400,000 MNT loan to purchase machinery parts and coal to sell.

loans.use: To purchase machinery parts and coal to resell

loans.name: Jesica

texts.en:
Jessica, 45, lives in the simple village of Baculud, Amulung, Cagayan. She is happily married to Joel, a farmer in their village. They are blessed with two children: Jhon Joel, age seven, a second grader and Ayannah Marie a six year old kindergarten student.

Jessica manages a sari-sari store (community based store) in their village. Due to lack of capital, she is asking for financial support from KIVA lenders to maintain her business. She would like to borrow at least PHP13,000 to purchase stocks for her store like rice, soft drinks, canned and bottled goods, noodles, soap and other basic commodities. Through hard work and the help of lenders, Jessica dreams of becoming successful in business.

She also hopes that her children will continue and finish their studies so they have a bright future. By helping each other and with her husband, Jessica knows it will come true.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Vin

texts.en: Vin Y. is a married woman and blessed with three children. All three are young and enrolled in the local public school. Her husband's name is Cheng Ngem, 29, and he assists her on the farm. Vin Y., born in 1977, has been a rice farming for years.  It's a skill she learned from her parents. To earn a living, she plants crops on farmland she inherited from her grandmother.  To help on the farm, Vin Y. requested a loan to buy a water buffalo to plow the farmland.

loans.use: Buy a water buffalo to plow the farmland.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Ma. Luzviminda A. is a member of ASHI since 2002. All throughout her membership and loans received, she had proven her dignity and word of honor by keeping a good track record in repayment, business and attendance during weekly center meeting. Despite of struggles she had been through in fighting against poverty, she had managed to be a responsible mother to her two sons and wife to her loving husband who is a fisherman. Business she had put up through her loans in ASHI is her most treasured achievement in life because this had been a great means of financial source for the family. Her profits in this business have enabled her to send her children to a vocational course in college. Thus, Ma. Luzviminda wanted her fishing business managed by her husband to grow even more to be able to be able to achieve her vision of life out of the umbrella of poverty. Now, she is requesting for a much larger amount of loan which will be used in buying a new motor fishing boat and some amount will be intended for its maintenance. Once her business has grown, she will be using her profits in supporting the needs of her family. She also hoped that their house be renovated for a healthy and comfortable living.

loans.use: Will be used to pay for purchasing a new motor fishing boat and for the boat's maintenance.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: He want to completed his stocks

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en: Chheng S. earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She raises them for their offspring and for slaughter.  Chheng also helps her husband cultivate rice. The couple was married years ago and has no children.  Chheng lacks money to buy food for her pigs so is asking for a Kiva loan to purchase food to fatten her pigs.

loans.use: Purchase food to fatten her pigs.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en: Through her membership in ASHI Teresita Maluco is requesting for a much larger amount of loan which will be used to support her desire of growing her hog fattening (pig raising) business. Her two children whose age range is from 25 and 26, are still dependent to her financially since they were only high school graduates. Opportunity of getting better and well compensated job for them is hard though. During the times wherein they are studying, it was so hard for Teresita to provide their needs at the same time providing also he needs of her business with such a very small amount of capital. A profit she makes out of this business is her family’s main source of income since her husband’s livelihood being a laborer is sporadic since then and now. Depending on it alone, there could have been no food on their table as regular as it should be, and her two children could not have graduated from high school.  However, for Teresita it is never too late yet to keep on dreaming for her children. Loan she requests now is her opportunity of achieving it. Once she had made her business grow, she could be of great help to her children and can as well provide her children source of income. The entire family can be working in the business to make it successful provided they have sufficient capital through loan.

loans.use: Will be used to pay for the variety store's inventory.

loans.name: Tep

texts.en: Tep C. is a 54-year-old farmer who lives in Pursat Province.  Tep is married to Mr. Cheang, age 55, who works with her in their farming business.  They own and use a cultivating machine for farming and plow a nearby farmer’s land for a fee.  There are many farmers who need their plowing services but they can't fulfill their needs because they only have one machine.  To satisfy more customers, Tep would like a loan to purchase one more machine.

loans.use: Purchase a plow machine.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
58-year-old Lucita Juanillo is requesting for a loan amounting to Php15,000 through ASHI. The said amount will be used to increase the inventory of her variety to be able to get more profits which will enable her to augment her husband’s income being a carpenter and will be able to support the needs of her two children who are unemployed as well as her grandchildren who lives in their house.

Lucita’s variety store has been a great provider to her family for the past five years that she had put this up. However, income it generates as well as its profits are yet enough to bring her family out of poverty at the same time working out for its sustainability. Loans she would be receiving through ASHI would be a great means for her aspiration be achieved and for her family especially grandchildren to experience life away from being poor.

loans.use: Will be used to pay for purchasing piglets for a hog fattening business.

loans.name: Oyuntsetseg

texts.en: A. Oyuntsetseg is 44 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her youngest daughter currently attends high school. Oyuntsetseg operates a wooden product making business in her town. The business is very family oriented, as her husband designs and produces their products while Oyuntsetseg paints and decorates them. Their oldest daughter also helps with the business in her free time. Oyuntsetseg started her wood products business in 1999 with capital of 50,000 tugrugs (~35 USD). The business has been successful and they have grown a stable operation. Today, her working capital exceeds 1,200,000 tugrugs (~840 USD) Using her savings, she was recently able to build a house for her oldest daughter. Oyuntetseg attributes her success to the quality of her products, which is much desired by her customers. She is requesting a 1,200,000 tugrug (~840 USD) loan to purchase more wood and paints for their wooden products business.

loans.use: to purchase more wood and paints for their wooden products business.

loans.name: Amanjol

texts.en:
Amanjol, 29, lives with his wife and two year old daughter in the Bayan-Ulgii province of western Mongolia. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Amanjol is a very busy man, owning not just one but two businesses. He operates a shoe repairing business during the day and drives a taxi at night. Amanjol began repairing shoes in 2000 after he graduated high school. He was able to save up money for a car and begin his taxi service in 2006.

Today, his taxi service earns between 20,000 and 45,000 tugrugs (~14-31 USD) each day. Amanjol works many hours every day to provide his family the things they need. He would eventually like to hire an assistant in his shoe repair shop so he can grow his earning and expand his customer base. Until that time he will keep working hard and saving money for his family’s future.

Amanjol is requesting a 300,000 tugrug (~210 USD) loan to purchase more supplies like rubber, glue, leather and nails that he needs for his shoe repair business.

loans.use: Purchase raw material.

loans.name: Chimedregzen

texts.en: Chimedregzen is 47 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a house in the Arkhangai province of Mongolia. His oldest son attends university and his daughter attends a local secondary school. Chimedregzen operates a retail clothing business in a rented stall in his town’s central market. He started his business in 2000 with working capital of 1,000,000 tugrug (~700 USD). Now his working capital exceeds 3,000,000 tugrug (~2100 USD). Chimedregzen imports his products both from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, and China. Because of his hard work and good business skills, Chimedregzen has been able to build a home for his family as well as pay for both his children’s education. He is requesting a 3,800,000 tugrug (~3670 USD) loan to purchase new types of clothing for his business so that he can expand his customer base.

loans.use: to purchase new types of clothing for his business

loans.name: Ray

texts.en: Ray R., 44 years old, is a low-income people living in the province of Pursat, in Cambodia. Ray R. and her husband are local crop planters. They have also been working in the rice trade business during the coming harvesting season: collecting rice from farmers and re-selling it to earn profit. Ray R. is taking out her first loan to buy a pair of buffalo which she will use them to help plow the farmland, as well as raising its offspring in the future.

loans.use: To buy a pair of buffalo which she will use them to help plow the farmland, as well as raising its offspring in the future

loans.name: Zergay

texts.en:
Zergay son of Nek M.. He is married and he has a retail shop. When he started this business for the first time, he had a small business and he was very weak, but when he got an individual loan he really improved a lot in his business and still he is furthering his business, attracting some good numbers of customers, making a good income for his family, and repaying the loan without any difficulty and on time. 
Therefore he has requested his second-cycle loan to enlarge his shop and continue his business with even more success. He is sure that he can be a good business dealer in the future.

loans.use: He want to buy foods and necessary things for his shop

loans.name: Gerelmaa

texts.en: G. Gerelmaa is a 42 year old single mother who lives with her two children in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her two sons live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest son currently attends university and the youngest is in kindergarden. Gerelmaa operates a clothing retail business out of a rented stall at the local market. She started her business in 2008 with the capital of 2,000,000 tugrugs (~1400 USD). She has found success in her trade and has used her earnings to support her family and pay her son's tuition fees. Today, her working capital exceeds 3,000,000 tugrugs (~2100 USD). In the future Gerelmaa hopes to continue her success and grow her business. She is requesting a 3,600,000 tugrug (~2530 USD) loan to purchase more clothes for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her business

loans.name: Kombinat

texts.en: Kombinat is 63 years old and lives with his wife and five year old daughter in the Bayan-Ulgii province of western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Kombinat owns a raw material retail business in his town. He began selling raw materials such as sheep skins, wool and cashmere to local garment producers in 2004. Currently, Kombinat earns between 5,000 and 10,000 tugrug  (~3-7 USD) per day. He wants to grow his business in the future so that he can provide a good education for his daughter and a comfortable home for his family.  He is requesting a 600,000 tugrug (~420 USD) loan so that he can purchase a larger amount of raw materials in which to trade at the market.

loans.use: purchasing a larger amount of raw materials

loans.name: Chuluunbaatar

texts.en:
Chuluunbaatar L. is 43 years old and lives with his wife in the Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. He and his wife live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. He currently operates a bakery and consumer goods retail business in his town. His wife, Tsiilaasuren, helps him by traveling to purchase the products and supplies for the business. 

Chuluunbaatar started his bakery in 1996 with capital of 120,000 tugrugs (about $84). He makes a variety of breads and baked goods which he sells directly to his customers. After building a stable operation, Chuluunbaatar used his earnings to start selling consumer goods in addition to the bakery. The continued growth of both businesses recently enabled him to purchase a car. 

He attributes his success to his ability to deliver quality products to the consumer. Chuluubaatar hopes to continue to grow his business in the future and is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug loan to purchase more supplies and products to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies and products to sell

loans.name: Mohammad Nazar

texts.en:
Mohammad Nazar is a young man. He is uneducated but he has lots of experience. He has a cosmetics and ladies purse shop in the city of Jalalabad. He has been involved in this business for more than 5 years, and earlier he worked in another similar business in the same city. He has responsibility for his family, so during the last 5 years, he tried many times to enlarge his shop, but was unable to do so. When he found AFS (Ariana Financial Services Joint Stock Company) in Jalalabad, he was very happy and decided to apply for a loan.

He has requested an individual loan of 30000 Afghans to buy some necessary tools for his cosmetics shop and to enlarge his shop. These improvements will further his business, helping him be more successful and make a good monthly income for his family.

loans.use: To buy some necessary tools for his cosmetics shop and to enlarge the shop

loans.name: Nemi

texts.en:
Nemi F. is 58 years old and already a widower. His wife died after giving birth to their daughter named Czarina Ellen who is still studying.  They are living in the village of Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. He is a vocational graduate of Driving Mechanics. After this, He is doing everything in order to support the education of his daughter. 

Farming is his major source of income.  He cultivates their farm twice a year by planting rice and corn. But since it is only seasonal. he then ventured to another business to have an alternative source of income.  Through his tricycle operation business, he was able to provide their basic needs and send his daughter to school. During harvest season, he can to earn an income of PHP15,000.00 and PHP2,500.00 a month from his tricycle. He utilized his income by acquiring their daily basic needs, finance the tuition fees and allowances of his daughter. 

To further maintain his two businesses, he is now asking to avail a loan of PHP7,000 that he can use for the maintenance of his tricycle and also to purchase their farming needs.  He believes that someday, his daughter will finished her studies and their status of living will improve also through the financial assistance of the KIVA lenders.

loans.use: For the  maintenance of his tricycle transport business and farming needs

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 45 years old, married and living in the village of San Juan, Quirino, Isabela. They have two children and still studying.  Marilyn is glad that her husband is in full support with her small business. She hopes that they will be able to survive the hardships in life that they are experiencing.  

Marilyn manages  a village store located just in front of their house.  She is requesting for a loan of PHP13,000 for her village store.  She will budget the loan to purchase more groceries for her general store business and hoping that it will become profitable.  

She hopes that her business will continuously be supported by KIVA lenders so she can also provide a better living for their family.

loans.use: Additional capital for maintenance and further growth of her store

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is engaged in a general store business. She sells different commodities such as vegetables, fruits, grocery items, dried fish and a lot more. Her store is located just in front of their house. With the help of lenders, she is positive that all things are possible.  

She is now asking for a loan of 9,000 Philippine pesos from Kiva lenders. She will use the loan to purchase stocks of commodities for her store to earn a bigger income. She hopes that the lenders will give her the chance to improve her business for the benefit of her family.

Angelita is 57 years old and is from the village of San Juan, Quirino, Isabela. She lives happily with her husband, who works as a farmer in their village. They are blessed with a big family. She hopes that her business will be maintained because she believes that her children still need her support financially.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her retail business

loans.name: Isaura Isaias

texts.pt:
Isaura Isaías M. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, tem 43 anos de idade, casada e mãe de dois filhos de 15 e 10 anos de idade, ambos vão a escola, estudou ate 6ª classe do antigo sistema de ensino e parou de estudar por motivos de gravidez pois teve que ir ao lar. Não sustenta mais ninguém para alem dos filhos.

Em 1996 Isaura saiu da cidade de Maputo para Boane junto com o marido e filhos, por motivos da transferência do marido que e funcionário do ministério da defesa nacional. Vive na casa do serviço do marido no bairro militar.

Isaura é vendedora Ambulante de camarão, aprendeu a fazer o negocio em Boane com as amigas a 06 anos atrás, não tem empregado e chega a fazer 10 horas diárias, actualmente tem capacidade para adquirir camarão no valor de 10.000,00mt, quantidade que depois de vendida consegue um lucro de aproximadamente 5.000,00mt, com o qual, somando com o valor que marido da, sustenta a família e consegue poupar algum através de poupanças bancárias.

Com o empréstimo de 10.000,00mt pretende investir na diversificação dos produtos no seu negócio adquirindo lulas e caranguejo. O seu maior desafio é de um dia poder adquirir um congelador maior que o que usa agora para poder conservar melhor os seus produtos e sonha em um dia construir uma barraca.

Conheceu a Hluvuku graças a mobilização feita pelos gestores da mesma, este é o segundo empréstimo da Isaura na instituição. Já se beneficiado de empréstimo no valor de 5.000,00mt que investiu no negocio, tendo reembolsado sem problemas e compromete-se a continuar a pagar bem para poder aceder a outros empréstimos.
texts.en:
Isaura Isaías M. was born in Maputo, Mozambique. She is 43 years old, married, and the mother of two. Her children are 15 and 10 years old and both in school. She studied through sixth grade in the old school system and stopped when she became pregnant. She takes care of her two children only.

In 1996 Isaura's husband, who works for the national ministry of defense, was transferred and he, Isaura, and their children left the city of Maputo for Boane. They live in her husband's barracks in the military area of the city.

Isaura is a mobile shrimp vendor. She learned how to conduct this business with friends six years ago. She does not have any employees and works ten-hour days. Now she can buy 10,000 MT (meticais)'s worth of shrimp, which after she sells it, earns her a profit of approximately 5,000 MT. This amount, plus the amount her husband earns, supports the family, and she is able to put some money in a savings account.

With the loan of 10,000 MT Isaura intends to invest in diversification of her products by purchasing squid and crab. Her largest challenge/goal is one day to buy a bigger freezer than her current one, so she can preserve her products better. Her dream is to construct a small home one day.

Isaura learned about Hluvuku (Kiva's Field Partner) through its employees. This is her second loan with the institution. She previously received a loan of 5,000 MT, which she used to invest in her business and which she repaid successfully. She has committed to continuing to pay properly and be able to access future loans.

Translated from Portuguese by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell shrimp, squid, and crab

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
For the last six years, Josefina has maD. a living managing a general store located in front of her house. She wants to make her business more productive and profitable, and has applied for a loan for PHP10,000 to expand her store so she can better help her family pay its bills and have the best life possible. She will use this loan to buy a range of items she can sell to her customers.

Josefina is 50 years old, married and lives with her husband and their four children in the village of San Juan, Quirino, Isabela.

loans.use: To expand her small store

loans.name: Sancho

texts.pt:
Sancho Filipe C., nasceu na cidade de Maputo, tem 60 anos de idade, casado e pai de 05 filhos de 28, 27, 12, 09 e 05 anos de idade, todos vão a escola, estudou ate 8ª classe do antigo sistema de ensino, parou de estudar porque tinha que cumprir o serviço militar obrigatório. Sustenta apenas três dos cinco filhos pois os dois primeiros têm rendimentos e residências próprios.

Sancho trabalhava nos Caminhos-de-ferro de Moçambique (CFM) .Quando ingressou no serviço militar obrigatório em Boane com 21 anos de idade, depois foi transferido para Cabo delgado (província do norte de Moçambique), onde regressou para Maputo quando tinha 24 anos de idade e voltou a trabalhar nos CFM ate reformar, actualmente vive na casa própria em Boane junto com a família.

 Actualmente é supervisor chefe na empresa de segurança privada de Moçambique (MOSEG), aprendeu esse trabalho nos CFM num curso de formação da policia em 1995, o seu rendimento actual e de 4.500,00mt por mês com o qual sustenta a família e consegue poupar algum para poder melhorar a sua habitação.

Com o empréstimo de 10.000,00mt pretende adquirir cimento, ferro e chapas para concluir a sua obra.

Conheceu a Hluvuku através de um colega de trabalho que também é cliente da instituição. Nunca trabalhou com outras instituições financeiras e este é o seu terceiro empréstimo tendo se beneficiado com empréstimos no valor de 5.000,mt e 8.000,00mt para agropecuária e comercio respectivamente, de salientar que fez o reembolso dos mesmos sem problemas e compromete-se continuar a pagar bem para poder aceder a outros empréstimos e mobilar a casa.
texts.en:
Sancho Filipe C. is a 60 year old Maputo resident. He is married and has five children with ages between 5 and 28, all attending school.Sancho supports the three younger ones. He completed 8th grade but had to drop school to join the army. Sanchos used to work at the Mozambique Rail Company "Caminhos-de-ferrro de Moçambique" (CFM), until he joined the army at 21. He was later tranfered to Cabo Delgado (a province in northern Mozambique), and returned to Maputo when he was 24, getting his job back at the Rail Company where he stayed until his retirement. He now works at a private security firm as the chief supervisor and makes around 4.500,00MT (U$155) per month, money that he uses to support his family and build his house. He is asking for a $375 loan so he can buy construction supplies (cement, iron, and other materials) to finish building his house.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy necessary things to build his house

loans.name: Assucena Avelina

texts.pt:
Assucena M. nasceu na cidade de Maputo capital de Moçambique tem 23 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 2 filhos de 4 e 1 anos de idades. Frequenta 12ª classe na Escola Secundaria Joaquim Chissano. Para alem de seus filhos vive também com a sogra e o cunhado numa casa alugada. O seu marido é funcionário do Ministério da Educação ajuda também na partilha de responsabilidade de casa.

Em 2002 sai rumo a Boane a procura de vaga escolar, onde em 2006 casa oficialmente e iniciando assim a sua careira profissional de facturação numa empresa denominada Moçambique farmas. Faz 9 horas diárias auferindo 3.300.00mt por mes. Conheceu a Hluvuku através  das mobilizações feitas e este é o seu terceiro crédito no valor de 15.000.00mt para compra de material de construção (cimento, ferro, areia e outros). Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 13.000.00mt e 4.300.00mt, todos para a mesma actividade.

Os desafios é ver a sua casa concluída, o que não é fácil devido ao alto custo de material construção, mas já com estes empréstimos paulatinamente vai atingindo o seu objectivo e vendo um dos seus maiores sonhos realizados.
Propõe se a reembolsar o valor o mais rápido possível para pedir outros empréstimos para a aquisição de mais materiais ate a conclusão.
texts.en:
Assucena M. was born in Maputo, Mozambique's capital, and she is 23 years old. She is married and has two children, a 4 and a 1 year old. She is finishing 12th grade at the Secondary School Joaquim Chissano. She lives with her husband and children, plus her mother-in-law and a brother-in-law in a rented house. Her husband works at the Secretary of Education and shares with her the household expenses. Assucena was married in 2006 and works processing invoices at a company called Mozambique Farmas. She works 9 hours a day and makes 3.300,00MT (U$ 115) per month. She's asking for U$550 to buy construction supplies. It's her third loan for the same purpose and she had no issues with paying back the other two. Assucena dreams of seeing her house finished so she can move there with her family.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction supplies

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 48 years old, married and has been blessed with three children: Maricel, 30 years old and married; Joemar, 28 years old and a computer technician; and Mary Joy, who is 14. Josephine is married to Marcelino, a farmer, and the family lives in Sillawit, Cauayan City, a semi-rural area. 

For the last 14 years, Josephine has made a living managing a genral store where she sells basic commodities, cooked foods and snacks. She earns about PHP 800 a week, and has applied for a loan for PHP 25,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. She hopes to secure her loan quickly because, as she puts it, "you live your life just once, so you should do things that are meaningful and rewarding."

loans.use: To expand a small retail store

loans.name: Isaura Silva

texts.pt:
Isaura C. nasceu na localidade de Matola Rio, um dos bairros da cidade da Matola a sul de Maputo. Tem 31 anos de idade é separada e mãe de 3 filhos com 8, 11 e 13 anos de idade, todos frequentam a escola. Vive na casa própria com mais um sobrinho orfão sob sua responsabilidade. Em 2001 parou com os seus estudos dando lugar ao seu negócio para ajudar a responder as necessidades de casa. 

Ela nunca mudou de cidade onde vive, juntou se com pai de seus filhos neste mesmo bairro, onde veio a separar se dele quando tiveram o terceiro filho.
Desde o ano de 2000 que faz o negocio de venda de roupas, em regime ambulatório, que compra na Republica da Africa do Sul. Trabalha sozinha. Aprendeu este trabalho com as amigas que juntos faziam Xitique (uma forma tradicional de poupança de fundos com outras), o seu melhor produto são Blusas. Usa cerca de 14.000.00mt na aquisição e que chega a movimentar cerca de 18.000.00mt. por mês e consegue render ate 5.000.00mt onde poupa algum no Banco comercial (Millenium Bim) e outro para o Xitique com as amigas.

Já fez empréstimos em outras instituições de crédito (FDM) mas quando terminou decidiu não continuar mais por razoes de varia ordem. Conheceu a Hluvuku através  da dona Isaura Muchisse (oficial de credito da Hluvuku-Adsema) que também foi trabalhadora (FDM).

Este é o quarto empréstimo da Isaura no valor de 14.000.00mt, para compra e venda de roupa (roupa diversa para todas idades) os outros foram de 5.500.00mt, 8.200.00mt, e 10.500.00mt todos para mesma actividades. 

Tem enfrentando alguns desafios para melhorar o seu negócio como alfandegas já que o produto adquire noutro pais assim como clientes que não pagam devidamente quando lhes dá por empréstimo.
 
No futuro gostaria de construir uma barraca e melhorar cada vez mais as condições alimentares em casa. Por isso pretende ainda pedir mais empréstimos para também concluir com a obra de construção da sua residência.
texts.en:
Isaura C. was born in Matola Rio, a neighborhood to the south of Maputo, capital of Mozambique. She is 31, divorced and has three children aged 8, 11 and 13, all of them students. She lives in her own house with her children plus a nephew who's an orphan. She dropped school in 2001 to start her clothing business and help with the household expenses. She and her husband separated after the last kid was born and she continued to sell clothes in order to support her family. She imports the clothes from South Africa and sells them in the streets of Maputo. Her best selling product are woman's blouses. Isaura can make up to 5.000,00MT (U$180) in a month with her business, an she uses the money to support the family and to buy more inventory to sell in the streets of Maputo. She has faced some hard times with clients that order in advance and won't pay her back, as well as with custom issues bringing the clothes to Mozambique, but she remains positive and looking into expanding her business. She is asking for $500 in order to buy more clothes to sell. She dreams to have her own store and to be able to better feed her kids. She also hopes to finish building her house and is planning on getting more loans in the future after she's done paying for this one.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing for reselling

loans.name: Jackielou

texts.en:
Jackielou is a hog raiser for two years. She is 24 years old and already married and blessed with a daughter.  They are living a simple life in Natappian West Solana, Cagayan. Her business has been a great help in providing the needs of their family.  

Lack of feeds supply encouraged Jackielou to ask for financial support from the KIVA lenders.  She is now asking to avail a loan of PHP5,000 that she needed to buy enough supply of feeds for her hogs. Jackielou works hard and patiently enduring all the hardship to give their children a better future. She believes that her sacrifices will someday be rewarded for them to have a progressive living.

loans.use: To purchase feeds supply

loans.name: Manuel Arnaldo

texts.pt:
Manuel nasceu em Boane um dos Distritos da província de Maputo, tem 30 anos de idade, casado, pai de 3 filhos com 6 anos, 8 anos e 9 anos de idade. Fez 5ª classe e não continuou mais porque a mãe no momento estava doente a única que sustentava os seus estudos o pai já não vivia com eles. Para alem da família sustenta a sua mãe dando lhe algum valor mensal para as suas necessidades básicas. Vive na casa própria com a sua família.

Viveu na cidade de Maputo onde saiu ainda jovem com os seus pais rumo ao Distrito de Boane, a procura de emprego. De profissão é pedreiro onde nas horas extras tem realizado alguns trabalhos de construção, mas a tempo inteiro dedica se ao comercio, (venda de bebidas alcoólicas e refrigerantes) com ajuda da sua esposa desde 1994.

Esta actividade aprendeu da mãe desde o ano de 1990. Actualmente consegue render cerca de 1.300.00mt por dia assim consegue poupar algum no final de cada mês aplica 12.000.00mt na compra e vende a 14.400.00mt, rendendo 2.400,00mt.

Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo no valor de 12.000.00mt, para compra e revende de cerveja, refrescos e vinhos aumentando assim a quantidade de produtos. Os créditos passados foram de 5.000.00mt e 7.200.00mt também para a mesma actividade. 

Os desafios que tem neste momento são a falta de estabelecimento comercial condigno para satisfazer a sua clientela.
No futuro pretende pedir mais empréstimos com intuito de aumentar o volume do negócio e bens de consumo (mobília e outros)
texts.en:
Manuel was born in Boane, a district in Maputo, capital of Mozambique. He is 30 years old, married and has three children aged 6, 8 and 9 years old. He dropped school on 5th grade because his mother was sick and his dad had left them, so he had to work to support them. He still supports his mother as well as his wife and children. He works in commerce selling alcoholic beverages and soft drinks, and also freelances as a construction worker when time allows him to. He's been doing this with the help of his wife since 1994. He makes about 2.400,00MT (U$83) per month. This is his third loan and he's asking for $450 to buy beer, wine and soft drinks, to resell them at his store. His other two loans were for the same purpose and he paid them back without a problem.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beverages for reselling

loans.name: Gretchan

texts.en:
Gretchan earns a living by making and selling cradles. Thanks to her hard work, she has been able to help her husband Melchor, a computer technician, provide for the needs of their family, especially their three-year-old son Lord Heintji. 

Gretchan is applying for a PHP 5,000 loan to expand her business by buying the supplies she needs to make more cradles. This will allow her to generate a larger income and better provide for the needs of her family, which is why she hopes and prays that this application will be funded.

loans.use: To expand a small cradle-making business

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 49 years old and married to Anastacio. They have eight children, four of them are already married. 

Wilma is selling cosmetics products within their village. She sells them house to house basis to earn a living.  Due to the demands of her customers, she is encouraged to seek of financial support from the KIVA lenders.  She hopes that she could avail a loan amounting PHP5,000 that she can use as additional capital that she can use to purchase more products that are needed by her customers.  Through her business, she was able to help her husband in meeting the needs of their family.  She is looking forward for the improvement of her business

loans.use: Additional capital for her vending activity

location.town: Rizal West, San Isidro, Santiago City

loans.name: Armando Alberto

texts.pt:
Armando Alberto M., nasceu no distrito de Boane, província de Maputo, tem 36 anos de idade, casado e pai de 04 filhos de 17, 05, 04 e 02 anos de idade, os dois primeiros vão a escola, estudou ate 4ª classe e parou de estudar por falta de condições. Para alem dos filhos sustenta também os pais que vivem com ele.

Em 1989 foi para Africa do sul afim de trabalhar e melhorar as suas condições de vida mas não foi bem sucedido, voltou no ano seguinte e instalou-se no bairro de Mahubo no distrito de Boane, onde casou-se em 1999 e construiu a sua residência onde vive com a família.

Armando é negociante permanente, tem uma banca no quintal da sua casa onde vende diversos produtos alimentares a 10 anos, aprendeu a fazer o negócio com amigos que vinham fazendo o mesmo a bastante tempo. O seu rendimento diário varia de 150,00mt a 200,00mt com o qual, e com ajuda da esposa que também e negociante ambulante, sustenta a família e consegue poupar algum para melhorar e desenvolver o seu negocio.

 Com o empréstimo de 13.000,00mt pretende investir na diversidade dos produtos e aumentar o volume de mercadorias para fazer face procura que e cada vez mais crescente e consequentemente aumentar o seu rendimento (vende bolachas, sabão, pipocas, sardinhas e outros). O seu maior sonho e de um dia poder construir uma barraca na vila de Boane.

Conheceu a hluvuku através de amigos e vizinhos e este e o seu primeiro empréstimo, nunca trabalhou com nenhuma outra instituição financeira, compromete-se a pagar bem o empréstimo para poder aceder a outros empréstimos para desenvolver mais o seu negocio e melhorar as condições de vida da família.
texts.en:
Armando Alberto M. was born in Boane, Mozambique. He is 36 years old, married and has 4 children with ages between 2 and 17. The two older ones go to school. He dropped school on 4th grade because his parents couldn't afford to support him anymore. Besides his children, he also supports his parents, and they all live together. He left for South Africa in 1989 trying to find work but he wasn't successful, so he went back to Mozambique the next year. He got married in 1999 and bought a house in Boane. He has a stand in the backyard of his house where he's been selling basic food products for the past 10 years, with the help of his wife, also a street merchant. They make around 200,00MT (U$7) per day, which they use to not only support the family, but invest in their business. He's asking for a $475 loan in order to purchase more inventory and diversify his business adding cookies, popcorn, sardines and other sought after products. He dreams to own a store in the village and improve his family's condition.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food products for reselling

loans.name: Phoeun

texts.en: The smiling face we see in this photo belongs to Mrs. Phoeun S., who earns a small income by raising pigs near her home and growing rice during the dry season. She is 30 years old, married and has two children who are in their teens. Her husband makes a living as a fisherman, and the family lives in Kampong Chhnang Province. Because raising pigs is her main hope for earning more income, S. has applied for a loan to buy piglets to feed and raise.

loans.use: To buy piglets to feed and raise

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
“Always be kind to everyone", says Eduardo Jr. of Brgy. Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. He 39 years old and still single.  He is living with his parents and helps them in sending some of his siblings to school through his business.

Farming is their main source of living.  He helps his parents to plow their farm by planting rice and some vegetables. But aside from this, he is also engaged in tricycle transport business for another source of income.  He is now asking to borrow a loan of PHP7,000 for the maintenance of his tricycle and purchased the needed agricultural supplies for their farm.  He uses his income to meet their daily needs and to support the tuition fees and allowances of his younger brother and sisters.

loans.use: Additional capital for the maintenance of his tricycle and farming needs

loans.name: Neli Antonio's Group

texts.pt:
Neli António T., nasceu na cidade de Maputo, tem 56 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 04 filhas a primeira tem 37 anos de idade e não se recorda das idades dos últimos dois, estudou ate 3ª classe do antigo sistema de ensino, parou de estudar por falta de condições, sustenta apenas três netos que vivem com ela pois todas suas filhas estão no lar.

Neli nasceu e cresceu no bairro de Choupal em Maputo e mais tarde mudou-se para o bairro de Khongolote onde fixou a sua residência e vive com os netos. 

A sua fonte de rendimento é o negocio, possui uma banca no seu quintal onde vende produtos alimentares diversos, aprendeu a fazer o negocio desde criança com a mãe pois esta fazia o mesmo tipo de negocio. O seu rendimento diário varia de 100,00mt a 1.500,00mt com o qual sustenta a família e consegue poupar algum para melhorar a sua residência.

Com o presente empréstimo de 10.000,00mt pretende comprar cimento e portas para concluir a sua obra.

Conheceu a Hluvuku de amigos, este e o primeiro empréstimo na instituição mas já trabalhou com outras instituições de crédito onde se beneficiou de empréstimos para investir no negocio.

Compromete-se a pagar o empréstimo sem problemas para poder aceder a outros empréstimos para mobilar a casa.
texts.en:
Neli António T. was born in the city of Maputo, is 56-years-old, is single, and is the mother of four daughters. The oldest is 37-years-old, and she doesn't remember the ages of the two youngest. She studied until third grade of the old school system but had to stop because of a lack of resources. She supports three grandchildren that live with her since all of her daughters live in her home. Neli was born and raised in the Choupal neighborhood in Maputo. Later on, she moved to the Khonglote neighborhood, where she established her home and lives with her grandchildren. Her source of income is her business. She has a business in her backyard where she sells various food items. She learned this business starting when she was young because her mother had the same type of business. Her daily income ranges from 100 meticais to 1,500 meticais, which she uses to support her family and to have some savings to improve her home. With her current loan of 10,000 meticais, she will buy cement and doors to finish her home. She found out about Hluvuku through friends. This is her first loan with the institution, but she has worked with other credit institutions who offered her loans to invest in her business. She promises to pay the loan back without any problems so she can receive other loans which she will use to furnish her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction material (cement, sand, doors, etc.)

loans.name: Yem

texts.en: Yem R., 28, lives in Kampong Chhnang Province, where she earns a living growing mushrooms on her farm. It takes her three months to grow a crop, which she sells for about $5 a day. She has been in this business for more than six years, so she has lots of experience. Yem R. is married and has two children, both of whom are in primaR. school. Her husband is a militaR. policeman who also helps out on their farm. Because her business has been a success, Yem R. would like to expand it. This loan will help make that expansion possible.

loans.use: To buy supplies to expand a mushroom-growing business

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie- 33 years old and married to Ariel, a welder.  They were blessed with two children: Mariel- 11 years old, grade 6 and Lady Maica- 6 years old, grade 1. They are presently residing in the village of Sillawit, Cauayan City, a semi- urban and plain area which is five to seven kilometers from the city proper of Cauayan. 

Melanie manages a village store.  She sells grocery items like fruits, vegetables and other basic commodities. Her weekly net income is PHP 1,000.00. She now wanted to avail a loan of PHP15,000.00 that she can use to purchase more stocks.  She said that "determination and self- esteem are the most important in dealing a productive business".

loans.use: Additional capital in her retail store

loans.name: Tumurkhuyag

texts.en:
Tumurkhuyag is 23 years old and lives with his wife and one-year-old child in the Arkhangai province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.

Tumurkhuyag operates a dairy retail business in his town with his wife. He purchases his dairy products from Bulgan Sum, a smaller town nearby, and sells them at the central market in his town or in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

Tumurkhyuyag began his business in 2006 with working capital of 1,000,000 tugrug (~700 USD) and since then, his working capital has grown to exceed 1,500,000 tugrug (~1050 USD). Since beginning his business, he has been able to not only provide for his young family, but he has also been able to purchase a car which helps him transport the dairy products to market.

Tumurkhuyag hopes to continue to grow his business so that he can provide for his family in the future. He is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug loan to purchase more dairy products so that he can attract even more customers in the markets.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products

loans.name: Julio Manuel

texts.pt:
Júlio G. é natural de Muecate na Província de Nampula ao Norte de Moçambique, tem 29 anos de idade, casado e pai de 2 filhos de 5 e 3 anos de idade. Para alem destes vive também com 2 sobrinhos em sua casa. Fez 4ª classe apenas. Não foi possível continuar devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos seus progenitores. 

Sai de Nampula com 19 anos, juntamente com os seus pais, devido transferência dos mesmos. Em Nampula fazia uma actividade comercial e chagado ao distrito de boane, preferiu continuar com o seu negócio que aprendera na terra natal quando tinha 12 anos de idade.

Actualmente trabalha sozinho, o seu produto favorito são chinelos onde usa 2.500.00mt na compra de 1 saco de 24 dúzias e vende a 75.00mt o par. Sapatilhas compra a 2.500.00mt a caixa de 50 pares e vende a 60 o par. Faz vendas diárias de 2.500.00mt por dia e ainda consegue poupar 350.00mt dia no Banco Barclays.      

Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 11.000.00 com qual pretende aumentar o volume da sua mercadoria (comprando mais caixas de chinelos e sapatilhas).
Nunca teve crédito em outras instituições. Conheceu esta instituição no mercado onde vende através de amigos e propõe se apagar sem problemas para poder aceder a mais créditos com intuito de comprar uma viatura para o uso pessoal.
texts.en:
Júlio G. is a native of Muecate in the province of Nampula in the northern part of Mozambique. He is 29; is married; and is the father of two children, who are 5 and 3. Additionally, two nephews or nieces live in his house. He only studied through fourth grade. It wasn't possible to continue studying because his parents lacked financial resources.

He left Nampula when he was 19 with his parents because they were transferred. In Nampula, he sold things, and when he arrived in the district of Boane, he prefered to continue with the business that he learned in his home town when he was 12.

Currently he works alone. His favorite products are flip flops. He uses 2,500 meticais to buy one bag of 24 dozen, and he sells them for 75 meticais a pair. He buys slippers for 2,500 meticais for a box of 50 pairs and sells then for 60 meticais a pair. He makes daily sales of 2,500 meticais and he still manages to save 350 meticais a day in the Barclays bank.

This is his first loan with Hluvuku, and it is for 11,000 meticais. He will use it to increase his merchandise (he will buy more boxes of flip flops and slippers).

He has never had a credit with another institution. He found out about this institution through friends in the market where he sells. He promises to repay the loan without any problems so he will be able to receive more credits, which he will use to buy a vehicle for personal use.

Translated from Portuguese by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell slippers and flip flops

loans.name: Sigara Group

texts.en:
Gidion E., age 23, is single, but he cares for his younger brother who is 21 and his older brother’s son who is 18.

Gidion sells new clothes in a market in the Mbezi area of Dar es Salaam. He has a small shop and also sells from door to door. He started this business three years ago and works daily from 9 a.m. until 6 p.m. He is able to make a monthly profit of $229.

This will be Gidion’s 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He hopes to buy more clothes with the loan in order to increase his profits.
	
Gidion will share this loan with his loan group, Sigara, which totals fifteen members. In the photo, Gidion is first on the right in the back row.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida S. is 53 years old and is a resident of Barangay Calamagui in San Pablo, Isabela. She has 2 children, both of whom are already married. Charry Ann is 30 years old and a college graduate, and Paul is 28 years old but unfortunately was not able to finish college. Aida now has grandchildren, and she is very happy to take care of them. She also manages a hog raising business which serves as their primary source of income. 

Aida makes a living by raising pigs and selling them when they are fully grown. The pigs are raised in a small piggery next to her house. She also grows vegetables in her garden which provide her with food as well as another source of income. Due to financial difficulty, Aida wants to ask for a loan from Kiva lenders in the amount of PHP 5,000 that will be used to buy all of the feed and supplies needed to raise her hogs for 4 months prior to selling them.

loans.use: Additional business capital for her hog raising business

loans.name: Mrs. Rurs Pork Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan which consists of fifteen people is located in Angk village in Kandal province. Mrs. Rurs P. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns 0,5-hectar to cultivate rice to earn for living. Her husband, Mr. Chhin Sipha, also helps her in the plantation. Although this couple tries to work hard, they still earn less income to support the family so Mrs. Rurs P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding and she hopes to increase her income after she sells the cow. Mrs. Rurs P. is 35 years old and the mother of five children two of whom are working in a garment factory while other two are attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is on the age of four years old. 

Thirteen members in this village bank loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding and she hopes to increase her income after she sells the cow.

loans.name: Tseveldorj

texts.en: M. Tseveldorj is 61 years old and lives with her husband in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her husband are both retired and live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Tseveldorj currently operates a clothing trade business in her town to support herself in retirement. She started her business in 2006 with a working capital of 500,000 tugrugs. She has found success in her new trade and attributes this to her good business knowledge and selling skills. Tseveldorj is very hard working and is very persistent in achieving her goals. She says, "My business is continuing quite well and someday I hope it will be managed by my grandchild." She is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for her business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is now 44 years old and she is married to Virgilio. Erlinda is making cradle then sells them in their village in the village of Angoluan, Echague, Isabela. The couple were blessed with six children:Gerald-24 years old, college under graduate;Marvin-21 years old, college student; Everlyn-20 years old, college graduate;Roosebelt-18 years old, high school student;Michelle-13 years old, high school student and Mary Jane-15 years old high school student also

Her business needs to improve in order to become successful. With this, she is now borrowing a loan of PHP5,000.  The loan will be of great help in purchasing threads she needed in weaving.  She hopes that through her business she can continue to send their children to school.

loans.use: additional capital for business development

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Pen C. was born in 1959; she has been established her own small family in the area of Kampong Chhnang Province, about ninety kilometers from Phnom Penh, where she earns a living as a grocer. Since the beginning 2007, she sells lunch to students at the local public high school for a profit. She is a widowed mother blessed with four children; two of whom are married and the remainders are attending school. Pen C. will be used her first loan to enlarge her successful business.

loans.use: To enlarge her successful business

loans.name: Parachichi Group

texts.en:
Christina M. is a widow with three daughters. They are 23, 21, and 16 years old. Christina has a small restaurant where she sells rice, meat, “mishkaki,” “chipsi mayai” and other Tanzanian dishes. She opened the business five years ago and works from 5 am until 6 pm every day. She manages to make a monthly profit of $183, which she saves in case of family emergencies.

This is Christina’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She says she looks up to other women in her area who have larger businesses and wants to use this loan to rejuvenate her restaurant. She will buy glasses, cooking utensils, and more food such as vegetables, rice, and soda.

Christina will share this loan with her loan group, Parachichi, which means “avocado” in Swahili. The group has 18 members. Many of the group have small restaurants like Christina, but some of them have salons, tailoring shops, fish stands, and produce shops. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans. In the picture, Christina is 2nd from the right in the first row.

loans.use: Glasses and cups, cooking utensils, food stock

loans.name: Mrs. Thavy Meng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nine people who live in Angk village in Kandal province made up the village bank loan and they will use the loan which they obtained in different purposes. Mrs. Thavy M. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns 0,6-hectar to cultivate rice for a living. In this farming, she now faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to buy more fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers for her purpose. Her husband, Mr. Arn Seourn, also helps her in the farming. Mrs. Thavy M. is 27 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study because that child is on the age of four years old. A man who is presented in the photo is a group guarantee; he also shown in the picture with the village bank loan.

Two members in this village bank loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows tH. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Rovelyn

texts.en:
Rovelyn is engaged in the hog raising business in their village in Bagnos, Aurora, Isabela. She is 30 years old and gifted with one child.  She is doing her best to help her husband in supporting their daily needs.  

She wanted to maintain her hog raising business.  For this, she is borrowing a loan of PHP5,000 that she can use to purchase more stocks of feeds for her hogs.  She also wanted to expand her business for them to have a bigger income.

loans.use: For the maintenance of her pigs

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is managing a hog raising business. She wants a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP5,000 for the maintenance of her livestock business.  She is 54 years old and already a widow. She solely provides for the family's needs at home through her income and managing their farm in their village.  

She is very determined to provide the needs of her family towards the improvement of her hog raising business. She hopes that lenders will provide her financial help so that someday, she will also give her niece a good future by continuously sending her to school.

loans.use: Additional capital for her hog raising business

loans.name: Mrs. Sok Houn Hok Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan group that consists of 11 people is located in Angk village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sok Houn H. is the village bank president wH. has been selected by the members. She owns a two-hectare field to cultivate rice to earn a living. On the plantation, she has a problem because her field has infertile soil so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Nguon Sbai, is a farmer. Mrs. Sok Houn H. is 35 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one just four years old. 

One member in this village bank loan has an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. This member is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers

loans.name: Nhey

texts.en: Mrs. Nhey V. is a villager in Thol Louk village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 2-hectar field to cultivate rice to earn for living. Aside from this she is a pig breeder. Since the second business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets and pig food for her business. Her husband, Mr. Ten Cheng, is a farmer and he also helps her on the businesses. Mrs. Nhey V. is 59 years old and the mother of two children two of whom are employed in a garment factory. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more piglets and pig food for her business.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
