Maribel has been managing her village store for five years.  However, her store was temporarily closed due to lack of capital.  This is the reason why she is now asking for financial support from the KIVA lenders to lend her a loan of PHP5,000.  She will use the loan to purchase different commodities like canned goods, biscuits, toiletries and other basic commodities that are very in demand in their village.  With her business, she believes that she can help her husband in supporting the needs of their children.  

Maribel is 33 years old, married and blessed with three children.

loans.use: Additional capital to continue her business

loans.name: Savy

texts.en: Mrs. Savy P. is a farmer in Roluos village in Takeo province. In this farming, she now faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to buy fertilizers to make her crop more productive thus she decided to ask for a loan for her purpose. Her husband, Mr. Ngoeng Bros, is a farmer who helps his wife on the farming. Mrs. Savy P. is 26 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or study because those children are on the age of 1 and 2 years old. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Nim

texts.en: Mrs. Nim C. is a villager in Russey Srok village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Since this business is going well wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets and pig food to support her pigs. Her husband, Mr. Chun Vin, is a farmer who owns 0,4-hectar to cultivate rice. Mrs. Nim C. is 47 years old and the mother of three children two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the youngest one is attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more piglets and pig food to support her pigs.

loans.name: Chroeun

texts.en: Mrs. Chroeun S. lives in Mea Neak village in Takeo province. She owns five hectares to cultivate rice to earn a living. On this farm, she now faces a problem because she does not have enough money to buy rice seeds for cultivating so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice seeds. Her husband, Mr. Khuon Theoun, is a horse driver who makes a small income to support the family. Mrs. Chroeun S. is 28 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom attend the local school and the other is just eight months old. Her husband is presented on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more rice seeds

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
“Nothing is impossible if you have strong faith and determination to achieve your goal,” says Sharon A. of Brgy. Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is already a widow and left with their three children: The eldest is six years old while the youngest is 7 months old.  It is difficult on her part to provide all the needs of her children. She is just glad that her parents are supporting her with their needs. 

Sharon operates a tricycle as a source of income.  Aside from this, she is also engaged in a hog raising business and plants some vegetables to earn additional income. She is now asking to borrow a loan of PHP 12,000.00 to be used in her small businesses.  She plans to use the loan for the maintenance of her tricycle, for her piggery and for her vegetable production business.

loans.use: Additional capital for the maintenance of her businesses

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en: Mrs. Chanthou N. is a villager in Mea Neak village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 7-hectare field to cultivate rice for a living. On this farm, she faces a problem because she does not have enough equipment to plow the field so she decided to ask for a loan to buy an electric cow to plow the field. She will also rent it to other villagers to earn more profit. Her husband, Mr. Put Sek, is a vice village chief in the local village and he also helps his wife on the farm. Mrs. Chanthou N. is 30 years old and the mother of three children who all attend the local school. Her husband is shown with her on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy an electric cow to plow the field.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: K., 49, is a married man and the father of three teenage children. One of his daughters is working in garment factory, while other two are students. K. currently works in construction; he is also hired by people to build their house. His wife stays at home to be responsible for a daily routine. She also cultivates a rice crop. K. is taking out his loan to buy a cow which enable him allow to his wife for using on the farm field. K.'s wife is shown in the picture above.

loans.use: To buy a cow which enable him allow to his wife for using on the farm field

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en: Mrs. Sarin V. is a farmer in Mea Neak village in Takeo province. She owns 9-hectar for cultivating rice. In her farming, she now faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to buy rice seeds to cultivate rice so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice seeds for her purpose and she would use the rest of the loan to a pump in order to water her rice crop. Her husband, Mr. Ngaet Ly, helps her in the farming. Mrs. Sarin V. is 44 years old and the mother of three children one of whom sells café in the local village while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is shown with her on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more rice seeds for cultivating.

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en: Mrs. Saroeun M. is a villager in Mea Neak village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who own 2-hectar field to cultivate rice. In this farming, she now faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to buy rice seeds for cultivating so she decided to ask for a loan to buy them for the purpose and she will use the rest of the loan to buy a pump to water the crop.  Mrs. Saroeun M. is 53 years old and a widow with four children three of whom helps their mother in farming while the other is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds for cultivating.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en:
"Achieving success in life is not that easy due to the challenges that one may encounter", says Genoveva V.. She is a store owner in their village while her husband is engaged in the farming business.  The couple were blessed with seven children and two are already married.  Her five children who are single are: Rowena-20 years old, high school graduate; Genaro Jr.-18 years old; Reylyn-15 years old; Randy-8 years old grade-IV and Regine-4 years old.

Genoveva is 36 years old.  She manages her store and at the same time she also sells milk fish.  She is thankful because her business is improving.  She hopes that she could avail a loan from the KIVA amounting PHP5,000. She will use the loan to purchase additional milk fish and other merchandise for her store.

loans.use: To purchase milk fish and merchandise for her store

loans.name: Horn

texts.en:
Mrs. Horn Y. is a farmer in Mea Neak village in Takeo province. Since it is the rainy season, she needs to cultivate rice but she does not have enough money to buy rice seed so she decided to ask for a loan. She will use the rest of the loan to buy a fishnet and a boat for her husband, Mr. Chor Meourn, who is a fisherman.

Mrs. Horn Y. is 31 years old and the mother of two children who are both attending the local school. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and also a fishnet and boat for her husband

loans.name: Noeme

texts.en:
Noeme is 29 years old, married and not yet blessed with a child. She is engaged in the sari-sari store business (community based store) for four years. Her goal is to expand her business to have extra income to help his husband.

She would like her business tog grow so she is asking to avail a loan of PHP5,000.  The loan will be used to purchase different commodities for her store to meet the demands of her customers.  She hopes that the lenders will grant her loan request.

loans.use: To buy more stocks

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en: S., age 28, has been farming since she was single, a skill she learned from her mother. She is married to Phoeun, 33 years old, who is a palm climber. With the palm climbing, he can tap palm juice from palm trees, boiling it to make palm sugar or turning it into palm wine for sale. This couple lives with two teenage children in the family home. S. has been growth her crop for along time, but it is not growing well, so she is applying for a loan to purchase fertilizer to fatten her crop yield.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to fatten her crop yield

loans.name: Srey Da

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Da O. is a villager in Mea Neak village in Takeo province. She is a rice wine maker in the local village. Since this business is going well, she wants to buy more equipment to produce a better rice wine for her customers. She would use the rest of the loan to buy fishnets and boat for her husband, Mr. Tum Sareourn, who is a fisherman. Mrs. Srey Da O. is 20 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more equipment to produce a better rice wine for her customers.

loans.name: Na

texts.en: Mrs. Na L. lives in Kampong Chrey village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she makes cake to sell to earn income. She is 49 years old widow with two children, one of whom is employed while the other is attending the local school. Now Mrs. Na L. is requesting a loan to buy five piglets and pig food for breeding pigs business. She hopes to increase income and improve the family living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy five piglets and pig food for breeding pigs business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 48 years old and married to Rex Dexter, a farmer. They have three children: John Rex Lester, 21 years old and a nursing graduate;  Mark, 15 years old and a fourth year high school student; and Pinky, 13 years old, and a 3rd year high school student. They are living in Salay, Angadanan, Isabela.

She has managed a typical retail store in their village for almost ten years and her weekly income is PHP300.00.  She plans to borrow a loan amount of PHP 11,000.00 from KIVA lenders for additional capital. One of their sources of income is hog-raising. She works hard for the education of their children and to support her husband financially. She said that "God provides all what we ask for, just have faith on Him, Nothing is impossible."

loans.use: Additional capital for her retail store

loans.name: Sovann

texts.en:
Mrs. Sovann S. is a villager in Kampong Chrey village in Takeo province. She is farmer who owns a plot of land which she uses to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she is a Khmer noodle seller.

Mrs. Sovann S. is a 50-year-old widow with five children, three of whom are employed in different positions while the others are enrolled in the local school. Although Mrs. Sovann S.’s family members try to work hard to earn income, they still earn less income than needed to support the family living. Thus, Mrs. Sovann S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira manages a van transport business from Santiago to Tuguegarao City. Aside from this, she also sells cosmetic  products in their village in Villa Magat, San Mateo,Isabela. Her husband drives their van transportation business while she manage her cosmetic products.  

She wanted to seek for financial assistance from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP5, 000 that will be utilized for the maintenance of their van transport and to have added capital for her selling business in order to cope up with the difficulties of life. This amount of loan she is requesting will serve a big help most especially in sustaining the needs of her family.

loans.use: Additional capital for the maintenance of their van trasnport business

loans.name: Samai

texts.en: Mrs. Samai B. lives in Prey Choeur Teal village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. She is also a grocer who owns a small grocery store. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more grocery products to resell to earn more profits. Her husband, Mr. Seng Bunthern, is a taxi driver. This couple has a child who is too young to work or study.  Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more grocery products to resell to earn more profits.

loans.name: Yom

texts.en:
Mrs. Yom O. is a villager in Prey Choeur Teal village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Aum Khum, are farmers who own a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) field which they use to cultivate both rice and vegetables to earn a living.

In this work, they face an obstacle because their field is far from the irrigation system. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Yom O. decided to ask for a loan to buy a pump to pump water to support her field.

Mrs. Yom O. is 50 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other stays at home to do housework. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a pump to irrigate her field

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en: Mr. Sorn B. is a villager in Krang Roung village in Takeo province. He is an ice-cream seller. His wife, Mrs. Khat Heang, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she needs a pump machine to pump water to support the rice field. Thus, Mr. Sorn B. decided to ask for a loan for his wife’s purpose. He is 42 years old and the father of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school and the other is too young to work or study. His wife is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a pump machine to pump water to support the rice field.

loans.name: Benielyn

texts.en:
Benielyn works as a manicurist in her village in Addalam Jones, Isabela. She is married to Elison, a farmer.  They were gifted with four children: Jazzrel, 12 years old; Krisca, 10 years old; Mark Acon, 2 years old; and the youngest, Benson Jay, 6 months old.

Benielyn would like to buy a new manicure and pedicure kit that she can use in the business.  She usually offers home service by going house to house to offer her service.   With this, she is able to support their daily needs.  She is asking to borrow a loan of PHP 5,000 that she needs to buy a nipper, nail polish and other materials needed in her daily routine.

loans.use: To purchase a new manicure and pedicure kit

loans.name: Tum

texts.en: Mr. Tum M. is a villager in Prey Choeur Teal village in Takeo province. He and his wife, Mrs. Neang Vuth, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn for living. In this plantation, they can earn less income to support their household. Thus, Mr. Tum M. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike to be motorbike taxi driver. He is 46 years old and the father of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school. His wife is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a motorbike to be motorbike taxi driver.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
28-year-old Juvy Baustista is a new member of ASHI. Because of her membership, she had an opportunity to request for a loan which she will be using for stating up her own business. Juvy thought of maximizing the product most produced in their municipality for her business to help people in marketing. Thus, loan she requests will be used as a starting capital for her rice buy and sell business.  Profit of this business will be a great source of income for the family and great means to augment the small income of her husband being a delivery boy. 

Juvy hoped that through loans she can request through ASHI, she will be able to grow her business and increase her profit thus enabling her to send all of her two children whose age range is from nine months to four years old until graduating from college.

loans.use: Will be used to pay for purchasing rice for a rice buy and sell business.

loans.name: Voeurn

texts.en: Mr. Voeurn N. was born in 1985 and he lives in Krang Roung village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. Sam Navy, is grocer. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more grocery products to resell to earn more profits. Thus, Mr. Voeurn N. decided to request for a loan for his wife’s purpose. He has a child who is too young to work or study. His wife is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To request for a loan to buy more grocery products to resell to earn more profits.

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
Mr. Tha C. lives in Kdey Thnaut village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he cultivates rice. His wife, Mrs. Seat Ny, is a pig breeder.

Although this couple tries to work hard, they still earn less income than needed to support the family living. In order to improve their living, Mr. Tha C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike and an ice box to start an ice-cream business.

Mr. Tha C. is 29 years old and the father of two children who are attending the local school. His wife is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike and an ice box to start an ice-cream business

loans.name: Florepes

texts.en:
Florepes O. is a new member of ASHI aspiring to bring her family out of poverty by having a strong economic base. She has ten children to raise and nurture, therefore making her aspiration real. She needs a productive role to be able to augment her husband’s income as a farm laborer.

Through the loan Florepes is requesting now, she will be starting up a rice buy-and-sell business. Rice is the most common product of their town; therefore, it would be helpful to the people and to the municipality’s economy if she becomes a means to market it.

The profit she will be making from her business will be used to support the daily needs of her children. She hopes that, someday, she will be able to grow her business and be able to send all of her children to college until graduation.

loans.use: To buy rice for her rice-selling business

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroeun N. is 34 years old and she lives in Trapaing Rom Pak village in Takeo province. She is farmer who owns a plot of land she uses to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Keng Arn, is a cow middleman. Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Saroeun N. decided to ask for a loan to buy two more cows for her husband’s business.

Mrs. Saroeun N. is the mother of three children who are attending the local school. In the photo, her husband is shown with her on the left.

loans.use: To buy two more cows for her husband's business

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma C., a 50-year-old widow, is requesting her second loan through ASHI which she will use to grow her business of buying and selling rice. This enterprise has great potential to help her achieve her family's goals, the most important one being having her children, currently ranging in age from 7 to 15,  graduate from college and never experience the life of poverty she has endured since her husband's death.  Through the profits of her business, Norma also hopes that someday she will build a house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase rice for the business.

loans.name: Sinoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Sinoeurn P. lives 27 years old single and she lives in Mean Neak village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn for living. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because she does not have rice seed to grow on the field. Thus, Mrs. Sinoeurn P. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy rice seed to grow on the field.

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Even at her age of 56 years old, Monina M. still dreams of living in a beautiful house along with her 22-year-old only daughter, Girley.

To be able to achieve her dreams in life, Monina joined ASHI because she wanted to put up a business which will be her source of income. Her daughter who is just a high school graduate will be her partner in running her business since her husband passed away a long time ago.

The loan Monina requested through ASHI is her only hope in achieving her dreams through a rice buy-and-sell business she is going to start up. With this business, she would have money to buy their food and other basic needs every day. Her child could also earn money by helping her.

loans.use: To buy rice for her rice-selling business

loans.name: Ma. Cristina

texts.en:
Ma. Cristina is 44 years old and is married to Marcelo, a fireman. They are blessed with four children: Renato - 22 years old; Raul - 21 years old; Teresita - 20 years old; and Beverly - 16 years old. They are all at college level. The family reside in Salay, Angadanan, Isabela.

Ma. Cristina is a tricycle operator and her weekly net income is PHP 500. She plans to obtain a loan of PHP 11,000 from Kiva lenders that will be used for the repair and maintenance of her motorcycle. She is also engaged in a farming and hog-raising business.

loans.use: To repair her motorcycle

loans.name: Rum

texts.en:
Mr. Rum N. is 32 years old and he lives in Mean Neak village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns 4-hectare (10-acre) field of land he uses to cultivate rice. In this plantation, he needs some money to buy rice seed and to hire an electric cow (a machine that pulls a plough and runs on fuel) to plow the field.

Mr. Rum N. is a father of two children, one of whom is attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. His wife, Mrs. Khan Sophea, who is presented on the left in the photo, is a duck breeder who sells duck eggs.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and to hire an electric cow to plow his field

loans.name: Uch

texts.en: Uch B., 50 years old, who is the good father blessed with five children. Uch B. earns a living as a domestic construction worker; he is always hired by people to build their new house. His wife’s name is Mrs. Ouch Ny, 52, who is a rice farmer, and who appears in the picture over. She also books the neighbor’s rice crop and she will harvest and sell them when they are matured. Uch B. requests a loan for his wife to use as capital in order to book more rice crop from other farmers.

loans.use: To use as capital in order to book more rice crop from other farmers

loans.name: Gorretti

texts.en:
N. Gorretti is thirty-two years old, is married with two children schooling, and has two dependents schooling, too.

Gorretti has operated a drug store selling medicines for over six years. She is using the loan to purchase various medicines to sell to her customers.

Gorretti is self-reliant and hardworking, and looking forward to stocking enough medicines to at least meet her customers’ demands. Her future hope is to construct rental houses for generating monthly income.

loans.use: To purchase various medicines for her pharmacy

loans.name: Madonna Gale

texts.en:
Madonna Gale is running her own village store located in Calamagui, San Pablo, Isabela. She is 34 years old and married to Marvin, a farmer in their village.  They are blessed with one child named Maria Christine.  

Madonna opens her store everyday.  She opens it very early in the morning and closes around 9:00 in the evening.  Her income from the business is utilized as revolving capital to maintain her store and somehow sustain it for stability. In this regard, Madonna wanted to ask for a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP10, 000 that will be used in purchasing stocks of merchandise to retail in her store. With the amount she is requesting to avail, Madonna believes that this will be a good start towards the fulfillment of her business goals someday.

loans.use: Additional capital for her geneal store business

loans.name: Cristiline

texts.en:
“Sacrifice and patience is necessary in order to achieve success in life,” said Cristiline. She is thankful because she has been blessed with four children: Virgiline - 19 years old, a college student; Cristine - 18 years old, also a college student; Princess - 15 years old, a high school student; and the youngest is Crichelle - 3 years old.

Cristiline is hoping that her children will all finish their studies. Her income from her business is carefully budgeted to meet the educational needs of her three children. Her husband is working abroad as an Overseas Filipino Workers or OFW.

Cristiline is engaged in a weaving business. However, her income is not enough to meet all their needs so she is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 from Kiva lenders to further improve her business and enable her to purchase materials needed for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed for weaving

loans.name: Mout's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is being requested by four borrowers, all of whom live in Chong Kneas Commune in Siem Reap Province. The group leader, Mrs. Mout S., age 67, makes a living selling fresh fish in the market. She retails her fish that she buys in bulk on credit from her wholesale supplier or fishermen. She also return her income when she fish selling. Mout S. is a widowed woman and the good mother of two children; one of whom is married and has ready started new home, while other one drives a fish boat. Mout S. is taking out her loan to accumulate the quantity of fresh fish to sell to raise income. The other three borrowers who have jointly taking this loan as following:
C. will be used her loan to enlarge her selling fish business.
T. is looking for a loan to finish building her new house.
S., a fisherman, who is asking for a loan to buy more nets and traps.(S. was not available for a photo, so his wife is shown instead).

loans.use: To accumulate the quantity of fresh fish to sell to raise income

loans.name: Legaspi

texts.en:
Legaspi is 29 years old and married to Irene.  They have a daughter named Arlene, five months old. Their family is living a simple life in the village of Salay, Angadanan, Isabela together with her parents and some siblings.  

Legaspi is a tricycle operator and driver.  He earns a weekly net income of PHP 500.00-600.00. He would like to ask for financial support from the KIVA lenders to borrow a loan of PHP 5,000.00. This will be of great help for the repair and maintenance of his motorcycle. Being a good father and husband, he works hard for the sake of his family. Diligence and patience are his foundation to reach his goal.

loans.use: For the repair and maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Kikawula Kamwanyi Nantale Florence Group

texts.en: N. Florence is the group loan president. She is 30 years old, married with three children in school and one sibling whom she is taking care of. She has sold fuel, mostly diesel, for almost two years. She is using the loan to purchase fuel in much larger quanities so that she can supply to more customers for more profits. For sure, the stocking of fuel will increase because of the additional capital. She is a hardworking business lady who is determined to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase fuel for resale

loans.name: Kikawula E Immaculate Tebuseke Group

texts.en: Immaculate T. is 30 years old, married with four children and two dependents, all in school. She has a retail shop that she has been operating for 12 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase retail shop items such as bags of sugar, salt, soap, paraffin and so forth for at least her business expansion. She is so much aspiring to prosper in life.

loans.use: To purchase retail shop items

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Maricel is 50 years old and she is managing a sari-sari store (community based store) in their village for almost seven years.  She plans to expand her business by borrowing a loan from the KIVA lenders amounting to PHP10,000.  The loan will be used to buy different grocery items and fruits for her store.  She hopes that the loan will be granted for her to pursue her business plans.  

Her husband is a farmer and they were blessed with four children: Nancy- 21 years old, accounting graduate; Nolita- 19 years old, 3rd year college; Ofelia- 17 years old, a pastor, and their youngest is Arlene- 15 years old, 4th year high school student. They are residing in Sillawit, Cauayan City, a semi- urban and plain area.

loans.use: Additional Capital in her Retail Store

loans.name: Besilia

texts.en:
Besilia is from the village of Calamagui San Pablo, Isabela. She is married to Romeo, a mechanic in their village and they have six children. Their youngest is already 16 years old and still studying. Besilia is hoping that their youngest will finish her study since her five children did not finish their studies.  

Besilia is helping to maintain their vulcanizing shop business.  Aside from that, she also manages a hog raising business for extra income.  For them to pursue their two businesses, she is now asking for a loan from the KIVA lenders of PHP 7,000.  With this amount, they will have the support needed for their business.

loans.use: Additional capital for their vulcanizing shop business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
“Wise use of capital and patience is needed in managing a business,” said Maria R.. Maria is thankful because she can see improvement in her store.  She wants her store to become profitable so she is asking for financial support from the KIVA lenders for a loan of PHP 5,000.00.  She will use the loan to purchase different commodities for her store. 

She is happily married to Rogelio, a farmer.  Her family is living in the beautiful village of Addalam Jones Isabela. The couple is thankful because they were blessed with five children: Khristian, 21 years old; Kathereine, 19 years old and still studying; Furtune Rea, 17 years old; Sharmain, 13 years old and Shalynne, 13 years old. The couple is striving hard to sustain the needs of their children, most especially their education.

loans.use: Additional capital for business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marben

texts.en: Marben is married to Rose and they were gifted with a daughter named Marrian-7 days old. Marben is a maker of stove made of cement and some of it was made of can.  According to him, he would like to continue improving and developing it so he can encourage more costumer to buy his product.  With this, he is asking to avail a loan amounting to PHP5,000 from the KIVA lenders.  The amount will be used to buy the necessary materials she needed in making stove.

loans.use: Additional capital for business development

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: P. is 53 years old and lives in Phnom Penh. She owns a few rental rooms that she rents out to people who need to relax on their work. Most of her guests are employed in garment factor. P. also works preparing room for a hotel. P. has five children: one is a student and other four are married and live separately. Her husband who appears in the photo, who is the one management of her business. P. would like a loan to buy a motor to make easier family's commuting to anywhere. This will allow this family to cut a taxi cost.

loans.use: To buy a motor to make easier family's commuting to anywhere

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Vending of vegetables is the business of Lilia B.. She used to roam around their village to sell her vegetables.  Lilia is happily married to Damian and they were blessed with six children: Francis-23 years old;Randy-22 years old; Richard-21 years old still studying; Bernardo-19 years old; Ariel-16 years old still studying;Rhialyn-10 years old. 

Lilia would like to buy additional vegetables to further improve their way of living and to be able to support the needs of their children.  According to her, the income she generate from her business is not enough so she is asking for financial assistance from the lenders.  She would like to avail a loan of PHP5,000.  This will be used to purchase more vegetables that she will sell.

loans.use: Additional capital for vending acitvity

loans.name: Baltazara

texts.en:
Baltazara L. is a new member of ASHI. Along with her four children, whose ages range is from 9 to 29 years old, and her 55-year-old husband, she lives in a municipality surrounded with wide verdant rice fields. The majority of people’s economic resources in their place comes through rice farming. This includes Baltazara’s husband and two eldest children who are farm laborers.

Poor people like Baltazara and her husband do not have their own rice field to farm. Instead, some of them opt to rent wealthy people’s farmland, a process which, in Antique province, is called “ariendo”. Ariendo is a system wherein poor people using wealthy people’s farmland give cavans (sacks) of rice to the owner every harvest in payment. The amount depends on the agreement between both parties.

Baltazara wishes to have her own land to farm someday on which her husband and her two sons will work. To start reaching that goal, she has no other choice for now but to continue to involve herself in the common practice of ariendo. The loan she is requesting will be used to start up this business for her family to be able to augment the income of her husband and two sons. With her loan assisting her farming business, someday she will be able to buy land of her own to farm.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs for her rice-farming business

loans.name: Kawuku Namaweje Christine Group

texts.en:
N. Christine is twenty-four years old and married with five children of whom three are schooling.

Christine’s business, which she has been operating for ten years now, has always been dealing in cash crops: that is, selling coffee. She is requesting the loan to purchase more coffee: at least fifteen to twenty bags of coffee for more profit return.

Christine has a coffee plantation and on top of that she purchases coffee from other farmers to stock for sale. She is sure that, with adding capital to her business, and with more effort, it will expand. She dreams of purchasing a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase more coffee to sell

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is sixty – two years old. He is married and has give birth to seven children, all in school. He lives with his wife and some of her children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. Edward is a herbalist. He prepares all kinds of concoctions and from leaves, roots and tree barks. Edward supplies to local drug stores and also treks to nearby communities to sell. He has been in business for over twenty years. He wants a loan to buy herbs and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy herb

loans.name: Akyedi Pa Group

texts.en:
Dora is forty-five years old. She is married and has give birth to seven children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa, a commercial and farming town in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana.

Dora is a food vendor and the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Akyedi Pa’, meaning Perfect Gift. The group members are engaged either in farming or trading activities ns sell in their local market and nearby communities. They sometimes trek to nearby community markets, too. Some of the group members, however, also render services such as sewing, tailoring, hairdressing, etc. They want a loan to buy goods and materials in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy stock for her business

loans.name: Nakazadde A Nakayima Norah Group

texts.en: N. Norah is thirty-two years of age, married with four children going to school, and has two orphans that she is looking after. She has been operating a banana business for over six years now. She is requesting the loan to increase her business stock, that is, add capital to her business. She is a hard-working business woman whose target is purchasing many bunches of bananas, at least 100 and more bunches of bananas because the demand for bananas (matooke) always becomes high in this festive season. She wishes to prosper and to educate her children.

loans.use: purchasing at least 100 and more bunches of banana

loans.name: Liberty Group

texts.en:
Agnes is thirty years old. She is divorced and has given birth to one child who is in school. She lives with her son in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town.

Agnes is a business woman and the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Liberty’. The group members are engaged either in farming and/or commercial activities. They sell/supply in their local market and nearby communities. They sometimes trek to nearby community markets. Some of the group members, however, also render services such as sewing/tailoring, hairdressing, etc. They want a loan to buy goods and materials in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy additional stock

loans.name: Nakazade A Muwonge Sarah Group

texts.en: M. Sarah is the president of Nakazadde A group loan. She is fifty years of age and a widow. She is blessed with six children and more so has one sibling who is going to school. She is a tailor and she has been operating her tailoring services since the year 1990. She is requesting for the loan to purchase more material clothing’s for making clothes; she makes good designing for sale that is dresses, shirts, suits, etc. She wishes to boost her business mostly that now she is targeting Christmas season where people buy more and more clothes for the festive season. Her future plan is to work very hard and construct a house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more material clothing’s for making clothes; she makes good designing for sale.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is fifty years old. She is widowed and has given birth to five children, all in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town.

Hannah is a business woman. She prepares and sells palm oil. Hannah supplies to retailers and also treks to nearby communities to sell her goods. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy palm nuts in bulk.

loans.use: To buy palm fruits

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is thirty – two years old. She is married and has give birth to three children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. Agnes is a trader. She trades in foot wears. She buys all kinds of foot wears from Kumasi. She hawks to sell in her community and also treks to nearby communities to sell. Agnes has been in business for two years. She wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy foot wears

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is thirty – three years old. She is married and has give birth to four children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. Janet is a trader. She trades in second hand clothes. She buys her goods from Sunyani. Janet hawks to sell in her community and also treks to nearby communities to sell. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy second hand clothes

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
Mrs. Mon M., 39, and her husband, Mr. Sengkry Teng, 45, married in 1993 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. Two of them stay at home, one is in school and another one is still young. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Mon has been a silk weaver for almost 20 years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. Her husband has been a construction worker for over 10 years. He works in his village.

Mon is requesting a loan of US$ 600 in order to build pillars on her house and purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To build pillars of her house and buy silk materials for her silk weaving business

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is twenty – eight years old. She is married and has give birth to four children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. Doris is a trader. She runs a provision store. She buys from Kumasi and sells in a shop by the road side. Doris has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy provision

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is fifty-one years old. She is married and has given birth to eight children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town.

Adwoa is a business woman. She sells bags of maize. She buys the maize from nearby towns and supplies it to food vendors in her community. Adwoa has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina is forty – six years old. She is divorced and has give birth to four children, all in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. Paulina is a trader. She trades in meat. She buys from Kumasi and supplies to food vendors in her community. Paulina also treks to nearby communities to sell. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy meat

loans.name: Mavlyuda

texts.en:
Mavlyuda is divorced with two children. She sells women’s clothing in the market. She originally started as a small market vendor. Today Mavlyuda offers a wide variety of prices and merchandise. She has been in business for 14 years. Mavlyuda would like to increase assorted merchandise in her vending facility. She is hoping to continue working in this sphere and generate additional income. That is why she is requesting a loan of 2400 USD.

Mavlyuda’s business is the only source of income for her family. She is trying hard to earn enough to pay for her children’s education and finish the reconstruction of her private house. We believe timely financial assistance will keep Mavlyuda’s business stable and her family well provided for.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing working capital

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Philomena is forty years old. She is married and has give birth to four children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. Philomena is a trader. She trades in plantain. She buys from nearby towns and supplies to food vendors and retailers in her community. Philomena also treks to nearby communities to sell. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy plantain

loans.name: Nasimkhon

texts.en:
F. Nasimkhon is 44 years old. He lives in Isfara town. He is married and has 4 children. Nasimkhon processes and sells dried apricots in the central local market. He is experienced in the business of making dried apricots. He purchases dried fruits in the market and processes them together with the help of his wife and his sons.

Because he buys dried apricots wholesale, Nasimkhon's prices are lower than regular market prices. He offers a wide assortment of goods for customers of different means. All this allows Nasimkhon to make his business quite successful and it brings in a stable income for the family.

Today Nasimkhon requests 1300 USD for purchasing dried apricots to process and sell. Nasimkhon expresses his gratitude for everyone supporting him.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: purchasing more dried apricots to process and sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is twenty-three years old. She is single and has given birth to one child and is in school. She lives with her child in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town.

Esther is a business woman. She buys and sells plantains. She buys them from nearby towns and supplies to food vendors and retailers in her community. Esther also treks to nearby communities to sell. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy plantains for resale

loans.name: Ravshanbek

texts.en:
Cattle farming is an economic activity dedicated to the raising of animals in order to generate revenue from the animals and the products they provide. Ravshanbek has earned a living from raising cattle since he was young. He's married and has 5 children that, according to Ravshanbek’s words, are his reason for living. It should be said that the low incomes available to people in this rural aren't enough to maintain a family and for this reason, Ravshanbek works enormously hard to provide a better standard of living for his wife and children. Ravshanbek urgently needs to buy animals such as cows and calves. He's applied for a loan of $1700 USD. Be an important part of the growth of Ravshanbek’s business.

loans.use: Purchasing of the young cattle

loans.name: Sohibdjon

texts.en:
B. Sohibdjon is 35 years old. He is married with 4 children. Sohibdjon is very diligent and hard-working man. On his car he is providing the taxi services inside the city of Istaravshan. For the last 5 years the current business had been the main income for the family allowing Sohibdjon to improve the living conditions of his large family. As any business generating the incomes the business of Sohibdjon also requires some investments from time to time. Thus, now the car needs the thorough fixing. For this reason Sohibdjon requests $1500 USD for purchasing spare parts. Sohibdjon promises to repay the current loan promptly and thanks all supporting him.

loans.use: Thorough fixing of the vehicle used for providing of taxi services.

loans.name: Abdullo

texts.en:
Since he was young, Abdullo has known how to work hard. His parents taught him how to get by as an agriculturist, and he learned very well. Now that he is the father of 4 children, he still works as an agriculturalist. Thanks to his parents, Abdullo now has the opportunity to move forward as a farmer, and he hopes to increase his agricultural produce so that he can bring his loved ones a more promising life.

Despite being a good agriculturalist and worker, Abdullo needs help to get ahead and improve his production. This is why he is asking for a loan, so that he can buy more of the seeds and fertilizers he needs, which are very expensive but without which his production will not improve. You can help Abdullo keep moving forward with his development plans.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is forty-three years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town.

Beatrice is a business woman. She sells corn dough. She buys maize from nearby towns and prepares the dough. She supplies to food vendors and retailers in her community. Beatrice has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy maize

loans.name: Shafoat

texts.en:
Shafoat, 37 years old, is very active and enterprising. She is married, and together they have two school-aged children. Shafoat says that, due to the scarcity of work, she decided to help her husband with the family’s finances. For the past 10 years, she has dedicated herself to the sale of women's clothing in the market. The credits obtained through IMON International in the past helped her purchase more merchandise and augment her sales, which, in turn, created better revenue. Her friends admire her greatly, given that she is a dedicated mother and wife, in addition to being good at sales. Today, Shafoat seeks a new loan to be able to buy a lot of merchandise that her suppliers offered her at a good price; she wishes to take advantage of this opportunity. In this way, she can offer her wares at competitive prices without affecting her returns. More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history and diverse culture, which is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet influence, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. It served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It was the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina. And it is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON’s History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase working capital with the purpose of developing the business

loans.name: Mighty God Group

texts.en: Adwoa is forty-nine years old. She is divorced and has given birth to six children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. Agnes is a trader and the leader of a trust bank group called "Mighty God." The group members are engaged either in farming and/or trading activities. They sell/supply in their local market and nearby communities. They sometimes trek to nearby community markets. Some of the group members, however, also render services, such as sewing/tailoring, hairdressing, etc. They want a loan to buy goods and materials in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Cresenciana

texts.en:
Cresenciana M. is now 63 years old and a single blessedness. Although she has no children to take care of, she wants to rise above poverty for herself, and also for Jenalyn, who stays in her house and became her partner in earning income for them. The main source of their income is selling different kinds of fish. This business suits their location, because their place is near the sea. They’ve run this business for 15 years now. When she joined Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), she used her first loan for this business, and now she also will use her second loan for this business. She will buy different kinds of fish only found in the Philippines, like bangus, tilapia, ayungin, and kanduli.

One dream of Cresenciana's is to grow her business more, so they will be able to earn more income so that they can build their house into a much more stable one. According to Cresenciana, she continues to have her savings in ASHI because in the long run she knows she can use it, and she also wants to have more savings in the bank because she is preparing for when she becomes old.

loans.use: To finance her fish vending business

loans.name: Kawugu C Asimwe Christine Group

texts.en: A. Christine is the group secretary, she is thirty-two years old, married with four children of whom three are schooling and she has two more people that she is caring for in her home and they are also schooling. She operates a retail shop since the year 2005. She is requesting for the loan to purchase retail item such as salt, sugar, soap, bread, etc increasing on the stocking. She is a hardworking business lady whose dream is to prosper and widen on her business.

loans.use: To purchase retail item such as salt, sugar, soap, bread, etc increasing on the stocking.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Although Pilar V. is ahead of 1 year at the age of 54 to her husband Florante V. who is now 53 years old this never been a hindrance for them who are the head in their family, because in the first place in their family they are both finding ways to fight their poverty. Her husband is work as a carpenter at the same time farmers in their place, while Pilar runs a sewing business for 3 years now. Because according to Pilar her husband’s revenue is only enough for their daily expenses nothing left for the education of her two daughter Diane 15 years old third year high school and Flor Marie 12 years old first year high school. So Pilar find an alternative ways to augment the not enough income of her husband, so it come out her sewing business because also she has a talent in sewing different kinds of clothes. Also her variety store business also contributes to their income that is why she also pursues to continue this.

The loan that she received from Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) will be use as additional capital for her sewing business. She will buy sewing machine, needle, different colors of thread and oil for the machine. It will help her to make her business more productive.

Pilar picture shows that they really needed enough capital so that her variety store and place for her sewing machine have their own part or place for more comfortable to move. This is one of her dream aside from to finish her children education until college.

loans.use: Will be additional capital for her sewing business

loans.name: Ivan Arturo

texts.en:
Ivan is 26 years old, single, and lives with his mother.  He lives in the Cercado Province of Cochabamba Department in Bolivia.  He runs a small shop where he sells various merchandise. The shop is not only a source of income, but also provides his family with their food.  Ivan also works as an auditor for a local construction company.  Work as an auditor is becoming tougher to find for Ivan, as more students graduate from university each year with qualified auditing skills.

With this loan from CIDRE, Ivan will purchase more merchandise for his shop.  He hopes to increase both the quantity and variety of products he sells.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Mirembe Group Nuru Nanyojo

texts.en: Nuru N. is a business woman of forty-five years old and the president of her group loan, she is married with eleven children where by six are going to school and she has four dependents schooling too. She deals with fresh food business since the year 2006. She is requesting for the loan to be purchasing more fresh food that is bananas, cassava, sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes, pumpkins, etc for sale. She wishes to expand on her grocery and more so educate her children for the better of their future.

loans.use: To be purchasing more fresh food that is bananas, cassava, sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes, pumpkins, etc for sale.

loans.name: Maria Lilian Tatiana

texts.en:
Maria is 46 years old, single, and has three children.  She is an English language teacher in the city of Cochabamba, Bolivia, and has been teaching for over 20 years.  Maria is a very hard worker; in addition to teaching, she runs a small convenience store.

At the store, Maria sells sugar, grains, crackers, juice, soda, and other basic foods.  When Maria is teaching during the day, her daughter helps run the shop. With this loan from CIDRE, she hopes to increase the variety of merchandise she has to offer, so as to attract more customers and ultimately earn more.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en: Mustafa A. is currently in the business of selling beer at the bar  and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell.  Mustafa is 35 years old and is Married with a husband that is a business man. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a house for rent BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Anthony A Nkalubo Harriet Group

texts.en: N. Harriet is a hard working business woman of forty years old, married with three children of whom two are going to school and she has six dependents schooling too. She owns rental houses since the year 2003. She is requesting for the loan to purchase paint, cement for renovating her rental houses. This rental houses are playing a big role in helping her family mostly in educating the children, feeding the family and so forth. In addition to that, she is selling water to community members helping her as side business too. Her dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase paint, cement for renovating her rental houses.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy F. is now 30 years old. She is now happily married to Alfredo F. who is now 34 years old the father of her two beautiful daughter Antonette 12 years old now studying as first year high school and Anjanette now in grade 6 at the age of 10. Amy’s husband is now work as a fisherman so one source of their income is come from fishing, and aside from that she run a variety store business that also give them extra income for their daily expenses. But Amy does not stop there, because she has a talent in sewing different kinds of clothes she decided to start a business which is sewing business.
 
Now in the 5th times of making loan in Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), she will use this loan in buying things needed in her sewing business like sewing machine, some oil for the machine and different color of threads. She was sure it will help her business to be more productive also with the effort she will exert in sewing all kinds of dress.   

Amy has a full determination that her businesses will grow to the point that it will give them enough income for all their expenses including expenses in schooling of her 2 children. Now one of her dreams is to have a car that she was sure can really help them for their business. She will work hard for it to make it possible.

loans.use: Will be used as additional capital for her sewing business

loans.name: Anthony A Stamili Namusubo Group

texts.en: Stamili N. is the chair person of her group loan, she is married with forty-five years of age, blessed with nine children of whom four are schooling and she has five siblings schooling too. Stamili N. has been operating her business of buying and selling tea ingredients for over six years. She is requesting for the loan to purchase tea ingredients such as tea leafs, coffee, tea masala, ginger, etc for sale to her customers. The tea ingredient she is selling makes tea taste good and admirable. She wishes to purchase in much volume at least more than 30 kilograms of each tea ingredients that will be improving upon her business. Her future plan is to work very hard and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase tea ingredients such as tea leafs, coffee, tea masala, ginger, etc for sale to her customers.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca A. is now 63 years old and happily married to her husband Eusebio A. now 68 years old. In the long years of their marriage they were blessed with plenty of childrens and all of them are now in the legal age. Most of them attain a low level of education because most of them are only a high school graduate. This is one of the frustrations of Prisca as well as her husband. She doesn’t want this to happen to her grandchildren that is why they’ll do their best to improve their way of living.

Main source of their income now is her variety store business so she wants this to grow more to give them enough income for their big expenses. When she joined Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI she use her first loan to her variety store. Now she wants again to use her second loan for her variety store, she will buy things that really needed in the store for selling like different groceries.

Now, one really dreams of Prisca is to turn her variety store into a grocery store that sell more items and goods for them to earn more income for them to build a big and stable house for their big family, for them to move and rest comfortable. And also she wants her neighborhood to benefit to it if this happen, they will never go to a far place just to buy the things they needed.

loans.use: To finance her variety store business

loans.name: Villa Ingavi Group

texts.es:
Aida C. de 35 años, es integrante del grupo “Villa Ingavi”, que pertenece al Centro Focal “German Busch” es madre de 2 hijos pequeños, tiene el negocio de trensado de mantas, cuenta que una amiga la había enseñado cuando era soltera, ella venda sus productos en una tienda ubicado en la 16 de Julio. Aida pertenece a este grupo aproximadmente unos 7 años, en esta ocación necesita el préstamo para comprar cortes de tela y fleco.
Al igual que Aida las demás integrantes del grupo tienen diversos negocios como la confección de faldas, venta de ropa, mochila, frutas, jugos y servicio de filmaciones. Todas necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercaderia y materia prima.
texts.en:
Aida C., 35 years old, is a member of the group "Villa Ingavi" that meets in the "German Busch" regional office of Pro Mujer. She is a mother of two small children. She has a business weaving blankets; she tells us that a friend taught her to do this when she was single. She sells her products in a store located on the Avenue 16 de Julio. Aida has belonged to this group for approximately 7 years. This time, she requests a loan to buy cloth and fringe. As with Aida, the other members of the group have small businesses involved in a variety of activities such as: the production of skirts, the sale of clothing, backpacks, fruit, juices and film services. They need the loan to acquire merchandise and raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise and raw materials

loans.name: Robane

texts.en: Robane V. is currently in the business of selling tea at the road side and is requesting a loan to open up a resturant.  Robane is 19 years old and is Single.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to go back for studies in the University BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: open up a resturant

loans.name: Total A Nasinjo Betty Group

texts.en: N. Betty is the representative of Total A group. She is thirty-two years old, married with five children who go to school, and has six dependents who also go to school. She has been in the poultry business since 2004. She is requesting this loan to purchase more chicks, feed, drugs, etc. for her business, which she will use strategically during festive season, when people will be purchasing more chicken. She is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to obtain a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks, feed, drugs, etc. for her business

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus O. age 52 is married to Nicanor O. 57 years old. They were blessed with plenty of children Mhelanie 28 years old graduated the course of computer management, Norven 18 years old graduated a 2 year course of welder, Nhesy 16 years old now currently studying first year college, Nhikko 14 years old now in third year high school and Chasie 8 years old now in grade 2 in primary level.

Her husband work as a fisherman in their place, so main source of their income is came from fishing business. Their house is near the sea so it’s more comfortable for them to run this business. They run this business for 35 years now and when she joined in Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) she use the loan that she received as additional capital for this business. Now in 2nd times of her loan she will use it for buying things needed in her business like different kind of fish net, accessories for the net and bamboo.

Venus makes promise to herself that they will do everything to make her business will continue to run and grow in the coming years because she is dreaming to have a big boat that they can use in their business for more income for them, in that way they can send all of her children to school until they become a degree holder.

loans.use: Will be use to buy different things needed in her fishing business

loans.name: Florigen

texts.en:
Florigen N. lives in the village of Pasil, Brgy. Tagda, Hinigaran Negros Occidental. She is 45 years old, married to Felomino N. who helps in running their businesses, and is blessed to have four young adult children. The youngest is 19 years old and the oldest is 26, and all of them help in the business for which Florigen pays them compensation. 

Because of her desire to help her husband support their family, Florigen joined NWTF-Project Dungganon to access capital that no one would have loaned to her without any collateral. When she received her first loan, she invested it by starting a mobile fish business. She would go from town to town selling fish during the town's market day, and she reinvested most of her income back into the business to gradually increase her stock volume. She used some of the income to send her children to school, but when they graduated from High School, they did not want to go to college and instead started helping with the business. With more helpers in her business, she expanded her operations to include selling dried fish, buying stocks from other suppliers. If any of her fresh fish stock was not sold, she sun dried them also so they wouldn't spoil, and would still earn a profit. 

Because of her good customer service, she was able to develop a good relationship with a regular customer who orders dried fish in bulk from her, and she now regularly sends a box of dried fish to Manila twice a week. Aside from her fresh and dried fish business, she also sells different varieties of bananas, and also has a pig fattening venture. From these different business activities, she earns PHP 10,000 a month net income and it helps pay for the household expenses, with some left over for reinvestment in the business and savings.  

Her previous loan of PHP 29,000 was used as working capital for her businesses. She was able to pay her loan on time without any delays. This contributed to her good credit performance as a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon, and she was able to access a bigger loan for her next cycle. Now she is borrowing for her 16th cycle PHP 35,000 to add to her capital in the mobile fish store and pig fattening business, so that she can provide a better future of her family.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for her fish business and pig fattening business

loans.name: Jinja Misindye A Nambi Sarah Group

texts.en: N. Sarah is a married business lady who is 30 years old and blessed with five children, all of whom are in school. She has a charcoal business; she has had this business for over two years. She is using the loan to purchase bags of charcoal, like 30 bags or more, from villages to town and market places for sale. She is a hardworking business lady whose dream is to complete her building and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase bags of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Binda

texts.en:
Binda S. is currently in the business of selling tea and bread at the restaurant and is requesting a loan to open up a shop. Binda is 28 years old and is single. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy land, build and rent it out.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open a shop

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel R. is married to Armando R.. She is now 37 years old while her husband is 40 years old and works as a carpenter in their place. They have 3 children namely: John Mark at the age of 18 working as a welder, Merlendeth 16 years old and currently studying as first year college and Arisa Mae now grade 2 in the age of 7 years old. Though her husband work hard for them, the daily income that she get is not enough for their big expenses, it only support their daily needs in the house, but it can’t support the other expenses of the family like the education of her two other children, because now a days it cost much to studied in college. So Maricel thinks of another business that can contributes to their daily income aside from the revenue of her husband and her sewing business, it comes out the buy and sell of banana. She decided to start up this business because in their place banana is common and not cost much.

The loan that she received from Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) will be use for buying different kinds of banana for selling. Because more banana to sell more income for their family. They do this business for one year now and she is right that this business will grow if you are interested in doing it.

Maricel really hopes that through all her business they will reach the things that they dream like to have a comfortable house for them and a good education for her children.

loans.use: To finanace her buy and sell of banana business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary P. is currently in the business of selling used clothes at the market and is requesting a loan to purchase shoes to sell. Mary is 33 years old and is married with a husband who is a teacher. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase shoes to sell

loans.name: Jinja Misindye A Sempa Florence Group

texts.en: S. Florence is a hardworking business lady of thirty-eight years old, married with six children schooling and has two dependents schooling too. She is carrying out live stock activity which she has obtained for fifteen years so far. She is using the loan to purchase pigs, cows and so forth for live stock. S. Florence is so much interested in agriculture that is why she is investing in live stock. Her future hope is prospering and raising her family’s standards of living.

loans.use: To purchase pigs, cows and so forth for live stock.

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa T. is now 37 years old and married to a driver Samson T. 44 years old. At the long years of their marriage they were given 2 children namely: Khristel Sam now in 2nd year high school and Chivae Rain now 1 year old. Ma. Teresa and her husband is a partner in taking care of their two children and giving them their needs through their growing.

Now as a source of their income her husband is driving a tricycle which is one of main means of transportation in their place. A tricycle is like a cab which has 3 wheels and can ride a maximum of 6 passengers. Although this business is not their main source of income it also contributes revenue for their expense. Also her husband manage their fish cage business, this business give them more income that’s why they focuses on it. As a matter of fact she will use the loan that she received from KIVA field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) as additional capital to her fish cage business. They will buy necessary things needed in her business like fish net, mini boat, bamboo and different kind of rope and also payment for the laborer. Ma. Teresa also run a variety store that also gives them additional income that they can use in times they needed it. ASHI approved the proposed loan of Ma. Teresa amounting Php 45,000 because she has a good credit rating. She always attend to a center meeting, always pay on time and her 3 businesses are running good.

One dreams of Ma. Teresa is to see her children finish their studies and living a descent and good life, not experiencing the hardness of life.

loans.use: Will be use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Rojo

texts.en:
Rojo A. is currently in the business of baking and selling bread and is requesting a loan to purchase baking materials. Rojo is 32 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase baking materials

loans.name: Las Huastecas Group

texts.es:
GRUPO LAS HUASTECAS

ESTE GRUPO SE ENCUENTRA UBICADO EN LA HUASTECA POTOSINA EN LA PARTE SUR DEL ESTADO DE SAN LUIS POTOSI COLINDANDO CON EL ESTADO DE QUERETARO, XILITLA ES UN LUGAR TURISTICO MUY VISITADO POR EXTRANJEROS, YA QUE CUENTA CON LUGARES PARADISOACOS NATURALES, SU CLIMA ES CALIDO ES CALIDO-HUMEDO.
EL GRUPO SE CONFORMA POR 4 SOCIAS:
MARTHA PATRICIA H. C.
MARIA OLIVIA M. Z.
LAURA H. C.

ESTAS PERSONAS SE DEDICAN DESDE HACE MAS DE 3 AÑOS A LA VENTA DE CATALOGO ESTA ACTIVIDAD LES HA AYUDADO A SACAR A SU FAMILIA ADELANTE Y APOYAR A SUS ESPOSOS CON LOS GASTOS DE SU FAMILIA
