LA SRA. VIRGINIA M. Z. SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION DE ZACAHUIL DESDE HACE MAS DE 10 AÑOS, ACTIVIDAD QUE REALIZA TODOS LOS DOMINGOS VENDIENDO A ORILLA DE CARRETERA. ACTUALMENTE LA SEÑORA TIENE 51 AÑOS, TIENE 5 HIJOS 2 DE ELLOS DEPENDEN DE ELLA, ESTA ACTIVIDAD LES HA AYUDADO A DARLES ESTUDIO Y A COLABORAR CON EL GASTO DE LA CASA. ESTA SEÑORA SOLICITO UN CREDITO DE $2,000 EL CUAL UTILIZA PARA LA COMPRA DE MATERIA PRIMA COMO ES HOJAS DE PAPATLA, SIMILAR A LA HOJA DE PLATANO, CHILE CHINO O CASCABEL, MANTECA Y CARNEDE PUERCO Y POLLO PARA LA PREFERENCIA DE LA GENTE. UTILIZA UN HORNO DE BARRO QUE SU ESPOSO LE HIZO EN SU CASA MISMO QUE CALIENTA 3 HORAS ANTES DE METER A CUESER EL ZACAHUIL Y LO DEJA ENCOCIMIENTO DE 8 A 9 HORAS PARA QUE QUEDE LISTO PARA EL DIA DOMINGO, TODO ESTE TRABAJO LO REALIZA UN DIA ANTES. SIENDO ESTA ACTIVIDAD UNA TRADICION DE ESTA REGION.
texts.en:
Las Huastecas Group This group is located in the Huasteca Potosina in the southern part of the state of San Luis Potosí bordering the state of Queretaro. Xilitla is a tourist place, which is visited by many foreigners. It has natural places that are like paradise. Its climate is warm and humid. The group is comprised of four people; Martha Patricia H. C., Maria Olivia M. Zuñiga, and Laura H. C.. For over three years these people have been selling by catalog. This activity has helped them get their families ahead and helped their husbands with the family expenses. Virginia M. Zuñiga has been making “zacahuil” (a large tamale) for ten years. She does this every Sunday, and she sells by the side of the road. She is 51, and she has five children. Two of the children are dependent upon her. This activity has helped her give her children an education. It also helps with the household expenses. She is asking for a loan for $2,000 to buy raw materials like “papatla” leaves, which are similar to banana leaves. She will also buy Chinese chili or “cascabel”, shortening, pork, and chicken for her customers’ preferences. She uses a clay stove, which her husband made in her own house. It heats for three hours before she puts the zachuil in the oven. She leaves them in for eight to nine hours so that they are ready for Sunday. She does all of this work one day ahead of time. This activity is a tradition in this region.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Making “zacahuil” (a large tamale)

loans.name: Jinja Misindye B Mirembe Robinah Group

texts.en: M. Robinah is the chairperson of her group loan. She is 38 years old and blessed with five children, two of whom are schooling. She has one dependent in school, too. She has been operating a canteen so far for three years and now she is requesting a loan to purchase canteen items, mostly edible items such as bread, milk, donuts, cakes, juices, sodas, biscuits, sweets, chocolates, etc., for sale. She wants the loan to help her to stock more and more canteen items for a large profit. Her future hope is the education of her children and well being of her family.

loans.use: To purchase food items for resale

loans.name: Awat

texts.en: Awat E. is currently in the business of selling clothes and bedsheets and is requesting a loan to purchase a sewing machine.  Awat is 34 years old and is Divorced.   She has 1 child and her child goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a hotel at the nearby market BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Ntinda F Nanyazi Harriet Group

texts.en: N. Harriet is twenty-nine years old married with two children. She is operating a retail shop business since the year 2006. She is using the loan to purchase items such as paraffin, 100 kilogram bag of sugar, bags of salt, wheat flour, maize flour, and so forth. She is so grateful in advance for the loan opportunity because she thought it was not all that easy, she will improve as she increase on the stock for big profit return. Her dream is to prosper and be well.

loans.use: To purchase items such as paraffin, 100 kilogram bag of sugar, bags of salt, wheat flour, maize flour, and so forth.

loans.name: Lemilda

texts.en:
Lemilda A. is 41 years old and married to Renato A., who is a 46 year-old tinsmith. They have seven children ranging in age from 6 to 18 years old, who are all going to school. The family lives in the village of Brgy. Rafaela Barrera, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. Lemilda and her husband dream of sending their children to school and when they finish their studies, be gainfully employed in a stable job in the future. That’s why the couple strive so hard to achieve their dreams for their children.

Before she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon, she and her husband already owned a tin shop because her husband was a skilled tinsmith. They made knives, tongs, different kitchen tools and farm equipment. Lemilda assisted her husband in producing some of the products, but she did most of the selling and managed the business. When demand for their products reached a critical point where they needed capital infusion so they could take it to the next level, Lemilda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon so she could borrow the capital to buy more materials to make more products to sell. With the additional capital, their income also increased and because she paid all of the installments on time and paid off the loans within its loan term, Lemilda was able to maintain a good credit record, and still earn an average net income of PHP 15,000 per month.

From the time she and her husband started the business 22 years ago, she has seen a big improvement to it, especially after she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon. To continue the momentum of her business, she borrowed PHP 19,500 on her previous loan to use as revolving working capital for her tin shop. Now she is borrowing the same amount again so that she will have enough working capital to continue buying the necessary materials for the production of the tools and farm equipment that they make and sell to earn their living.

Limilda and her husband Renato are shown in the picture in their tin shop.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase materials for their tin shop

loans.name: El Manguito Group

texts.es:
El grupo El Manguito, se formo en S. Pinotepa Nacional Oaxaca; está integrado por 14 clientes, llevan un año (3 ciclos)trabajando con credito que Fundacion Realidad ofrece, todos los integrantes se dedican a la elaboración y comercialización de productos como son:Abarrote, tamales, refrescos, helados, totopos, ropa, perfumes y zapatos por catalogo, merceria, lenceria, tortillas de maíz elaboradas a mano, tacos, maíz a granel y pescado fresco, debido a la zona geografica en que se encuentra la locaidad estos tipos de productos tienen buena demanda en la región y por consecuencia buenos ingresos algo muy aceptable comenta la señora Alicia D. T. ella es clienta de 71 años de edad que junto con su hija Rosario que actualmente ya no esta en el grupo por cambiar de domicilio fueron quienes conformaron el grupo invitando a sus vecinos para formar el mismo,  comenta doña Alicia que el credito recibido por la institución le han beneficiado demasiado a todos los integrantes ya que les dá el medio de trabajar y contribuir a los ingresos de sus familias mas ahora que la situación aconomica del país esta en crisis y el ingreso de sus esposos no son suficientes para solventar los gastos que generan sus hijos para que acudan a la escuela.
El recurso que solicitan del credito lo utilizarán para invertir en la elaboración y compra de productos para vender como son:compra de maíz, leña, bolsas de plastico, carne fresca, chiles seco para prepar mole, articulo de abarrotes, refrescos, pago de fletes de las personas que compran articulos por catalogo asi como renta de lanchas y compra de gasolina  de las pesonas que venden pescado freco.
ellan tienen la esperanza de que Fundación Realidad continue brindandoles el servicio financiero  ya que dependen de eso para que continuen trabajando y a futuro tener un negocio que le genere ingresos y mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
The Manguito Group was formed in S. Pinotepa Nacional Oaxaca. It is comprised of 14 members. They have been working for one year (three cycles) with loans that Fundacion Realidad offers. All of the members make and sell products like groceries, tamales, soft drink, ice cream, tortilla chips, clothes, perfume, shoes by catalog, notions, lingerie, handmade corn tortillas, tacos, bulk corn, and fresh fish. Due to the geographic region they are located in, these types of products are in good demand in the area. As a consequence, their income is very good and acceptable, according to Alicia D. T.. She is a 71 year old member who joined with her daughter, Rosario. Currently she is not in the group because she moved. They were the ones that founded the group by inviting neighbors to join. Alicia comments that the loan received from the institution has really helped all of the members. It gives them a means to work and contribute income to their families. It really helps now that the country’s economy is in crisis, and their husbands incomes do not cover the expenses of the children going to school. They will use the loan they are asking for to make and buy products to sell like corn, wood, plastic bags, fresh meat, dried chilies to prepare mole, groceries, soft drinks, shipping charges for those who buy articles by catalog, rent for boats, and gasoline for those who sell fresh fish. They hope that the Realidad Foundation will continue to offer financial services. They are dependent upon them to keep working and to have a business in the future that generates income and a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials and products to sell

loans.name: Alcatraz De San Marcos Group

texts.es:
APROXIMADAMENTE A 33KM DE LA CIUDAD DE CUAUTLA MORELOS SE ENCUENTRA UBICADO EL POBLADO DE SAN MARCOS PERTENECIENTE AL MUNICIPIO DE PUEBLA.
 LA FORMA MAS FACIL PARA LLEGAR A ESTE POBLADO ES POR LA CARRETERA 160 QUE CONDUCE DE CUAUTLA A IZUCAR DE MATAMOROS A 20KM DE CUAUTLA SE ENCUENTRA EL CRUCERO DE AMAYUCA DONDE SALEN DOS CARRETERAS REVESTIDAS UNA EN DIRECCION A ZACUALPAN DE AMILPAS HACIA EL NORTE Y OTRA HACIA JANTETELCO AL ORIENTE. POR ESTA ULTIMA, A UNOS 10 KM ADELANTE SE LLEGA A SAN MARCOS ACTEOPAN.

EN ESTE POBLADO SE ENCUENTRA LA UDE "ALCATRAZ DE SAN MARCOS" EL CUAL SE ENCUENTRA EN SU CICLO 7 CONFORMADO POR 13 INTEGRANTES 11 MUJERES Y 2 HOMBRES LOS CUALES SE HAN DISTINGUIDO POR SU TRABAJO Y LA PUNTUALIDAD EN SUS PAGOS EN ESTA COMUNIDAD TODA LA GENTE SE DEDICA A LA INDUSTRIA Y UNO QUE OTRO A LA AGRICULTURA PERO TODOS LOS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON ALFAREROS.
EN ESTA OCACION HABLARE UN POCO  DE LA SRA. TEREZA A. M. LA CUAL CUENTA CON 29 AÑOS DE EDAD ES MADRE SOLTERA, TIENE UN NIÑO DE 8 AÑOS QUE VIVE CON ELLA Y CURSA EL 3er AÑO DE PRIMARIA.
EL CREDITO QUE PIDIO LA SRA. TEREZA ES DE $3000 LO VA A OCUPAR PARA COMPRAR LEÑA, BARRO, GRETA, PINTURA Y ASI PODER FABRICAR SUS CAZUELAS, JARROS, SALCEROS, CAFETEROS, ECT. DECIDIO PEDIR POCO ESTA OCACION YA QUE COMENTA AHORITA LA SITUACION ESTA MUY DIFICIL POR LAS LLUVIAS Y ESO A ELLOS LES AFECTA EN SU ACTIVIDAD YA QUE SI LLUEVE ELLOS NO PUEDEN FABRICAR SUS CAZUELAS YA QUE EL METODO QUE UTILIZAN PARA FABRICARLAS ES ALGO LABORIOSO Y SI LLUEVE EL BARRO NO SE SECA NI EL HORNO SE PUEDE PRENDER Y DE ELLO NOS PLATICO UN POCO  EL BARRO QUE OCUPAN PARA FABRICAR LAS CAZUELAS LO TRAEN DE VARIOS LUGARES COMO SON SAN ADRES AHUATELCO, SAN FELIPE CUAPAXCO Y SAN FRANCISCO TEPANGO.
LA FABRICACION CONSISTE EN PONER EL BARRO EN EL SOL Y SE MACHACA CON UN RODILLO, DESPUES SE HUMEDECE Y SE MANIPULA HASTA FORMAR UNA MASA DE BUENA CONSISTENCIA, DE AHÍ SE SACAN LOS PEDAZOS PARA ELABORAR LAS CAZUELAS, VASIJAS, MACETAS, ETC. DE AHÍ SE SACAN AL SOL PARA QUE SE SEQUEN UNA SEMANA APROXIMADAMENTE, DESPUES DE QUE YA ESTAN SECOS SE ACOMODAN EN EL HORNO PARA QUEMAR DURANTE 2 HRS.
EL HORNO ES DE ADOBE CUYA FORMA ES SIMILAR A LA DE UN POZO DE AGUA DE UN METRO DE ALTURA POR 1.30 DE DIAMETRO APROX.
 POR LO CUAL DECIDE ESPERARSE Y SI LAS COSAS MEJORAN VOLVERA A INCREMENTAR SU CREDITO COMO ANTES ELLA HA FORMADO PARTE DE FUNDACION REALIDAD DESDE HACE 3 CICLOS YA QUE COMENTA EL GRUPO LO INICIO LA SRA. SATURNINA B. B. LA CUAL FORMABA PARTE DE UN GRUPO PERO ELLA DECIDIO FORMAR EL SUYO PERO, NADAMAS ESTUVO 2 CICLOS DE AHI LO TUVO OTRA SRA. PERO TAMBIEN DECIDIO DEJARLO Y COMO LOS DEMAS QUERIAN CONTINUAR DECIDIERON QUE SE FUERA A LA CASA DE LA SRA. HERMINIA MAMA DE TEREZA LA CUAL ANIMO A DOÑA TERE PARA QUE ENTRARA Y HASTA EL DIA DE HOY ELLA ES LA REPRESENTANTE DEL GRUPO.
NO TIENE UN NEGOCIO ESTABLECIDO YA QUE COMO EN SAN MARCOS TODOS SE DEDICAN A LA ALFARERIA ES MUY DIFICIL ESTABLECERSE ELLA VENDE SUS CAZUELAS Y TODO LO QUE ELAVORAN A COMPRADORES QUE LLEGAN DE FUERA DE LA CD. DE MEXICO, PUEBLA, MORELOS, LA FIESTA EN SAN MARCOS ES EL DIA 25 DE ABRIL Y AHI TODOS LOS AVITANTES SACAN SU MERCANCIA AFUERA DE SU CASA PARA VENDER A TODOS LOS VISITANTES QUE LLEGAN DE FUERA SUS PRECIOS SON MUY ECONOMICOS.

EL SUEÑO MAS GRANDE QUE ELLA TIENE ES QUE SU HIJO LE HECHE MUCHAS GANAS A LA ESCUELA Y QUE TAMBIEN APRENDA LO DE LA ALFARERIA YA QUE ES ALGO QUE CON EL TIEMPO PUEDE EXTINGUIRSE COMO LOS ANIMALES POR QUE LOS NIÑOS DE AHORA CRECEN Y NO LES GUSTA Y PREFIEREN IRSE A E.U. PARA TENER UNA VIDA "MEJOR" SIENDO QUE ESTA ACTIVIDAD ES ALGO QUE VA GENERACION TRAS GENERACION NOS COMENTA QUE ELLA EMPEZO DESDE LOS 15 AÑOS A TRABAJAR EN LA ALFARERIA YA QUE SUS PAPAS LE ENSEÑARON.

POR ULTIMO AGRADECIO A FUNDACION REALIDAD POR OTORGARLES LOS PRESTAMOS A TIEMPO Y SER MUY AMABLES Y CONFIABLES Y A KIVA GRACIAS POR PRESTARLE A FUNDACION YA QUE ES UNA EMPRESA MUY SERIA Y QUE CUMPLE LO QUE PROMETE Y DICE "FUNDACION REALIDAD NO LOS VA A DEFRAUDAR TENGAN CONFIANZA EN ELLOS"

loans.use: PARA COMPRAR GRETA, PINTURA, LEÑA, BARRO

loans.name: Romualdo

texts.es:
Romualdo tiene un vehiculo con el que trabaja como chofer en el sindicato Simón Bolívar trufi 5.   
Vive en la zona de Achachicala de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa de sus padres. 
El crédito será destinado para capital de inversión ( compra de línea en el sindicato y asi ser socio afiliado).
Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.

loans.use: Compra de linea (membership) en el sindicato de Trufi Simon Bolivar, para ser socio afiliado.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
Nora es empleada domestica, y también lava ropa en diferentes domicilios, 
Vive en la zona de villa copacabana de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa alquilada
El crédito será destinado para capital para iniciar una actividad de comercio ya que venderá harina, arroz, azúcar, etc., al crédito, lo cual  mejorara sus ingresos y calidad de vida.
Es primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, las ganas de superarse le dan la oportunidad de obtener este crédito.

loans.use: compra de articulos de primera necesidad, como harina, arroz, azucar, para su venta al crédito.

loans.name: Milly's Group

texts.en:
Milly is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is 40 years old and a single mother of four children ages 16, 14, 12 and 10 years old. Also, she takes care of three dependents. 

Milly is a businesswoman with three businesses: selling used clothing, selling matooke (a Ugandan dish), and managing a restaurant, all in Mbalala. With regard to the clothes and matooke, Milly has had both businesses for 30 years. The restaurant has been running for four years. She employs three people, two of whom are her siblings, to help her manage her businesses. All in all, she is able to make 250,000/= a week as profit, which help her take care of her children, including paying their school fees. She is what she is today because of her businesses that help to bring in more income. 

In the future, instead of moving around with her clothes to the daily markets, she would like to have a stationary shop where she can sell her clothes, as well as increase the number of bales she buys a week from 2 to 3 or 4, for increased profits and to have a variety. At the moment, Milly is renting, but she is building a house for her children to live in. She needs a loan to be able to buy more bales of clothes for resale as well as buying more matooke for the same purpose.

loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk for resale

loans.name: Vitza

texts.es:
Vitza, es ayudante de albañil y trabaja de lunes a sábado en una construcción. 
Vive en la zona de alto Llojeta de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa propia 
El crédito será destinado para capital e iniciar el negocio de venta de azúcar, arroz, harina, etc., al crédito y poder mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su responsabilidad y la necesidad que tiene le dan la oportunidad de obtener este crédito.

loans.use: Compra de articulos de consumo básico, como harina, arroz, azucar, etc., para su posterior venta al crédito.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana S. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Llojeta, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su hijo.
La señora Juana es enfermera y trabaja en la policía de esta ciudad, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para el acabado de una habitación en su vivienda y así tener espacio para su hijo que ya cursa la secundaria.
Esta es la tercera vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Juana S. lives with her son in her own home in the Llojecta area west of the city of La Paz. Juana is a nurse, and she works with the city’s police force. She supports her family with this income. The loan she is asking for is to finish a room in her house. This way she will have space for her son who is in high school. This is the third time she has asked for a loan. The completed socioeconomic analysis qualifies her to access a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish a room in her house so that her son can be more comfortable

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Having a secure future when they grow old is one thing that Esperanza M. is preparing for. Even at 62 years old, she is still very strong and very capable of running her business and continues helping her children. She is married to Ellerino M., who is 63 years old and also still earns a salary by working as a timekeeper at a sugarcane plantation, even as he receives a pension from social security because he is officially retired. The couple is blessed with four children, all of whom have their own families, but they still help their children support their young families. Esperanza and Ellerino live in the village of Brgy. Rafaela Barrera, Sagay City, Negros Occidental.

Esperanza started her business when she saw how hard her husband was working just to earn enough to provide for his family's basic necessities -- food, clothing and shelter -- much less the education of their four children. As a good wife, she believed that it was her duty and her right to earn a living to help ease the burden of supporting the family from her husband's shoulders. This is why she used the small savings that she had set aside from her husband's salary to start a small general store, rolling her capital over to buy new inventory periodically. But as her operations continued, she saw that without an infusion of capital, she would not be able to optimize her income potential. This is why she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1992, so that she could have continual access to the much needed working capital that her business needed to expand.

In the 31 years that she's had her general store, Esperanza is happy to be earning her own income and is able to stay independent because of this source of income, even though she is now a senior citizen. Her business now earns her PHP 4,000 per month on average from the operations of her general store.

In her previous loan, she borrowed PHP 19,500 to buy additional items/goods for her general store. Her loan was fully paid within term and each weekly repayment was made on time without any delays. For her 18th cycle, she is borrowing only PHP 15,000 because this amount is what she needs for her general store at this time. Esperanza continues to strive in her business because she wants to stay independent even as a senior citizen.


About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for her general store

loans.name: Justine's Group

texts.en:
Justine, 50, is the chairperson of her group in Mukono. She is a businesswoman with a stall in Kasenge, where she sells fresh fruits and vegetables she gets from the Mukono and Nakawa markets every day. She does this because she wants to sell all her produce fresh and this has enabled her to keep her customers to herself. She also has a business of selling clothes from the same area for ladies, children and men, and this helps bring in an extra income. She has a dream of owning a boutique in the future.

She is married with six children, all in school, and she takes care of some other orphans and grandchildren. Justine needs a loan to help buy more clothes for sale.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Even as she approaches senior citizenship, Emma S., a 57-year-old widow is still determined to stay independent and earn her own income. She does not want to rely on her children to support her. Emma lives in the village of Brgy Tagda, Hinigaran Negros Occidental. She has been a widow for 19 years and has raised her six children well.  Now that they are all adults, have their own families, and are gainfully employed, Emma wants to save for her future support so she will not be a burden to her children in her old age.

When she was widowed, the demands of her business and the need to sustain a young family impelled Emma to slowly recover from the grief of losing her husband at such a young age. She continued running her business until the increasing financial needs of the family prompted her to look for an external source of capital. In 2004, Emma became a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon and was able to sustainably increase her income and meet the needs of her household. 

Along with a general store, Emma later invested in a fish vending business in her community, where regular customers come to buy fish. Her general store and fish vending business have a combined average income of PHP 6,000 per month, which is enough to cover her household expenses with some left over for savings so she can stay independent in her old age. 

Emma borrowed PHP 13,000 on a previous loan, and was able to repay it on an installment basis in full and on time without any delays. Since it is the rainy season now, Emma expects sales to be slower than it was earlier this year, so she is requesting to loan the smaller amount of PHP 11,000  right now which she foresees as sufficient additional capital she needs to continue expanding her general store without sacrificing her profitability because of the anticipated slower inventory turnover.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few women but thousands of them. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a meager $1 a day, to creating realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for her general store

loans.name: Charles' Group

texts.en:
Charles S. is 27 years old and the leader of a lending group in Mukono. He is a single man with no wife or children of his own.

Charles has worked as a motorcyclist in Namugongo/Mbalwa for three years and is able to make 35,000/= in profits per week. He says that it’s a good business except at times his bosses and his regular customers take a long time to pay him, which affects his cash flow. Despite this, Charles makes sure that he is always neat and clean at work and handles his customers professionally.

Charles dreams of buying his own motorcycle, as well as building his own home, before he even thinks of marrying and having children because he would want them to have a bright future. This is his first loan application with the group and he believes it will enable him to repair his motorcycle, since it was loaned to him on the condition that in the event of any mechanical problems, he would cover the repairs.

loans.use: To repair his motorcycle for efficiency

loans.name: Odun

texts.en: Odun is 35 years old and married with four children. She sells provisions and also has a salon where she creates lovely hairstyles for her customers. Odun is hoping to borrow N50,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She also wants to say thank you to all the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane N. is the leader of an entrepreneur group in Mukono. She is 52 years old, married, and has seven children aged 8 to 22 who are all still in school. She also takes care of orphans.

Jane works as a plantation farmer where she grows crops both for sale and home consumption. She also works as a poultry farmer and has raised chickens at her home in Kisoga for 20 years. She is able to generate 100,000/= in profits per week, which helps her run her home and save a little money.

Jane wants to expand her poultry farm so she can earn enough income to educate her children and enable them to get jobs in the future. She needs a loan to buy more chicken feed and fertilizer to help boost her farming businesses.

loans.use: To buy more chicken feed and fertilizer for her farms

loans.name: Damiola

texts.en: Damiola sells bags of garri(cassava flakes) in wholesale to her customers.She has been in this business for long.she is  hard working woman and she is determined to lift her business above poverty. the demands for her bags of garri is high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers.She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more bags of garri to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of garri to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock of produce for resale

loans.name: Danis De Los Angeles

texts.es: Danis de los Ángeles L. Chavarría tiene 37 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, tiene 2 hijos a su cargo por lo que tiene muchos tiempo de trabajar y buscar la forma de sobrevivir. Danis atravesó muchos problemas para salir adelante como lo fue el tiempo ya que no podía salir a buscar sus productos para surtir su negocio de los productos que sus clientes solicitaban, pero con el apoyo de sus hijos logro poco a poco aumentar sus productos, por lo que los financiamiento han sido de gran ayuda para su negocio. Actualmente solicita un financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, jugos, gaseosas, refrescos, pan, galletas. El deseo de Danis es que la situación mejore para aumentar su inventario.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Many people who do not have property or money to leave their children always say that the one legacy they can leave them is an education. Education is a treasure that once possessed, cannot be stolen or given away, and when used wisely, can open a whole new world for just about anyone whether they started from poverty or wealth. Gloria P. who lives in the village of Brgy. Vito, Sagay City, Negros Occidental also believes that education is the one thing she can give her children to prepare them to rise above their situation and improve their lives.

Gloria is 50 years old and married to Fernando P. who presently owns and manages a fishing business. They have three children, two of whom are already gainfully employed, and a younger daughter who’s in her fourth year of High School. It is Gloria's dream to send her daughter to college to earn a degree, get a stable job, and have a good life.

Fishing is the main source of income for the family because of their proximity to the sea. At first, Gloria relied wholly on her husband's income as a fisherman. But maintaining a fishing business requires a capital infusion from time to time, especially to cover repairs and maintenance of the nets and boat. This is the reason why Gloria joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1995—to access new capital so that her family could sustain their fishing business.

With consecutive loans from NWTF-Project Dunggano, that Gloria borrowed and repayed, their income increased and Gloria saw her husband's fishing business become stable and sustainable. This prompted her in 2004 to take out a loan to start a general store so she could supplement her husband's income and help with the family's expenses. Her subsequent loans were alternately used to increase the working capital of her general store and the family’s fishing business, and have helped earn her an average monthly income of PHP 5,000.

For now, Gloria’s focus is in the expansion of her general store. Her 9th cycle loan of PHP 19,500 was used to add to her working capital so she could have more inventory to sell. For her 10th cycle loan, she is again requestion PHP 19,500 to continue expansion of her store. She intends to use the income to supplement her husband's earnings to help support the family and set aside something for her daughter's college education.

About NWTF:_In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few women but thousands of them. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a meager $1 a day, to creating realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for her general store

loans.name: Aida Patricia

texts.es: Aida Patricia Hernández Méndez tiene 24 años. Es una madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo ello asisten a un colegio público ya que Aida no tiene los suficientes recursos para costear los gastos de un colegio privado. Su actividad económica es la venta de leña. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, y dio inicio por la necesidad de mantener a su familia además Aida no término sus estudios ya que sus padres no pudieron brindarles esta oportunidad, pero esto no le impidió salir adelante con esta humilde actividad. Ella es una joven muy trabajadora y disfruta mucho de su trabajo, porque todos sus clientes gratifican su valor porque a pesar de ser muy joven ha logrado salir adelante. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra leña. Su mayor sueño es obtener otro negocio para mejorar sus ingresos.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Anifat

texts.en: Anifat is 41 years old and she is married with 6 children. She sells crates of drinks and sachet water. This is her main source of income. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She is indeed grateful to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To restock her supply of beans, cooking oil, and flour, and to build a stand.

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Angel is a 40-year-old borrower who lives in Ingenio Angelina, a small community north of San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. Angel lives with two of his four children, his wife, and his mother. He operates a carnicería, or butcher shop, in which he specializes in the sales of pork.

Angel runs a very successful business, and this is his fifth loan with Esperanza. He purchases the piglets, raises them, and then prepares the meat to sell to his community. He oversees the entire process, from start to finish. This way, Angel can guarantee the quality of the meat he is selling to his customers. Also, if a customer wants another type of meat, Angel will find the best cuts possible and deliver them. 

With the profits from his business, Angel hopes to buy a small van he can use to get around the country. He would be able to transport the animals much more easily, and expand his customer base. He also has two children who are in university in different cities, and with a van he would be able to see them more frequently. Thank you for your loan to Angel!

loans.use: Raising and selling pigs

loans.name: Gbatima 1 Group

texts.en:
Hawa is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Gbatima 1. She is a 52-year-old married woman with two children, aged 23 and 26, both of whom are university students. Hawa is illiterate because she was born and raised in a rural area where there was no school, but later she migrated to Monrovia, Liberia. Hawa and her family now live in Virginia, and sell in the Banjaour market, north of the capital, Monrovia.

Hawa's business is food preparation. She buys ingredients and prepares food to be sold in the Banjaour market. She has been running this business for 15 years and has been able to take care of her family with the proceeds of the business. She is a good cook, which is why she has so many customers. Hawa's difficulty is the rainy season, because when it rains she doesn't really get customers because it is said that Liberians are afraid of rain.

Hawa is requesting a loan to buy more food ingredients such as tins of oil, seasoning, pepper and bags of rice, to improve her business. She is hoping to establish a big restaurant in the future in order to make enough profit to build a house for her family. This would changes their lives totally.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients such as tins of oil, seasoning, pepper and bags of rice

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Nothing is impossible if you believe that you can have everything you want, if you just put your faith and trust in God above all things. This is what Marlyn S. truly believes. She is a 44 year-old widow with 3 children who lives in the village of Brgy. Vito, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. Two of her daughters, who are 22 and 21 years old, have already graduated and earned their Bachelor's Degree in Elementary Education, and the older one has already passed the Teacher's Board. The youngest, who is 16, just graduated from high school and is now in her first year of college.

When she was widowed, she was devastated because it was unexpected and she was not prepared for such an occurrence. She had to find a means of support for her young daughters. While looking around for business opportunities, she realized that she could earn a living selling religious articles to the devotees who visited the old church in her village. The village of Vito, which is in the older part of Sagay City, is visited by both tourists and devotees, especially on Fridays because of its famous shrine to St. Vincent Ferrer.

Marlyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 so that she could get start-up capital for her business - selling religious articles and accessories to people who come to the church. Her income has been able to support her family over the years as well as pay for all the weekly installments on time. Since she started her business, she has seen the advancement of it with each succeeding and larger loan she received from NWTF-PD, and this has in turn improved her family's quality of life. She was able to earn an average monthly income of Php 8,000 which allowed her to send her children to college. She still continues to save part of her income for the education of her youngest daughter.

Her previous loan of Php 19,000 was used for additional working capital for her retailing of religious items/articles. This loan was fully paid on time without any delays. And in her 9th cycle loan, she intends to borrow Php 19,500 as additional capital for her business, which will be a big help to her family.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for her religious articles

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida is twenty – eight years old. She is divorced and has give birth to two children, both in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. Vida is a trader. She trades in jewels. She buys her goods from Sunyani. Vida hawks to sell in her community and also treks to nearby communities to sell. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy jewels

loans.name: Silvia Helena

texts.es: La Señora de Nombre Silvia Helena Rodríguez B. tiene la edad de 42 años, es madre de 4 hijos que laboran de forma independiente y algunos le ayudan en el negocio. Silvia tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000 y siempre la ha gustado ser una persona responsable y pagar a tiempo. La actividad económica es la venta de materiales de construcción, ella da inicio a esta actividad por su papa quien era el que estaba a cargo del negocio ella siempre lucho por mantener este negocio, ya que sabía que un futuro el día de mañana podría serle muy útil para el futuro. Ahora solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de arena, ya que es destinada para la elaboración de bloques. El sueño de ella es que sus hijos logren finalizar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Silvia Helena is 42 years old and the mother of 4 children who work independently now, though some help her in her business. Silvia has worked with the Leon 2000 Foundation for a long time and she has always enjoyed being a responsible person and paying her loans on time.

She sells construction materials. Silvia began this activity with her father who used to be in charge of the business. She has always struggled to maintain the business, knowing that it would serve her well in the future.

Now she asks for financing to buy sand for making cement blocks. Her dream is that her children will succeed in completing their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY SAND TO MAKE CEMENT BLOCKS

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is thirty – nine years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. Regina is a trader. She trades in ready-made textiles. She buys her goods from Sunyani. She hawks to sell in her community and also treks to nearby communities to sell. Regina has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy ready-made textiles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: ouvrir un atelier et achat de matériels de travail.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is thirty – six years old. She is widowed and has given birth to three children and in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. Monica is a trader. She trades in plantain. She buys from nearby towns and supplies to food vendors and retailers in her community. Monica also treks to nearby communities to sell. She has been in business for fifteen years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy plantain

loans.name: Juana Yamilette

texts.es: Juana Yamilette T. Espinoza tiene la edad de 36 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Juana tiene 2 hijos y están a su cargo. Este no es el primer financiamiento que ella tiene con Fundación León 2000, ya que siempre le han sido de mucha ayuda para su negocio. La actividad económica de Yamileth es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a  esta humilde actividad, por lo que está ubicada de León en donde a diario obtiene clientes, por lo que dio inicio por cuenta propia para obtener los ingresos necesarios para cubrir los gastos de su vivienda. Ella solicita el financiamiento  para capital de trabajo como pantalones, carteras, camisas y pantalones. Ella desea mejorar sus ingresos para su hogar.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Gbatima Group

texts.en:
Sarah J. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Gbatima. She is a 32-year-old married woman with five children, aged between 9 and 17 years old and in 6th to 10th grade. Sarah dropped out of school at 5th grade due to poverty. She and her family live in Siaza town, Virginia, and sell in the Banjour Market, north of the Liberian capital, Monrovia.

Sarah buys food ingredients and sells them to the residents of Siaza town, Virginia. She has been running her business for five years and has been grateful to the business for helping her and her family. Sarah's difficulty is the competition at the market as there are many vendors selling the same goods as she does. However, she talks to her customers in a good manner, and this encourages them to buy from her.

Sarah is requesting a loan to buy more food ingredients, such as tins of oil, seasoning, pepper and bags of rice, to improve her business. She is hoping to establish a bigger shop in the future in order to make enough profit to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy more food ingredients such as tins of oil, seasoning, pepper and bags of rice

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is fifty–two years old. She is divorced and has given birth to four school-age children. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. Comfort is a trader. She trades in plantains. She buys from nearby towns and supplies to food vendors and retailers in her community. Comfort also treks to nearby communities to sell. She has been in business for over twenty–five years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy plantains

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia is sixty – three years old. She is married and has given birth to seven children and in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. Afia is a food vendor. She trades in pastries. She prepares and sells on a table top by the road side. She also supplies to other retailers. She buys her ingredients from nearby towns. Afia has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is fifty years old. She is divorced and has given birth to six children who are in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. Elizabeth is a trader. She trades in jewels. She buys her goods from Sunyani. She hawks to sell in her community and also treks to nearby communities to sell. Elizabeth has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy jewels

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is thirty – five years old. She is married and has given birth to two children and in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. Martha is a trader. She trades in maize. She buys from nearby towns and supplies to food vendors and retailers in her community. Martha also treks to nearby communities to sell on their market days. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Harrisco Group

texts.en:
Robert K. H. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called Harrisco.  He is a 45 year old married man with 4 children aged 4-23 years old and their educational levels are 7th grade to high school graduate.  He also cares for 2 siblings.  He is a high school graduate and attended a medical college studying nursing.  He and his family live in Freetown, Virginia and sell in the Sheriff gas station north of the capital Monrovia, Liberia.

Robert's business is pharmaceutical drugs.  He buys medical drugs wholesale and sells to the residents of Virginia, north of the capital Monrovia, Liberia.

He has been running this business for 3 years. Because he talks to his customers in a good manner they always buy from him.

Robert needs this loan to buy more pharmaceutical drugs to improve his business.  He is hoping to establish a bigger pharmacy in the future so as to give his family a better life.

loans.use: To buy more pharmaceutical drugs to improve his business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Gladys is forty–two years old. She is married and has given birth to five children who are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. Gladys is a trader. She trades in plantains. She buys from nearby towns and supplies to food vendors and retailers in her community. She also treks to nearby communities to sell on their market days. Gladys has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy plantains

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is forty – two years old. She is married and has given birth to three children who are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. Gladys is a trader. She trades in plantain. She buys from nearby towns and supplies to food vendors and retailers in her community. Gladys also treks to nearby communities to sell on their market days. She has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy plantain

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo has been interested in the restaurant business for some time, having done apprenticeships at multiple coffee shops. At the beginning of this year, he and his business partner, Jarrod, jointly purchased their first cafe. They located themselves across the street from a train station, taking note that, while the area did have a few coffee shop chain stores, they didn't offer the "coffee house" vibe that Alfredo and Jarrod planned to bring to the neighborhood, with specialty drinks and great live music.

As of now, Alfredo and Jarrod are breaking even with their business that specializes in coffee, tea, pastries, and smoothies (a blended, chilled beverage made from fresh fruit or vegetables). They have some regulars and their foot traffic is steadily increasing, but they feel they could really take their business to the next level with some advertising in print media, on television, and through direct mail postcards that would help increase their visibility.

By drawing more people to their shop, they hope to grow their cafe and turn it into a place that neighborhood patrons love to frequent as a unique place not only to get a great cup of coffee but also to catch local live music acts.

loans.use: To pay for advertising to increase their visibility

loans.name: Nubia Del Socorro

texts.es: Nubia del Socorro S. tiene 42 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos y la actividad económica a la que ella está dedicada es a la venta de nacatamales, ella se inicia en este rubro siendo una madre abandonada pero que con mucho valor decidió enfrentar su situación e invirtió unos ahorros que tenía en la compra de cerdos, de esta manera pudo hacer su propia clientela, al principio fue un poco difícil, pues sus niños estaban pequeños y ella no tenia clientes fijos por lo que tenía que caminar largos trechos a ofrecer sus nacatamales. Ella nunca opto por dejar a sus hijos, ya que siempre ha sido una madre muy responsable y cuidadosa, gracias a Dios ella ha podido enfrentar todo lo que ha su vida se ha aproximado, y hoy en día se siente muy satisfecha por su valentía y ánimos de luchar por la vida. Ella desea un financiamiento para invertir en su capital de trabajo que es necesario para materia prima. El sueño de Nubia es salir adelante con su familia y enfrentar todos los retos.
texts.en:
Nubia del Socorro S. is 42 years old and has 2 children. The economic pursuit in which she is engaged is the sale of Nicaraguan tamales. She is starting in this field being an abandoned wife who very courageously decided to confront her situation and invested some savings that she had in the purchase of hogs. In this way she was able to establish her own clientele. At first it was somewhat difficult because her children were small and she didn’t have regular clients. For this reason she had to walk long distances to sell her Nicaraguan tamales. She never opted to leave her children because she is a careful and responsible mother, and thanks to God she has been able to face everything that life has brought her way. She now feels very pleased with her courage and desire to struggle for life. She wants a loan in order to invest in her working capital which is necessary for raw materials. Nubia’s dream is to get ahead with her family and to confront all challenges.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Yajaira

texts.en:
Yajaira is an associate of Esperanza living in the community of Quinientos in the Province of El-Seybo. The area where she lives is economically based around agriculture and services such as running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable at best. She lives in her community in a home with her husband and her two month old son. She is described as being entrepreneurial and hardworking.

Yajaira has been very successful in the Esperanza program and she is taking out her first individual loan, having successfully completed several group loans. She will use this loan to improve her business by painting the building where it is located, purchasing a new basin to wash hair in, and purchasing more beauty products to sell to her clients. She has over two years of experience in this business, has recieved training in beauty school, and has been so succesful that she has had to hire two employees to help her in her salon. Her long term goal is to continue developing her salon by adding features such as pedicures and manicures, so that it will be a full service salon and provide income to support her child. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Beauty products, wash basin and paint for her shop

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is a 38 year old businessman who runs a water supply business in Kayaba part of Mukuru  slums. He also owns rental units in the same area. He has been selling water for a period of five years and previously owned a grocery. He is requesting a loan of Kes. 50,000 to buy a water tank and a water pump. A father of four, Elijah hopes to own rental units and on a personal level, he hopes to buy his family a home away from the slums. He describes himself as social and generous.


About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Buy water tank

loans.name: Justinah

texts.en:
Justinah is a 46-year-old businesswoman who has been selling charcoal and vegetables for nine years in Machakos. She also supplements her income with small scale commercial farming business. She is requesting a loan of Kes. 40,000 to add to her inventory of vegetables and charcoal. She hopes to grow her business into a cereals shop. She describes herself as hardworking.


About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Increase her inventory of vegetables and charcoal

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is a 49 year old businessman who operates a herbal medicine business in Machakos town. He has been in this business for ten years. He also does farming as a means of generating additional income.    He is requesting for a loan of Kes. 50,000 to add stock of herbs, honey and packing materials. He hopes to improve his skills on alternative medicine to better his business. He describes himself as a professional.


About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Anatolyi

texts.en:
Anatolyi is married. He is a businessman from Ordzhonikidze. He runs a small business manufacturing and selling windows and doors. Anatolyi owns a store in his hometown. He is new to this type of business as he started it only two years ago. Currently, he has about 40,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital. His net profit amounts to 4,800 each month. 

Anatolyi is seeking a 12,000 Grivnya loan to increase his working capital and purchase additional raw materials for his business. He is hoping to use the loan to make more doors and windows out of wood. This type of merchandise always sells well in fall as it keeps houses warm in winter. Anatolyi realizes this type of inventory is always in demand. He is hoping to continue growing his business by opening new vending locations in the future.

loans.use: Increase capital and buy raw materials for making doors and windows

loans.name: Mujeres Capcitadas 5 Group

texts.en:
Carmen is the group coordinator of the group Mujeres Capacitadas (Capable Women). Her story is representative of both the member of her group and more generally of Esperanza's clients in the Dominican Republic (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) and Haiti. Her group is based in a small community close to the coastal town of Puerto Plata. Here electricity and running water (none of which is potable) are unreliable at best and there is no trash pickup. Here she makes her home with her husband and three children in a simple structure of wooden walls and a tin roof. 

Carmen has been a successful associate of Esperanza for two loan cycles now and she has repaid without problems. She says that working with Esperanza has helped improve her quality of life and she is excited to take her third loan. With this loan she will continue to invest in both of her businesses. For her clothing business she will buy blouses and women's pants to sell, and for her food stand she will purchase flour, meat and cooking oil. She has over two years experience and she expects her businesses, which are the main source of income for her family, to continue to improve her living situation. In the long term her goal is to open her own cafeteria. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Blouses, women's pants, flour, cooking oil and meat

loans.name: Nuria

texts.en:
Nuria is a Nairobi-based businesswoman who operates a boutique as well as rental units in Embakasi. She has been running this business for the last seven years after leaving employment where she worked as a teacher. She is requesting a loan of Kes. 50,000 to add to her inventory of clothes. A 45-year-old mother of two, Nuria hopes to start importing clothes directly and on a personal level to establish a stable family. She describes herself as hardworking and determined.

About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Scholastica

texts.en:
M. is a 26 year old mother of three who runs a retail shop in Mukuru slums Nairobi. She is requesting a loan of Kes. 20,000 to add stock of foodstuff and general merchandise in her shop. She has been running this business for one year and hopes to grow it into a well established business. She also hopes to have a happy and fruitful life. She describes herself as honest and determined.


About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es: Gilberto S. C. tiene la edad de 39 años, es  padre casado y tiene 2 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El quiere comprar mas ganado y cerdo. Hace muchos anos que el dedico a su campo y quiere crecer. Es el segunda préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. También, el es parte del comité la luchita, el banco de campo, hace 5 anos. El es el tesorero del comité y su iglesia y le gusta participando en los comités por que tiene mas respeto de la comunidad. El no tenía problemas con su campo hace cinco anos y por esta razón, cree que crecer su campo sin riesgo. El deseo de el es de proporcionarles a sus hijos la educación necesaria para que se preparen para la vida. Esto es el primer prestamo de FUDECOSUR.
texts.en:
Gilberto S. C. is 39 years old and is married with 2 children, who are his highest priority. He wants to buy more pigs and livestock. His land has been his livelihood for many years and he wants it to develop further. This is the second loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has also been part of the La Luchita committee, a farming communal bank, for 5 years. He is the treasurer of the committee and of his church. He likes participating in committees because he has a lot of respect for community. He has not had any problems with his land over the past five years, and for that reason, he believes that there is little risk that his land will not develop further. His wish is to provide his children with the education necessary to prepare them for life. This is FUDECOSUR's first loan on Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more cattle and pigs

loans.name: Wilma De

texts.es: Wilma tiene 45 años  es casada y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales solo una depende de Wilma, su esposo está trabajando en España desde hace varios años atrás. La señora Wilma es enfermera y aparte tiene el negocio de venta de  mercadería según la época ahora que estamos en tiempo de calor trajo chinelas y sandalias para vender ambulando como hace toda su mercadería, la competencia es alta pero la cliente trata de traer cosas bonitas y baratas y además la clientela a la que presta sus productos están acostumbrados a la calidad de su servicio. Gracias a ambas actividades Wilma ha cumplido sus cuotas en forma puntual en su anterior crédito sin ningún atraso, lo cual significa que sus ingresos son buenos gracias a sus dos actividades, y también tiene crédito en otra entidad financiera.

loans.use: PARA COMPRA DE MERCADERIA

loans.name: Guido

texts.es: Guido es soltero, tiene 25 años de edad, no tiene hijos y  vive en la casa de su padre. Guido se dedica al transporte público de pasajeros en su vehículo propio, actividad a la que se dedica hace más de 5 años. La competencia en el rubro del transporte es alta, pero la demanda también lo es, ya que para todos es conocido que es el medio de transporte más rápido. Cuenta con clientela fija que demanda sus servicios permanentemente. El destino del crédito es para cancelar el saldo por la compra de un nuevo vehículo, el mismo que prestara el servicio en el transporte público de pasajeros. Es el tercer crédito al que accede Guido con buen cumplimiento de pago. No tiene pasivos en el sistema financiero y cuenta con buenas referencias personales y morales.
texts.en:
Guido is single; he is 25 years old, has no children and lives at home with his father. Guido provides public transportation using his own vehicle, activity that he has been doing for more than five years. Competition in the transportation business is high, but demand is also high, because it is common knowledge that it is the fastest method of transportation. He has an established clientele that requests his services continuously. The loan purpose is to pay the balance owing from the purchase of a new vehicle, which will be used to provide public transportation services to passengers. This is the third loan for Guido and he has complied well with repayment terms. He has no liabilities in the financial system and has good personal and professional references.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a vehicle

loans.name: Salome

texts.es: Salome tiene 53 años de edad, la misma vive sola ya que termino su relación con el padre de sus hijos desde hace varios años atrás, cuenta con 3 hijos, 2 de los cuales ya son independientes, vive en una casa en alquiler desde hace varios años, la cliente vende todo tipo de artículos de chifleria en la plaza principal de nuestra ciudad por las noches, también ambula por toda la ciudad, al ser ambulante y producir algunos productos como las papas fritas no cuenta con mucha competencia, el crédito que se le otorgo fue para poder incrementar su capital de operación y surtir mas para poder ofertar mayor variedad de productos, en Agrocapital demostró un buen comportamiento de pagos, alguna vez se retraso ya que tuvo problemas familiares por uno de sus hijos y tuvo que viajar al interior.

loans.use: COMPRA DE MERCADERIA

loans.name: Dominga De La Cruz

texts.es:
La señora Dominga de la Cruz D. ha vendido carne durante 28 años siendo este negocio el que le brinda el sustento para sus dos hijos y sus padres.

Ella vende en la parte interior del Mercado Ivan Montenegro donde es visitada por los clientes para comprar la carne. Es importante destacar que ella ha laborado para Ceprodel un total de cuatro años y hoy en día ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de la carne de res y de cerdo para ofrecerla en su localidad.
texts.en:
Señora Dominga de la Cruz D. has sold meat for 28 years. Being in this business has provided sustenance for her two children and her parents. She sells in the interior of the Ivan Montenegro Market, where she is visited by customers who want to buy meat. It is important to emphasize that she has worked with Ceprodel a total of four years. Now, she has applied for a loan in order to purchase beef and pork in order to offer it in her location.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beef and pork

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es:
Alcides tiene 35 años, vive en la casa de sus padres. Desde su niñez se dedica a las tareas agrícolas, sus padres le enseñaron a desarrollar correctamente todas estas labores. Actualmente se encarga del cuidado de sus animales (ganado vacuno) y de sus tierras de cultivo, su trabajo es duro y arduo, pero es compensado cada día al vender la leche de sus vacas y en las épocas de cosecha. Para más adelante Alcides desea tener un establo más grande donde pueda albergar a más animales.
Esta es la séptima vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, está muy entusiasmado por este nuevo ciclo de préstamo y va a poner todo de su parte para seguir con la actitud de compañerismo que hay en su banco comunal. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará una vaca joven para criarla y que a futuro produzca leche.

loans.use: Compra de una vaca joven

loans.name: Aura

texts.es:
Aura tiene 57 años, es viuda y vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a la venta de un plato de comida típico de su zona llamado “chicharrón”, que es carne de cerdo frita y tiene gran demanda entre los pobladores. Para ello, Aura implementó un espacio en su casa para su negocio, el cual atiende todos los días, por la tarde hasta la noche, y al día siguiente en la mañana realiza las compras necesarias para la preparación. Con estos años de experiencia Aura ha visto el fruto de su esfuerzo y los frutos de su negocio y esto la anima continuar trabajando para el incremento de sus ventas.
Este es su crédito número 16 con MFP, ella es parte de un banco comunal y además es una de las fundadoras, por lo que persevera en mantener activo su grupo y renueva su compromiso de pagar con puntualidad sus cuotas de pago. El dinero que ahora solicita será utilizado en la compra de cerdos y bebidas para acompañar sus comidas.
texts.en:
Aura is 57 years old. She is a widow and lives with her two children in her own home. For the last 20 years she has sold "chicharrón", a food typical to the area she lives in. Chicharrón is fried pork which is in high demand. To work in this way, Aura works in every afternoon to night in the part of her home set-aside for her business. The following morning she spends her time buying the things she needs to prepare the meat. With her years of experience, Aura has seen the fruits of her labor and the fruits of her business and is motivated to continue working and improving her sales. This is her 16th loan with MFP. She is one of the founding members of her village bank and works hard to keep her group active and renew their commitment to repaying on time. The money she is asking for now will be used to buy pork and drinks to accompany her food.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pork and drinks for her business

loans.name: Rony

texts.es: Rony tiene una familia que está compuesta por 4 hijos de 2, 4 y 6 años de edad, Rony está casado y reside en Puerto Fernandez, lugar que es bastante humilde. Rony se dedica al transporte público, es mototaxista y en su negocio tiene varios años de experiencia, la competencia en este rubro es moderada por la zona. El destino del crédito es para la refacción de vivienda, no tiene deuda directas con otras entidades financieras, en nuestra Institución tiene buen historial crediticio, Rony es una persona trabajadora y responsable.
texts.en:
Rony has a family that consists of four children, ages 2, 4, and 6. Rony is married and lives in Puerto Fernandez, a place that is humble enough. Rony works in public transport, he is a motorcycle taxi driver and he has several years of experience in his business. The competition in this area is moderate for the region. The use for this loan is for the refurbishment of his home. He does not have direct debts with other financial entities, and in our Institution he has a good credit history. Rony is a very hard-working and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home Refurbishment

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.es:
Eduarda tiene 61 años, vive con una de sus hijas en su casa propia. Toda su vida ha estado ligada a las tareas agrícolas, actualmente siembra papa, habas y maíz y también cría ganado porcino en su mismo establo. Los cerdos que tiene, los vende mientras espera la cosecha, pues una vez llegada esta temporada su trabajo en sus terrenos de cultivo se intensifica, seleccionando cuidadosamente su producción que posteriormente vende poco a poco de acuerdo a la demanda del mercado. A Eduarda le conviene vender cuando pagan más por  el kilaje y es por eso que tiene un almacén grande donde guarda sus cosechas. Para ella, la ventaja de trabajar en la agricultura es que siempre tiene los alimentos para su consumo a la mano.
Esta es la sexta oportunidad en que  tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una persona puntual en sus pagos y se compromete a seguir trabajando de esa manera con sus créditos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en la compra de sacos de abono para su próxima siembra de maíz.
texts.en:
Eduarda is 61 years old, and she lives with one of her daughters in her own house. For her entire life, she has been involved with agricultural work, currently she is sowing potatoes, beans, and corn. She also raises pigs as livestock in the same stable. She sells the pigs that she has while she is waiting for the harvest. When the season arrives, her work in the crop lands intensifies, and she carefully selects the production that she would later sell little by little in accordance with the demand of the market. It is better for Eduarda to sell when they pay more per kilogram and for this reason, she has a big warehouse where she saves her harvests. For her, the advantage of working in agriculture is that she always has the food for her own consumption on hand.

This is the sixth opportunity that she has had a loan with MFP. She is a very punctual person with her payments and she is committed to continue working in this way with her loans. The money that she is requesting now will be utilized in the purchase of sacks of fertilizer for the next corn harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Félix tiene 56 años, vive con su esposa en su casa propia. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a las tareas agrícolas, lo cual le ha permitido sostener a su familia. Hoy, sus hijos son personas independientes y con sus propios hogares, por lo que Félix trabaja feliz al lado de su esposa. En épocas de siembra trabajan con la ayuda de sus dos toros para arar la tierra, de esta manera logra que sus productos sean atractivos para ser vendidos en el mercado de su localidad. Además sus tierras de cultivo se ubican en una buena zona, con  canales de riego que garantizan una buena cosecha.
Esta es la oportunidad número 14 en que tiene un préstamo con MFP, durante estos años (aproximadamente 6) ha aprendido el valor del ahorro, por lo que se siente muy contento de seguir participando en este tipo de créditos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para sus tierras de cultivo.

loans.use: Compra de abono

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesús tiene 36 años, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde su niñez se dedica a las tareas del campo, siembra hortalizas como la zanahoria, espinaca y cebolla, también cultiva alfalfa como el alimento primordial de los cuyes que cría en su granja. Cada mes vende grandes cantidades de estos animalitos a una empresa mayorista, de esta manera garantiza un ingreso adicional a la venta de sus productos agrícolas. Por tal motivo, Jesús desea mejorar su granja de cuyes, pues éste es definitivamente un negocio muy rentable.
Esta es la oportunidad número 13 en que tiene un crédito con MFP, él es un integrante activo de su banco comunal, por lo que se compromete a seguir trabajando por el bienestar común. l dinero que ahora solicita será destinado a la compra de madera para ampliar su granja, comprar cuyes de mejor raza y adquirir abono para sus tierras de cultivo.

loans.use: Compra de mandera para ampliar su criadero de cuyes

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 49 años, vive sola en su casa propia. Desde hace 12 años tiene una tienda donde vende hierbas aromáticas, como la hoja de coca, pero también ofrece otro tipo de artículos y productos comestibles. Su puesto está dentro del mercado de su localidad y atiende durante todo el día, todos los días, pero los fines de semana se toma un momento al medio día para ir a su casa a alimentar a los animales que cría. Julia trabaja con mucho esmero y fe en su negocio, para el futuro su deseo es mejorar sus ventas incrementando la cantidad de mercadería que ofrece.
Este es su 15avo crédito con MFP, ella es una de las socias más activas de su banco comunal, el cual tiene como nombre “Chamblachaca”. En esta oportunidad el dinero que esta solicitando será para invertirlos en la compra de mas mercadería en coca, velas y demás artículos para su tienda.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina tiene 50 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en una casa arrendada. DesD. hace 11 años se dedica a la venta D. helados en el parque principal del poblado más cercano a su casa. Ella misma prepara los helados con una máquina especial, por lo que empieza su labor a las 11 D. la mañana hasta el medio día, y por la tarD. los venD.. Cuando su hija termina sus clases la apoya en la atención D. su negocio y al terminar, van nuevamente al mercado para comprar los ingredientes necesarios para sus helados. Este negocio le permite mejorar la economía D. su hogar, es por eso que Marcelina está pensando en adquirir otra máquina para elaborar más helados. 
Esta es la 12ava oportunidad en que tiene crédito con MFP y está muy contenta D. ser parte del banco comunal que le ha dado la oportunidad D. integrarse para trabajar por el bienestar común. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. cajas D. barquillos, servilletas, leche, manteca y demás artículos e ingredientes necesarios para su negocio, en una cantidad que le dure para varios meses.

loans.use: Compra de ingredientes para sus helados

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mujeres De Fe Group

texts.en:
TeofiL. is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres D. Fe (Women of Faith). Her story is representative of both her group members and Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients. Her group is based in the community of Las Flores in the coastal city of Puerto Plata, where running water (which is not potable) and electricity are unreliable at best. She rents a simple structure of concrete walls and a tin roof where she lives with her husband. She is six months pregnant.

TeofiL. has become a successful Esperanza associate and has already successfully repaid three loans. With this loan she intends to purchase precious stones, Larimar (a locally mined precious stone) coconuts, shells, lanyards and metal wiring to use in her artisan work. She plans to market her goods both in her native City of Puerto Plata, but also hopes to market them in other islands in the Caribbean by sending them to her father who works in the Turks and Caicos. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Precious stones, Larimar, coconuts, shells, lanyards and metal wiring

loans.name: Elvira Azucena

texts.en:
Elvira Azucena G. runs a beauty shop in the Ivan Montenegro Market. She first opened her salon 6 years ago using savings.

She is going to use her loan to maintain her salon’s capital. She will buy shampoos, hair dyes, make-up and other things that will ensure that her salon is well-stocked.

loans.use: Buy hair dues, shampoo, make-up and other supplies

loans.name: Rosa Maribelt

texts.es: Rosa Maribelt S. Ríos tiene la edad de 42 años. Tiene 1 hijos que todavía no asiste a un colegio ya que está muy pequeño. Su actividad económica es la venta de ropa usada. Rosa tiene más de 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Ella es una mujer muy responsable y dedicada con su familia, por lo que siempre le ha gustado trabajar muy fuerte. Inicio por cuenta propia ya que empezó vendiendo pantalones, camisas y ropa interior  por lo que ofrecía sus productos en una comarca llamada el congo, fue aquí en donde inicio con este negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de camisetas, pantalones, faldas, ropa interior y trajes. Su deseo es establecer su propia tienda
texts.en:
Rosa Maribelt S. Ríos is 42 years old. She has a child who is still too young to attend school. Rosa has been selling used clothing for more than 6 years. She is a very responsible woman who is dedicated to her family, which is why she always enjoys working hard.

Based on her recollection, Rosa began selling pants, shirts, and undergarments and offered her products in a region of Nicaragua known as “El Congo”. This was the start of her business. The loan she is requesting will be used as operating capital to buy shirts, pants, skirts, undergarments, and suits. She hopes to open her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase more clothing

loans.name: Victor Enrique

texts.en:
Victor Enrique R. has been selling chicken and sausage in his meat shop, “La Chelita”, for 20 years. Victor’s shop is in the Ivan Montenegro Market in Managua. In the market his shop has walls, a metal door, a window, and a zinc roof. Before moving to the market, his shop was open air with a dirt floor.

Victor will use his loan to buy chicken to sell. The loans will help his business continue. Victor is married and has no children.

loans.use: To buy chicken

loans.name: Carmen Delia

texts.es: Carmen Delia D. D. tiene 52 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos y todos trabajan de forma independiente. Carmen se dedica a la compra-venta de ropa en general, ella ha logrado obtener clientes fijos desde que inicio su negocio y esto le ha permitido obtener ganancias que le han ayudado a solventar gastos en su hogar pues ella es madre y padre para sus hijos quienes han sabido corresponder al esfuerzo de su madre. Ella solicita un financiamiento que le permita comprar ciertos artículos como: trajes para niños, jóvenes, adultos y ancianos, además comprar tallas grandes y extra grandes ya que estas  cuestan encontrarlas y sus clientes las requieren, pues ella desea aumentar sus ventas. Su deseo es obtener su propia tienda de ropa.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Agueda De Jesus
