If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase seven sheep for breeding.

loans.name: Les

texts.en: K. is an older woman, 59 years old, and is the widowed mother of one son. Her son is newly married with a child. K. currently lives with her son, daughter-in-low, and grandchild, in Phnom Penh. K. depends on the income comes from her son’s business; he is construction foreman who employees to provide his service. To make additional income for family, K. hopes to run a suitable business but she lacks capital to begin the process. Thus, she would like a loan for capital to buy chicken in bulk from rural people and then retails them at the market. K. was not available for photographing, so her son, daughter-in-low, and grandchild are shown instead.

loans.use: To buy chicken in bulk from rural people to retail them at the market

loans.name: Sam-At

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-at Y., 33, and her husband, Hout Thol, 40, live in a small village along National Road Number 2 about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They have been married for more than eight years and have one son and three daughters, two attending school and one still too young to go to school. Mr. Hout Thol is a driver for an electrical shop in Phnom Penh.

One of Sam-at’s children works at a garment factory along with her. Since they don’t have transportation for commuting to work, Sam-at is asking for a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase textiles.

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: TATTEY Koku est un homme âgé de 61 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants. Il habite à Kpadapé, un village situé à 10 kilomètres de Kpalimé. C’est un enseignant retraité. Avec ce crédit, il estimerait achever sa maison afin de ne plus payer les frais de location. Dans l’avenir, il rêve de construire une autre maison à AVENO.
texts.en:
Koku T. is a 61-year old man, he is married and is the father of 4 children. He lives in Kpadape, a village located about 10 kilometres from Kpalime. He is a retired teacher. With this loan would love to complete building his house, so that he will no longer have to pay rent. In the future, he dreams of building another house in Aveno.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To complete building and maintenace of his house.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en: Lan K. is 29 years old married woman and mother. To earn a living, Lan K. buys clothe in bulk at reasonable price from her market supplier and then she walks selling those clothes from door to door around her community for a profit. As another source of family income is from her husband’s working in construction. He has employee to provide his service. Lan K. saw that her husband’s business is a profitable one for family; she would like to borrow a loan for her husband to use as capital to enlarge his business size.

loans.use: To enlarge his business size

loans.name: Phork

texts.en:
Mr. Phork Y., 43, and his wife, Mrs. Ratana Bou, 39, live along National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They were married in 1988 and have five children: four sons and one daughter. His wife is shown in the photo.

Phork has been a policeman for over 20 years, while his wife stays at home and does housework. He wants to supplement his salary by operating a taxi business when he is free, and so is requesting his first loan of $1,000 to add to his own money to buy a van to drive as a taxi.

loans.use: To add to his own money to buy a van to drive as a taxi.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo es una mujer muy responsable, tiene 33 años, es casada y madre de 4 hijos con los que vive en su casa propia. Junto a su esposo, se dedica a la siembra de plátanos, café y paltas, pero de todos sus cultivos, lo que prefiere sembrar es el café, por ser más rentable. Llegada la temporada de cosecha de este producto, muy ansiosa inicia la recolección del grano, que posteriormente lava y hace secar al sol. En este tiempo logra obtener muy buena cantidad de dinero, por lo que en cada viaje hacia la acopiadora que le compra su producto lleva de 3 a 4 quintales en 2 horas de camino en carro. De los 4 quintales su venta es un aproximado de 900 soles, mientras que con los plátanos obtiene una menor cantidad, pero le es muy útil porque cosecha con mayor frecuencia y le permite cubrir las necesidades de alimentación diaria de su familia. Ahora, la meta de Consuelo es de incrementar su producción para solventar la educación de sus hijos.
Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y durante todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser una cliente muy responsable y más aun en su cargo de tesorera de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita es para pagar a los peones que realizarán la limpieza de sus campos de cultivo de café.

loans.use: Pago por la limpieza de sus tierras de cultivo

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en:
Mr. Sophorn P., (age 29) and his wife, Mrs. Soklim Sim, (age 25), were married in 2001 and just have a young daughter. The family lives in suburb of Phnom Penh about twenty-five kilometers.

Sophorn has been a construction worker for 12 years. He works in his village and Phnom Penh. His wife has been a garment factory worker for 8 years. Sophorn is requesting his first loan of $300 to concrete his house foundation.

loans.use: To concrete his house foundation.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia tiene 69 años, tiene 5 hijos que viven independientemente y actualmente vive con su esposo en su casa propia. Aprovechando que vive en una localidad turística, la cual es muy atractiva y visitada por gran cantidad de personas, acondicionó su vivienda como una casa de huéspedes campestre. Delia también ofrece comidas típicas a sus clientes, para lo cual, su esposo va a la caza de animales regionales y ella los guisa aliñando con una hierba silvestre que le da un sabor muy peculiar y agradable, sazón que disfrutan todos sus visitantes. Y esa es una de las razones por lo que muchos turistas llegan a su negocio por recomendación. Aunque el paso de los años, la hacen sentirse cansada, Delia continúa atendiendo su hospedaje, mientras su esposo se dedica a sus cultivos de café, con cuyas ganancias pudo educar a sus hijos.
El banco comunal al que pertenece se llama “Gallitos de las Roca” y ella ingresa mediante la invitación de su hermana. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, donde espera llevarse muy bien con el resto de integrantes del grupo, además de comprometerse a pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas. El dinero solicitado será invertido en la refacción de las habitaciones para sus huéspedes, ya que quiere que su negocio sea más cómodo y atractivo.

loans.use: Refacción de sus habitaciones

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de pièces détachées

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase supplies of spare parts

loans.name: Jinja Misindye B Nanyonga Zara Group

texts.en: N. Zara is forty years old, married with eight children schooling and looking after four siblings. She operates a butcher business kind of real business to women but she is operating it. She has been in this business for over ten years. She buys meat from slaughtering place to butcher for sale. She is requesting for the loan to purchase at least 40 to 50 kilograms of meat for sale daily. This will enable her cater for her family needs, educate her children and still the well being of her family is her future dream

loans.use: To purchase at least 40 to 50 kilograms of meat for sale daily.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de pneus

loans.name: Ricarda

texts.en:
Ricarda, 47, from the village of Baculud Amulung, Cagayan. Ricarda, is married to Ruben, who works as a house carpenter in their community. They are blessed with four children: Diana - 20 years old; Angelica - 17 years old and a college student; Cheska Mae - 11 years old, an elementary school student, and Jhairo - 1 year old.

Ricarda earns approximately PHP600 weekly through her dressmaking business, an enterprise she has operated for 10 years. She also does clothing repair for extra income. This enables her to help her husband support their family's needs, especially the education of three of their children. Because she wants to improve her business output, she is hoping to avail financial assistance from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP8,000.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sewing service business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: réparer son four

loans.name: Phang

texts.en: Phang C. is a 51-year-old farmer who lives in Kampong Chhnang Province. Phang C. is married to Mr. Sophal, age 42, who works with her in the farming business, and he appears in the picture. This couple has been planting rice two months ago but their rice is not growing well because it is lacking fertilizer. Thus, Phang C. would like a loan to buy fertilizer to fatten her crop yield.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to fatten her crop yield

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy charcoal

loans.name: Kasokoso A Namaganda Hadijja Group

texts.en: N. Hadijja is forty-three years old a secretary of their group loan, widowed with three children of whom two are schooling and has one sibling she is looking after. N. Hadijja is carrying out a restaurant activity and she has been operating this restaurant so far it is two years. She is requesting for the loan to purchase variety of food menu to meet her customers’ different tastes that is bananas, cassava, sweet potatoes, rice, posho, drinks and sauce (meat, chicken, fish, vegetables, and so forth). She is a promising business woman whose dream is to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase variety of food menu to meet her customers’ different tastes that is bananas, cassava, sweet potatoes, rice, posho, drinks and sauce (meat, chicken, fish, vegetables, and so forth).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase tools

loans.name: Ntinda F Nasubuga Salima Group

texts.en: N. Salima is forty years old married with five children schooling. She is a tailor carrying out tailoring services which she has been doing for over four years. She is requesting for the loan to purchase material clothing’s’ for making different designs for sale to customers and more so she buys and sells already made clothes too. She hopes for improvement in her business. Her dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase material clothing’s’ for making different designs for sale to customers and more so she buys and sells already made clothes too.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de peinture pour bâtiment

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia manages a retail store for almost three years.  Aside from selling , she also sells cooked food during lunch time. Her daily net income is PHP300.00.  With her dream to expand her retail store her mini-eatery, she is now requesting to avail a loan of PHP15,000.00 that she can use to pursue her plans.  

She is married to Carlito, a farmer.  They have two children: Janine Frances- 17 years old, 1st year college student and Jessica- 15 years old, fourth year high school student. They are harmoniously residing at baranggay Sillawit, Cauayan City.

loans.use: Additional capital for business expansion

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy rice and beans

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy, or Neneng as she is fondly called in their village, is 39 years old and living in Barangay Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Andres and they are gifted with two children: Andy, 5 years old, and Bonna, 2 years old. As parents, they are responsible for supporting the needs of their children, particularly in financial, moral and spiritual aspects.

Daisy’s husband works as a bus conductor in Solano Vizcaya Liner while Daisy is engaged in selling frozen foods to help her husband gain income for their daily living and to save for the future of their children.

Daisy is now in need of financial support so she is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 from Kiva lenders. She plans to utilize the loan to purchase more frozen foods that she will deliver to her customers.

Daisy hopes that, with her patience and sacrifices, she will be able to earn a higher income and give their children a better future. As she has said, “Having a strong faith and determination will help you to attain your goal.”

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat des outils de travail

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat d'igname et de maïs

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en: Vorn C. is 43 years old widowed woman and mother, a resident of Pursat Province. Vorn C. currently lives with her sister who appears in the picture. To generate a daily income, Vorn C. raises a few pigs in a stall next to her house. She also sells her matured pig out to slaughterer at least two times per year. Vorn C. has blessed with five children; most of whom are employed in a various jobs. Because raising pig is the main source of income for family, Vorn C. requests a loan to buy piglet to raise.

loans.use: To buy piglet to raise

loans.name: Morena

texts.en:
Morena manages a store in the village of Villa Corazon, Mallig, Isabela. She is married and blessed with two children who are currently studying. She wishes that her children will finish their studies and this is the reason why she and her husband keep on working hard for them to provide their educational needs. Since their income from farming is not enough, she decided to venture in another business as an alternative source of income. 

“Through sacrifices and patience you can achieve success,” said Morena. She is a vegetable vendor in their village. She would like to buy additional vegetables to further minimize her fare in going to the market. But her capital is insufficient and that’s the reason why she is asking for additional financial support from Kiva lenders to gain a bigger income for her family needs. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 that she can use to buy more vegetables.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.en:
Arturo C.'s main source of income comes from selling buko juice (coconut water) in the market. He is 50 years old, married and has one school-age child. He is from the city of P-4 Gango Ozamis City. Arturo has been in his business for over one year and earns approximately 10,000 pesos a month.

In 2009, Arturo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Arturo is requesting a loan of 20,000 pesos which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make his product. This will be Arturo's first loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for buko juice

loans.name: Khin

texts.en: Two persons shown in the picture are Mrs. Khin K. and her husband, who are standing on their farm field. This couple cultivates variety kinds of crop to earn a living. They both are parents of two children; one of whom is working away from home, while other one attends school and works on the farm. To help alleviate the hard physical labor on the farm, Khin K. will be used her loan to buy a pair of water buffalo which she will use to plow the farmland.

loans.use: To buy a pair of water buffalo which she will use to plow the farmland

loans.name: Genie

texts.en: Genie T. is from the village of Sibugon, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Genie owns and operates a business manufacturing and selling wood products to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Genie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,500 PHP from GDMPC. Genie is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is engaged in charcoal making. Aside from this, she also sells vegetable in the public market of Mallig. With her desire to send her children to school and finish their studies, she wanted to continue her business and ask for business capital from the KIVA lenders amounting to PHP8,000.  She is  hoping that the lenders will approve her loan request for her to improve her charcoal making business and vegetable vending.  

Bernadeth is already a  widow and she only have one child.   “Patience is the key to success” is her guiding principle in life.  She is sending her child to school and dreams to finish her study until college. As she believes that education is the only wealth that she can give to her child.

loans.use: Additional capital for charcoal making and vegetable vending

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Phal H. makes a living raising pigs from her home and grows rice during the dry season. She is 42 years old and is married with three teenage children. Phal H. was not available during taking the photo, so her husband is shown instead. He assists her in the business.

Rice farming and pig raising are the main sources of income for Phal H. and her family; thus, she is requesting a loan to purchase rice seed, fertilizer, pig food, and a piglet for her daily routine activities.

loans.use: To purchase rice seed, fertilizer, pig food, and a piglet

loans.name: Mrs. Samorn Sorn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Samorn S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members I. Sokram village I. Takeo province. All the members will use the loans that they obtaI. for different purposes. Mrs. Samorn S. owns a small grocery store I. the local village so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods for her business. Her husband, Mr. Nak Thy, is a construction worker who makes a small income to support the family. Mrs. Samorn S. is 26 years old and the mother of a one-year-old child who is too young to work or study. 

All the members I. this village bank loans have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s maI. product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods for her business.

loans.name: Naing

texts.en:
K. is a 39-year-old married woman who is blessed with three children who are teenagers. She currently stays at home to sell a few produce items in her small store in front of her home. Her husband is a local farmer who raises a few pig from home.

Recently, K. has been very busy at her business because she has many clients who need more of her products, but she does not have enough supply to meet her customer's needs. That is why K. has requested a loan to buy extra grocery inventory. Note: K.'s husband appears in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more grocery inventory

loans.name: Mrs. Chrev Horm Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan, which consists of 16 people, is located in Thmei village in Takeo province. Mrs. Chrev H. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a pig breeder. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets. She will use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Teng Khloung, is a farmer and he also helps his wife in her current business. Mrs. Chrev H. is 39 years old and the mother of three children who are all attending the local school. All the members are presented in the picture. 

Fifteen members in this village bank loan have end-of-term loans and one has a monthly payment loan. The fifteen members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy piglets and fertilizer

loans.name: Deborah's Group

texts.en: K. Deborah has a lot of determination in whatever she does. She is a business lady with a boutique in Banda Zone ‘B’ for 10 years and also the business is mostly affected by the seasonal changes, she is able to make net profits of 50,000/= a week. She has a hope of increasing her stock so that she could be able to sell more by having an increased stock hence increasing her income. She also hopes to own rentals that could bring in a monthly pay hence being well of and improving her standard of living. Deborah is 47 years old and married with 5 children with the eldest being 26 years and out of school doing her own businesses; and the rest still in school as she takes care of other orphans. She is in need of a loan to help boost her business by stocking her boutique with more clothes for resale.

loans.use: Buying more clothes for increased stock.

loans.name: Saroem

texts.en: Mrs. Saroem K. is a villager in Samraong village in Takeo province. She owns a small grocery store in the local village. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods for her business. She is a widow with three children, one of whom earns an income by charging batteries. The others are employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy more grocery good for her business.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie G. is from the village of Sibugon Lopez jaena. She is 35 years old. Jessie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jessie owns and operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector making "kaang" ling flower pots. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making pottery. Jessie has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jessie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jessie successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,500 PHP from GDMPC. Jessie is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for pottery making. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jessie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to sustain the needs of her family.

About GDMPC

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for pottery maker

loans.name: Sam Art

texts.en: Mrs. Sam Art E. lives in Samraong village in Takeo province. She is a duck breeder. Since this business is going well, she wants to ask for a loan to buy more 550 ducks for breeding and she would use the rest of the loan to buy duck food to feed them. Her husband, Mr. Chel Dol, is a farmer and he also helps his wife on the current business. Mrs. Sam Art E. is 36 years old and the mother of four children who are all attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more 550 ducks for breeding and she would use the rest of the loan to buy duck food to feed them.

loans.name: Nafi

texts.en:
Mrs. Nafi M. F. is a villager in Trapaing Leuk village in Takeo province. She is 27 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study because that child is only three years old.

Mrs. Nafi M. F. owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. She now faces a small problem with her business because her field is infertile, which affects her crop. Therefore, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and a pump to support the field.

Her husband, Mr. Tom Kompheak, is a teacher who makes a small salary to help support the family. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy  fertilizers and pump to support her field

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Felista's Group

texts.en: N. Felista is a friendly lady who works so hard for a better life and that of others. She is 35 years old and married with 4 children and the eldest being 15 years and in secondary school. Felista is a Head teacher in Nabuti where she owns a private school and she is happy that she has managed to run it for 4 years successfully. She hopes to continue improving the academic standard of the school so that her pupils could be good citizens. She also hopes to secure enough land so that she could expand more as well as have a good house for her family. Felista needs a loan to help buy more food stuffs for her children like maize flour, sugar and beans for efficiency, since most parents pay school fees in small installments yet work has to go on at the school.

loans.use: Buying more food stuffs like maize flour, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel T. is from the city of Bañaderos Ozamiz City. She is 31 years old. Ritchel is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Ritchel owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a "sari-sari" retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Ritchel has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Ritchel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ritchel is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Ritchel from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her retail store

loans.name: Mrs. Samnang Tong Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Samnang T. is the leader of a group of six members who all live in Trapeang Dang Tuek village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Sok Lav, sells firewood. Mrs. Samnang T. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets for breeding to earn more income. She is 52 years old and the mother of four children. One child is employed in a garment factory; another is a seller; and the others are attending the local school.

All the members in this group are requesting end-of-term loans, so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan's term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy piglets for breeding to earn more income

loans.name: Thoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Thoeurn P. was born and lived in the best territory of Pursat province, since she was young. Thoeurn P. was married years go and has blessed with two kids who are still not enrolled in school. She and her husband own a plot of land that they were inherited from their grandparents, on which they grow different kinds of vegetable to earn a living. At the same time, Thoeurn P.’s husband is also a fisherman in the village. After Thoeurn P. has ready planted her crop, she is facing a problem with lacking fertilizer for her crop. She therefore would like a loan from Kiva to be used to purchase fertilizer to sustain her crop well growth.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to sustain her crop well growth

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia C. is from the city of Bañaderos Ozamiz City. She is 41 years old. Cecelia is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Cecelia owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a "sari-sari" retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Cecelia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Cecelia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cecelia successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Cecelia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Cecelia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her retail store

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en: Mr. Thorn N. is villager in Samroung village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectar field of land to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. Chhel Noeun, is a duck breeder. Since her poultry business is doing well, she wants to expand it. Thus, Mr. Thorn N. decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks and duck food for her poultry business. He hopes to increase the family's income and improve their living standard with this loan. He is 46 years old and the father of five children; three are enrolled in the local school and the others are too young to work or study. His wife is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more ducks and duck food for a poultry business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Khiem

texts.en: Mrs. Khiem S. is 38 years old widow and she lives in Ro Lous village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She is also a grocer. Now Mrs. Khiem S. is requesting a loan buy fertilizer to support the rice field and grocery products. She hopes to increase income and improve the family living with this loan.

loans.use: To ask for a loan buy fertilizer to support the rice field and grocery products.

loans.name: Sarorn

texts.en: Mrs. Sarorn S. lives in Samroung village in Takeo province. She is a Pro Houk seller in the local market. She also owns a poultry business and now she wants to expand it by purchasing more ducks and duck food for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Hum Mao, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Sarorn S. is 35 years old and the mother of four children who are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more ducks and duck food for breeding.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mrs. Touch N. is a villager in Ro Lous village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Nhoem Bou, are farmers who own a piece of land to cultivate rice. However, they do not have enough money to buy fertilizer and rice seed, or to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the rice field. Thus, Mrs. Touch N. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She is 51 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory; another is a farmer; and the remaining one is attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed, and to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the rice field

loans.name: Nak

texts.en: Mrs. Nak O. is a villager in Ro Lous village in Takeo province. She is employed in a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Doeu Tin, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, he faces an obstacle because he does not have enough money to buy fertilizer and to hire laborer with two oxen to plow on the field. In order to deal this problem, Mrs. Nak O. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She is 29 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to hire laborer with two oxen to plow on the field.

loans.name: Khut

texts.en: Khut T., 29, is a single woman. She now lives with her older father and other three siblings in a medium family home. To make a living, Khut T. has built a small grocery store in front of her home where she sells a few cooking ingredients and some sweet for kids. She typically generates an income of approximately of $5 each day to contribute her family’s living expenses. Recently, Khut T. has sold nearly all her item from her stock supply. Because of lacking capital, she would like to borrower a loan in order to accumulate the quantity of grocery item to sell.

loans.use: To accumulate the quantity of grocery item to sell

loans.name: Samban

texts.en: Mrs. Samban E. was born in 1968 and now lives in Ro Lous village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. She needs some money to buy fertilizer and to plow the rice field. Her husband, Mr. Khuon Sokhum, is a construction worker. This couple has four children; one is employed in a garment factory and the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to plow her rice field

loans.name: Thear

texts.en: Mrs. Thear P. lives in Ro Lous village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Nak Khom, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn for living. In this plantation, he faces an obstacle because he does not have enough money to buy fertilizer, for plowing, and to hire laborers to work on the rice field. Thus, Mrs. Thear P. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She is 41 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is attending the local school and the others are farmers. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, for plowing, and to hire laborers to work on the rice field.

loans.name: Maeth

texts.en: Mrs. Maeth S. is a villager in Prey Choeur Teal village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she is a chicken breeder. Her husband, Mr. Van Ra, is a construction worker. Although this couple tries to work hard, they still earn less income to support the household. In order to improve the family living, Mrs. Maeth S. decided to ask for a loan to buy two for breeding. She hopes to increase income and improve the family living condition with this loan. She is 36 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is a construction worker while the others three are enrolled in the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy two for breeding.

loans.name: Entilio

texts.en:
Entilio L. is currently in the business of selling local alcohol, and is requesting a loan to purchase more jericans of local alcohol to sell. Entilio is 37 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a hotel at the market.

About BRAC

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more alcohol to sell

loans.name: Chanthon

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthon P. lives in Kampong Chrey village in Takeo province. She is a grocer who owns a small grocery store. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more grocery products to sell.

Mrs. Chanthon P. is 40 years old and the mother of a child who is attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Mol Try, is a farmer who owns a plot of land he uses to cultivate rice. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Mr. Pann Nut Group

texts.en:
Mr. Pann N. is a Group leader of six members who all live in Ta V. village in Takeo province. He is a piglet middleman. Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets for his business. His wife, Mrs. Ou Norm, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. She is also a Khmer noodle seller. This couple has three children who are enrolled in the local school. 
Three members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more piglets for his business.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en: Salome A., 32, views herself as a humble and hardworking Kenyan.  She is married to a laborer and has two children, aged 5 and 15 yrs old. Her business is a tailoring shop which makes dresses and embroidery for female clients.  She currently has four employees and faces challenges with machine maintenance.  She will use the proceeds of this KES20,000 loan to buy a new sewing machine and cloth.  Her ultimate goal is to expand the business to the point where it can fully support her and her employees.

loans.use: A new sewing machine and cloth

loans.name: Azizullah

texts.en: The man who is pictured is Azizullah, the son of F. M.. He lives in District 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He wants to take out an individual loan of 50,000 AFN in order to repair his house and buy essential construction materials for it. He is glad that through this effective process he can solve his problems, and, finally, he would like to thank all the lenders around the world.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Agnes' Group

texts.en: W. Agnes is 24 years old and married with two children as she takes care of two dependants. Agnes is a beautician with a salon in Kitega that has been in operation for 3 years and it is able to make profits of 30,000/= a week. She specializes in plaiting, treatments and haircuts and her major challenge is the power cuts and the expensive chemicals that limit her profits. She has a dream of expanding and having her own salon since the one she has is owned by her husband and has many employees. She also vies to educate all her children to attain the best education so that they can have a better future. Agnes needs a loan to help buy more hair oils and weaves so that she can be able to boost up her business. She is such a friendly young lady and this will help her succeed.

loans.use: Buying more hair oils and weaves for expansion.

loans.name: Gairatjon

texts.en: A. Gairatjon is 31 years old and is married with two children. He is a market vendor, selling animal fodder. The income generated is used mainly to purchase small bulls to raise and sell. Now, Gairatjon applies for a 5,000 Somoni loan. He is planning to increase his working capital to expand the business and to use the generated income for forming a private farm for breeding cattle. Gairatjon thanks all supporting him and promises to repay the loan promptly. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase his working capital in order to expand the business

loans.name: Mrs. Savoeurn Prum Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group is comprised of seven people who live in Roka Village in Takeo Province. Mrs. Savoeurn P. has been selected by the members to be the village bank president. All the members will use their loans for different purposes. 

Mrs. Savoeurn P. is a tailor who works from her house. Her husband, Mr. Kung Sarin, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he grows rice. He has a problem because he does not have enough money to bU. rice seed and fertilizer to support her rice field. Thus, Mrs. Savoeurn P. has decided to request for a loan for this purpose. She is 38 years old and the mother of three children who are enrolled in the local school
. 
Five members of this group have end-of-term (EoT) loans and the rest have monthly-payment loans. The members with EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on their loans until the very end of the loan term. 

End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. The EoT loan allows the client to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer to support their rice field

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
40-year-old Rosalie C. is a newly recognized member of ASHI, the Kiva field partner in the Philippines. She wants to put up her own business to be able to augment her husband’s income from his job as an office utility worker.

Through her membership in ASHI, Rosalie requested a loan which will be used to pay for the purchases needed for her planned variety store business. By having a business of her own, Rosalie believes that the life of her family will be changed and improved. Profits she will make out of her business will be spent wisely for the necessary things her family needs, especially the needs of her four children whose ages range from 10 to 17 years old.

Through future loans with larger amounts that she can request after repaying this one, she believes that her business will grow and that she will be able to earn a bigger profit.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her variety store

loans.name: Annet's Group

texts.en:
N. Annet is a very hardworking lady with a restaurant business. For Annet, her day begins at 5 a.m. when she starts preparing breakfast for her customers in Nabuti. She is able to make 15,000/= as daily income and she says that this would be more except that the food prices are now expensive.

Annet needs to expand her business further by being able to prepare more foodstuffs as well as expanding her house for more space and comfort. She is a single mother of three children who are all in school and this is the best reason why she works so hard. She needs a loan to be able to buy more foodstuffs for her restaurant.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for her restaurant

loans.name: Roda

texts.en: Roda J. is currently in the business of selling charcoal wholesale at her store and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. Roda is 30 years old and is married with a husband who is a policeman. She has five children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business by building another store for selling charcoal. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Benter Achieng

texts.en: Benter H., 36, is married with four children ranging from 9 to 19 years old.  While she originally just sold charcoal, she has expanded her inventory to foodstuffs and household products and has one employee.  Her kiosk serves households and she struggles with fixed prices for her goods.  This KES20,000 loan will enable her to expand and deepen her offerings of foods as well as the ever popular scratch cards.  Benter considers herself to be a responsible hardworking vendor and she aspires to expand her business further.  Ultimately, she would like to purchase some land for development.

loans.use: Add additional items for sale including sugar, salad, flour as well as scratch cards.

loans.name: Mrs. Nim Mey Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group consists of sixteen people who live in K. Nhae Village in Takeo Province. Each of the members will use their loans for different purposes. Mrs. Nim M. is the village bank president. She is a weaver. She is also a farmer who owns a .7-hectare (1-3/4-acre) plot of land on which she grows rice. Her husband, Mr. Chrun Sok, is a motorbike taxi driver. 

Mrs. Nim M. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, piglets for breeding, and pig food. She is 33 years old and the mother of three children. Two of her children are enrolled in the local school. The youngest one is too young to work or study. 

Thirteen members of this group have end-of-term (EoT) loans and the rest have monthly-payment loans. The members with EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on their loans until the very end of the loan term. 

End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. The EoT loan allows the client to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, piglets, and pig food

loans.name: Abduvosit

texts.en:
F. Abduvosit is 35 years old. Abduvosit is married and has two children. His wife is keeping the house and taking care after their children. In order to support his family Abduvosit is selling household goods such as kettle, pail, basin and other items. He is in this business for 15 years. Having the rich experience Abduvosit is able to choose such goods that meet the requirements of the clients whose tastes are differ. The business is quite successful and generates the stable income that allows Abduvosit to improve the living condition of his family and to make his kids happy. Abduvosit has been provided with several loans by IMON during 3 years. He’d shown himself as an accurate client having the positive credit history. Today Abduvosit requests 3500 Somoni for purchasing the new household goods for selling thus enlarging the range of goods. Be an important part of the growth of Abduvosit’s business.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the new household goods for enlarging the range of goods.

loans.name: Lucia's Group

texts.en:
N. Lucia is a 44-year-old lady who is married with five children, three of whom are in school. She also takes care of four dependents.

Lucia is a farmer and is also involved in animal husbandry. Her main challenge is having cattle sickness and the drought and feeding her animals.

In the farming business, she grows food for sale and this helps to bring in a double income. She is able to save 30,000/= a week out of her income and it is this that helps to contribute to her family welfare. She ensures that her produce and cows are of good quality, hence earning a good income.

Lucia has a dream of buying more cows and more land both for cultivation as well as to build a good family house for her children.

Lucia needs a loan to help purchase more feed, drugs and seeds for her farm for improvement and to ensure good quality output products.

loans.use: To buy more feed, drugs and seeds for her farm

loans.name: Hellen Anyango

texts.en: Helene O., 44, is married to a farmer and has four children ranging from a 9 year old son to a 19 yr old daughter.   She runs a Mitumba / food kiosk with one employee and sells food, second hand clothes and footware.  The business caters to government workers and she manages the challenge of the high cost of inventory.  She is using the proceeds of the KES20,000 loan to increase her stock of food, clothes and shoes and buy new cooking equipment.  While she views herself as a poor and struggling vendor, her near term goal is to own a soda depot.

loans.use: Flour, maize, cutlery, cooking equipment, clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Elizerbeth

texts.en:
Elizerbeth R. is in the business of selling beer and wine. She is requesting a loan to purchase more tables and chairs for her bar.  Elizerbeth is 28 years old and is married. Her husband is a police man. She has a child who is not yet in school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a hotel where she would provide meals. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more tables and chairs for her bar

loans.name: Abdukayum

texts.en:
The agriculture business is one that requires much effort, for the simple reason that it requires sun exposure, the physical exertion of moving animals from one place to another, as well as the work it takes to tend to various crops. Abdukayum, has dedicated himself for already twelve years to cattle raising, which supports his humble family which so relies on him.

Currently, Abdukayum has turned to IMON International for a loan of 1000 USD to purchase calves that he can raise. It’s important to note that the granting of this loan will not only benefit him, but also his dearest children and wife who he loves greatly.

loans.use: To purchase young cattle

loans.name: Sy

texts.en: Mrs. Sy Y. lives in Prey Meas Village in Takeo Province. She owns a small piece of land that she farms for a living. Her husband, Mr. Keo Doeurn, sells groceries door-to-door. He has a problem because he does not have enough money to buy a new motorbike. His motorbike is very old and it uses a lot of petroleum, which is expensive. Thus, his wife, Mrs. Sy Y., has decided to ask for a loan to buy a new motorbike for her husband. Mrs. Sy Y. has two children who are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her husband's business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rebecca's Group

texts.en:
M. Rebecca is 42 years old and married with 6 children. Five of her children still attend school. She also takes care of 12 dependants in her village. She is a business lady, and has sold drinking water for the past 7 years. She has also been a farmer in Bijowali for a long time. Her farming has been greatly affected by drought and the lack of quality seeds which has reduced her income. She is able to make 30,000 UGX profit a week. In the future, she wants to buy a larger piece of land for agricultural expansion. She also plans on building a family house. 

Rebecca is requesting a loan to help purchase more high quality seeds for cultivation to ensure quality produce. She is such a determined lady with a strong vision  of growth and expansion.

loans.use: To buy high quality seeds for cultivation to ensure quality produce.

loans.name: Lonita

texts.en:
Lonita Montazes is a 45 year-old mother of five children whose age range from ten to 21 years old. She dreams that someday those of  her children, who are still studying, will graduate from college. She hopes also to be able to give her two eldest children, who are unemployed because of their low educational attainment, a stable source of income through a business. She has worked hard, all by herself, to attain this dream ever since her husband passed away, many years ago. 

Through ASHI, Lonita is requesting for a loan which will assist her financial needs in growing her hog fattening business (pig raising) which she started a year ago. Profits through her business, which have doubled, are a great source of support to for her family. Because of this, she has ben able to provide her children with regular meals, though they may sometimes not be as nutritious or special.

loans.use: To purchase piglets for her hog fattening business.

loans.name: Roda

texts.en: Roda J. is currently in the business of selling bread and phaste and is requesting a loan to open up a backery.  Roda is 29 years old and is Married with a husband that is a business man. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a hotel at the nearby market BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. loans.use: open up a backery

loans.name: Jahongir

texts.en:
Committed first and foremost to his family and business, Jahongir works hard at ranching. He has his own herd of cattle which he works day after day to earn a living to support his dear wife and little child. As every business requires investment, Jahongir needs to add some young bulls, that he hopes to raise and sell. He turned to IMON International to obtain a loan to buy the cattle and help improve his standard of living. Jahongir sincerely thank you for your generous heart.

loans.use: Purchasing young cattle.

loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.en:
(In the small photo, Christine was not in the group photo but a member of the group)
B. Christine is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is 25 years old and married with 1 child aged 3 years and in Nursery section as she takes care of her siblings. She is a tailor in Nakazadde and it’s the competition that enables her to succeed since she knows what she is doing. Before the tailoring business, she had a video library and changed two years ago and she is not regretting. She is able to make 30,000/= as profits a week and she hopes this will increase more because of the quality work she does. Christine has a dream of becoming a supplier of sewing machines as well as building a residential house for her children. She needs a loan to help add more capital in her business by buying more clothing materials for a steady supply. Christine is such a hard working and determined lady and I believe she will make it in future.

loans.use: Recapitalising her tailoring business with more clothing materials.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Since Hasan R. was very young, he has dedicated himself to raising livestock. He is married and the father of three children. Hasan hopes to purchase calves. He will raise animals and sell their offspring to small farm operators. To acquire the animals, Hasan came to IMON International for credit and this will help him maintain his dear home.

loans.use: Purchase calves.

loans.name: Safarmat

texts.en:
D. Safarmat is 53 years old. He is married with 3 children. Three years ago Safarmat decided to start his own business selling carpet. Safarmat began his own business with his hard earned savings as he had always wanted to be an entrepreneur. He is familiar with this business and provides good customer service. He has many clients and his business keeps growing. In order to increase the range of his carpets, he now needs a loan in the amount of $3000 USD which he will use to purchase more inventories. Be a part of this business and of Safarmat's family by supporting his growing business. They greatly appreciate it!

loans.use: Increasing of the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Mr. Em Huy Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mr. Em H. is a villager I. Niel village I. TaK. province. He is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a construction worker. Now he is applying a loan to buy a pump machine, construction supplies, and he would use the rest of money to buy piglet for breeding. His wife, Mrs. Nut Saraem, is employed I. a garment factory. This couple has two children who are just four and two years old. 
Eight I. this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s maI. product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy piglet for breeding.

loans.name: Dorine

texts.en:
Dorine S., who runs a hair salon (Plaits style), is requesting a loan to purchase weaving materials of hair to sell. Dorine is 35 years old and married to a health worker. They have two children who go to school. With the profits from her loan, she hopes to employ some experts in her saloon shop.

----------------------- BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase weaving materials for her salon shop.

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.en:
G. Bahrom is 34 years old. He is married and has three children. Bahrom owns a computer club where people can use computer, play video games and work on computers. He has also billiard table at his club. He rents a small office on the ground floor of a housing complex. He has been in this business for the past 5 years. When Bahrom receives credit, he plans to restore several computer systems that are currently out of order and with the part of them wants to buy additional computers.  This will provide Bahrom with an opportunity to increase the number of working computers in his club. This credit will help people who do not have home access to a computer to come and work at the club. Some can improve their computer skills and others can make new friends through video games and gain necessary educational information from different sites. The loan will greatly improve Bahrom’s income and his family's living standards.

loans.use: Purchasing of new computers and restore the exist one.

loans.name: Mrs. Nim Duch Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group consists of ten people wH. live in Pou Doh Village in Takeo Province. Each of the members will use their loan for a different purpose. Mrs. Nim D. is the village bank president. She and her husband, Mr. C. Roin, are farmers wH. own a plot of land on which they grow rice and vegetables. 

Mrs. Nim D. is requesting a loan to buy a cow to breed so they can earn more income. She is 45 years old and the mother of four children. One of her children is employed in a garment factory, another is a construction worker, and the others are enrolled in the local school.
 
All of the members of this group have end-of-term (EoT) loans, so they are not required to pay any principal on their loans until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. The EoT loan allows the client to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a cow to breed

loans.name: Justine's Group

texts.en:
Justine N. leads her lending group in Lugazi. She's hard working, determined and married with five children, who are in school. She also takes care of two siblings.

Justine sells fish and has done so from Busaana for five years. Her major challenge is catching enough fish. She is able to make 200,000 a month because of the quality of the fish she sells. She hopes to expand her business, provide a good education, health care and housing for her children. She needs a loan to buy more fish for resale.

loans.use: Buy more fish to resale.

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.en:
A. Khurshed is 28 years old, is married, and has a little child. For Khurshed the harvest is what he enjoys the most and he devotes a lot of time to sorting the potatoes that he will sell, because the price will depend on the size of the potato. Sorted, the potato is more profitable, although the potatoes he sells are not in great shape. Agriculture is full of satisfaction for him and his family, even more when they sell for a good price at the market; that is the motivation to continue planting. This is the second loan that Khurshed has with IMON International, making his payments on time. And he is very grateful to those who support him, because they allow him to provide well-being to his family. With the money requested, he will buy seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants for his farm.

loans.use: Purchasing seed, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Doku

texts.en: Doku S. is currently in the business of selling bread and is requesting a loan to purchase baking flour .  Doku is 22 years old and is Married with a husband that is a peasant. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a hotel BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. loans.use: purchase baking flour

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario T. Sr. is 33 years old and married to Carry. They are glad because they have been blessed with five children:Bernardino-13 years old, 1st year high school; Rodolfo-9 years old, grade-IV; Mario Jr.-4 years old and the twins Aristotle and Ariston-1 year old.

Mario hopes that he could sustain all the needs of his family. He repairs umbrella,water jag and shoes in their village. He is striving hard to provide the needs of his family. He would like to improve their way of living through his small business and he is now asking for additional capital from the KIVA lenders the amount of PHP5,000. He is praying that he could attain the amount of loan he is requesting. He is currently spending tuition fees, projects and allowances to his two children. So, he needs to double the income he generate to further supply all the needs of his family.

loans.use: additional capital for business

loans.name: Bahridin

texts.en:
Bahridin K. has been a potato farmer for more than 14 years. He is married and has four children. His wife is a housekeeper and he is the sole source of income for his family. He is about to harvest his potato crop. Bahridin requests a loan of 5500 Somoni to buy agricultural products to boost is next harvest. Bahridin wishes to improve his living conditions and hopes to do so with the profit his production will bring.

loans.use: Purchase seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Homa Soma Group

texts.en:
Rohgull is the group leader of the Homa Soma Group. There are three members in this group.  All of them would like to improve and make changes in their businesses and lives. 

Rohgull wants a loan to complete her PCO requirements. Homa would like to borrow money to purchase a new sewing machine and buy supplies for her tailoring business. Belqis wants a loan to buy supplies for her brother’s retail shop. They have requested a group loan of 20000 Afghani.

They all would like to state that Kiva is an effective process that can support all entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Abdusalom

texts.en:
Z. Abdusalom, 33, is a farmer who lives in Shahristan, Tajikistan. He is very experienced in this business and has been farming since 2002. He is married with three children. Unfortunately, Abdusalom's farmland is infertile. He is in need of a loan in the amount of $1000 USD to purchase fertilizer, fuels, lubricants and seed. Abdusalom hopes the loan will allow him to increase his earnings and with the profit he wants to send his sister, who is ill, to the modern hospital in Khujand. Z. thanks you for your loan that will improve the well being of this humble family.

loans.use: Purchasing seed, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is married to Eugenio but their marriage has not been blessed with a child. They reside in Sillawit, Cauayan City, a semi-urban and plain area located along the national highway.

Marcelina is engaged in a sari-sari store (community based store) business in their village. Her weekly net income is PHP 1,000 and, with her desire to improve her business, she is now asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 that she can use as capital for business growth.

Marcelina said that "happiness does not come from doing easy work but from the afterglow of satisfaction."

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Abduahat

texts.en: Abduahat is a small producer in the city of Isfara in Tajikistan. Together with his wife they’ve been raising cattle for more than fifteen years. This produces the income which allows him to feed his two children and his wife. As well as caring for his livestock, he also cultivates agricultural crops such as wheat which helps with the family's diet and provides additional income. Abduahat has asked for this loan to buy young cattle in order to obtain a better profit. His greatest wish is to be able to improve his farm by constructing enclosures and establishing better grazing for his livestock. loans.use: To buy calves and construction materials for improving his cattle-shed

loans.name: Shokir

texts.en: K. Shokir is 41 years old and is married with two children. His wife is the housekeeper. For more than two years Shokir has been running a small open café where he cooks kebab (pieces of meat roasted or grilled on a skewer or spit). His café is located inside the food market of the city. Shokir’s children are growing up and, accordingly, their expenses are rising. For this reason he wishes to expand his café in order to make more profit from his business. He requests the loan of 1500 US Dollars in order to increase his capital and expand his business. With your support, you can improve the quality of life for Shokir and his family and help his business grow and prosper. He is sincerely grateful for your support. loans.use: To expand his café

loans.name: Zakiya's Group

texts.en:
N. Zakiya is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is 24 years old and the single mother of two children aged 3 years and one and a half years and both of them are not yet in school.

Zakiya is a business lady involved in the sale of fish, mostly dried fish, in Tongolo. Since we are in a rainy season, it takes a lot of time for her to dry her fish and hence most of them rot. In a good season, she is able to make 100,000/= as profits and this is attributed to her good customer care.

She has the aim of expanding her business to ensure that she can earn more money and be able to educate her children to the highest level. Zakiya needs a loan to help buy more fish for resale. She is such a hardworking and determined lady with a strong drive to succeed.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Malikakhon

texts.en: K. Malikakhon is 35 years old and is married. Her husband is currently earning money in Russia. Malikakhon lives in her own house with the basic necessities. She has one child. Malikakhon has been the owner of a small general store for more than two years. She sells foodstuffs for everyday use such as: rice, flour, macaroni, soft drinks, sweets (candies), etc. She runs her business from her home. Malikakhon’s motivation for requesting a loan is to be able to purchase more merchandise to stock her business. A larger selection of goods will attract more clients and generate a good monthly income to help her family. Support this woman of much strength and courage to keep working. loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en:
“Team work makes the dream work”, said Estrelita.  She is 43 years old and still very diligent in her general store business and gasoline retailing.  She were blessed with six children and all are studying. It is not easy to send six children to school so she came up with her own business since their income from farming is not enough to provide the educational needs of their children.  

Estrelita needs to add more items in her store in order to gain more income.  She believes that through her business, she can meet the needs of their family. This motivates her tom seek for financial assistance from the KIVA lenders amounting to PHP5,000.  She hopes to become successful in her business endeavor.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for her store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en:
Saodat is the married mother of two children. Her women’s clothing business has been a valuable source of income for her and her family over the past ten years that she’s been in business. In a typical month she makes about $200 in profit from the business.

Saodat is hard-working, polite and communicative entrepreneur. She has an attitude of service and loves being able to help women with their clothing needs. She has requested a loan of $800 USD to purchase new inventory. This loan will help her to continue developing her business and provide a good income for her family.

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit:  www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy new inventory for her business

loans.name: Mehrangez

texts.en:
B. Mehrangez is 20 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. Mehrangez is a market vendor. She is selling the clothing for kids in the local market.
