Se dedica a la agricultura, siembra paltas y café; pero su cultivo preferido es el café, por ello con mucha alegría y dedicación cuida sus plantas, podando y quitando todos los arbustos para que se ramifiquen y desarrollen rápidamente para que en menos de 9 meses ya pueda estar cosechando. Herminia vende su café a una acopiadora llamada “Mina”, la cual le compra toda su producción a un buen precio y sin engañarla en el peso, como otros compradores. Para ello, debe transportar los sacos de su producto durante 2 horas en carro desde su chacra. Las ganancias que obtiene por su café las usa para comprar vestimenta para sus hijos y otras necesidades de su hogar.
Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y manifiesta su agradecimiento a los integrantes de su banco comunal, quienes le permitieron ser parte de ellos y confiaron en su trabajo responsable. Con el dinero que ahora solicita quiere comprar un motocarro para poder trasladarse rápidamente a las tierras de cultivo que tiene en zonas más alejadas, donde no pueden ingresar los autos.
texts.en:
Herminia is 29 years old. She lives with her partner, the father of her 3 children, in a rented house. Her work is in agriculture; she cultivates both avocados and coffee, but her preferred crop is coffee. She tends her plants with great joy and dedication, pruning them and removing the brush so that they will branch properly and develop rapidly, providing a harvest in less than 9 months. Herminia sells her coffee to a wholesaler called "Mina," which purchases all of her production at a good price and does not cheat her on the weight as some other buyers do. For this, she has to transport her products in sacks 2 hours by car from her farm. She uses the profits from her coffee to buy clothes for her children and other necessities for her home. This is Herminia's second loan with MFP, and she expresses her gratitude to the members of her communal bank who have allowed her to join them and who have shown faith in her as a responsible worker. With the funds she is currently requesting, she will buy a motocarro (a 3-wheeled vehicle with cargo space in the back), so that she can move around quickly on her cultivated land, some of which is in isolated areas not accessible by car.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a motocarro (3-wheeled vehicle)

loans.name: Fokaben Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Fokaben est composé de quatre  femmes mariées vivant toutes dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies. Ayant en moyenne 37 ans et 2 enfants, elles habitent dans le village Noumouwèrè  dans la préfecture de Ségou (4ème  Région administrative de la république du Mali).
 Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de mariage et font la production et vente de la poterie (canaris, gargoulettes, passoires et marmites) et des calebasses décorées de gravures. 
Dans le but de d’associer d’autres activités artisanales à celles qu’elles mènent, elles décidèrent d’intégrer Soro Yiriwaso. Après six prêts de groupe tous remboursés sans aucune difficulté, elles  sont à leur 7ème  prêt solidaire qui sera  utilisé pour acheter,  20 colis de calebasses (chaque colis contient 20 à 30 calebasses). Les calebasses achetées sont limées et gravées de dessins avant d’être mises au marché.  
Elles se ravitaillent en calebasses dans les foires de Tonan, Cinzana et au grand marché de Ségou.  Les produits sont revendus au comptant au bord du goudron à proximité de la grande mosquée et en ambulant à travers la ville de Ségou à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 26.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et prendre en charge le pétrole et les dépenses des scolaires qui sont à Ségou. 
Elles ont pour ambition l’installation d’un moulin dans le village afin qu’elles aient plus de temps pour leurs activités génératrices de revenus.

loans.use: Achat  de calebasses.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 39 años, está separado de su pareja. Tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 12 años, con los que vive  en su casa. Tras el abandono de su esposa, Jaime adquirió mayor responsabilidad por el bienestar de sus hijos. Ahora se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para preparar los alimentos y posteriormente trabajar en sus chacras de café o en las de sus vecinos, macheteando y quitando los arbustos, por lo que le pagan 18 soles diarios. En el caso de realizar sus propias cosechas de café sus hijos se suman a la recolección, ya que con su producción abastece a una a asociación de productores, quienes le compran a precio razonable. En esta labor Jaime se siente muy bien, sobre todo porque tiene tiempo para compartir con sus hijos, a quienes ama mucho.
Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que está muy contento de ser parte de un banco comunal y asimismo se compromete a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente. El dinero que viene solicitando es para la compra de fungicidas para sus plantaciones de café.

loans.use: Compra de fungicidas

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es: La Señora Candida Rosa Medina Cáceres tiene 61 años, ella tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000 ya que es por medio de ella que ha obtenido los financiamientos necesarios para su negocio. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una librería hace mas de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, con mucho esfuerzo logro establecerse en este lugar, actualmente está ubicada en su vivienda. En su negocio vende ciertos productos como papel, calculadora, tijeras y útiles escolares. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima que es necesaria para su negocio. El deseo de Candida es seguir creciendo para darle los estudios necesarios a su hija.
texts.en:
Mrs.Candida Rosa Medina Cáceres is 61 years old and has been working with Fundación León 2000 for a long time. Through Fundación León 2000 she has been able to finance her business. For the last 5 years, she has had a bookstore in her home that took her a lot of effort to establish. In her shop, she sells paper, calculators, scissors and school supplies. The loan will be used for working capital to buy the supplies she needs for her business. Candida's wish is to continue growing her business so that she will be able to put her daughter through school.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre de 50 años, es padre de un hijo y vive en su casa con su pareja. Cariñosamente le llaman “El  Rocotero”, debido a su actividad, pues se dedica a la compra y venta rocotos, también de cayhuas y plátanos. A Juan no le molesta que lo llamen así, por el contrario le hace mucha gracia. Los rocotos y las cayhuas que vende los envía a un mercado grande de la ciudad de Lima, mientras que los plátanos van con destino a otra ciudad aledaña donde año tras año le solicitan dicha fruta. Los viernes a las 3 de la mañana se dirige a las chacras de sus vecinos en busca de los plátanos; para que en la tarde, en compañía de su esposa e hijo, encajonen los plátanos para ser transportados sin dañarse. Juan está muy contento con su labor, porque le es rentable y con esas ganancias puede vivir tranquilamente con su familia. 
Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que tiene muchas expectativas y se compromete a pagar puntualmente cada una de sus cuotas para no defraudar a los demás socios de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en el incremento de su capital de trabajo para la compra y venta de mayor cantidad de productos.

loans.use: Incremento de su capital de trabajo

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros Y. is 62 years old and married with 3 adult children. She and her husband help each other in running their business. The couple lives in the village of Nabantu-an, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. Even while she is growing older, Milagros and her husband want to retain their independence by having their own business. Milagros is quite content that her 3 children have their own families and are all gainfully employed, earning enough to afford giving extra money to support their parents. Milagros is very aware that she needs to have proper nutrition now to stay healthy, and she also dreams to build a decent house for herself and her husband.

Milagros always wanted to help her husband earn their living. She knew that if she only had the opportunity to use her cooking skills, she'd make a successful business, but before she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001, she did not have such an opportunity. But as soon as she became a member of NWTF-PD, she was able to set up her own "carinderia" an eatery or luncheonette selling and serving cooked food in a simple kitchen setup, adjacent to her house. Before long she had a loyal clientele and her food sold out fast each day, she had to frequently increase the volume she cooked each day. It was fortunate that she could borrow additional capital to address the growing opportunity that she was able to sustain and stabilize her business. Later, she even started investing in raising pigs as it would allow her to build savings. She only sold her pigs when she really needed the money. Her business ventures earn her an average income of PHP 5,000 per month and it is taking her one step nearer her dream.


With her previous loan, she borrowed Php 10,000 on her 12th cycle and used it as additional capital for her businesses. She was able to return this loan in full without any delays. Now she is borrowing the same amount of Php 10,000 for her 13th cycle loan to use in her business in Carinderia and raising pigs.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for her lunchenette and raising pigs

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre de buen carácter, tiene 36 años y vive con su pareja y madre de sus 2 hijas, en una casa alquilada. Se dedica a sembrar y cultivar plátanos, café, rocotos y cayhuas en sus propias chacras, donde generalmente trabaja solo; pero para la temporada de cosecha, necesita de la ayuda de su esposa, quien lo ayuda a encajonar los plátanos. Estas labores agrícolas le agradan muchísimo, más aun cuando los comercializa a un buen precio, vendiendo las  50 ó 70 cajas que tiene hasta 490 soles, pero cuando bajan los precios muchas veces no llega ni a la mitad de esta cantidad; pese a estas dificultades, Juan no piensa dejar sus cultivos, ya que gracias a ellos trabaja tranquilamente, sin presión alguna y brindando lo necesario para su familia.
Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, en el segundo le normaron secretario de su banco comunal, desde entonces en cada reunión lleva junto a él el libro de actas del grupo. Con el dinero solicitando piensa implementar en su casa un espacio para la venta de  combustibles, debido a que está situado al costado de la carretera principal de su localidad. También comprará cajones vacíos para encajonar sus frutas.
texts.en:
Juan is a man of good character. He is 36 years old and lives with his partner, who is the mother of his 2 daughters, in a house that they rent. He dedicates himself to planting and cultivating bananas, coffee, large peppers, and cayhuas (local peppers) on his own small plots of land where he works alone. However, for harvest season he needs the help of his wife, who helps him box the bananas. These agricultural labors please him a lot, even more when he can sell the food at a good price. He can sell 50 to 70 boxes and make up to 490 soles ($169 dollars), but when the prices drop he doesn’t even make half of this. Despite these difficulties, Juan doesn’t think he should leave his crops since thanks to them he works calmly, without any pressure and providing what’s necessary for his family. This is his third loan with MFP (a Kiva field partner); in the second loan they named him secretary of his communal bank. Since then he brings the group’s book of minutes with him to every meeting. With the loaned money he is thinking of creating a space in his house for the sale of fuel since his home is located on the edge of the principle highway in his area. Also he will buy empty boxes for packing his fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Seton Hill University , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase boxes for fruit and to invest in a new business

loans.name: Somadje Koko Mimi

texts.fr: Cette femme est gérante d’un débit de boissons dans le quartier de Baguida à Lomé ; elle a débuté cette activité depuis 2006 et cette activité lui permet d’apporter sa contribution financière dans la vie du foyer. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle vend aussi bien en gros qu’en détail ; elle reçoit des commandes de la part de ses clients lors des fêtes, mariages et anniversaires et est bien connue des gens du quartier. Elle pense dans un proche avenir se lancer aussi dans le commerce d’alimentation générale dans sa boutique. C’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour s’approvisionner en produits d’alimentation générale ; le prêt servira aussi à commander 40 casiers de boissons de toutes sortes.
texts.en:
This woman manages a drinks depot in the neighborhood of Baguida in Lomé; she began this business in 2006 and this business enables her to contribute financially to the needs of her family. She is married and the mother of one child. She sells at wholesale, as well as retail. She receives orders from her clients for parties marriages and anniversaries. She is well-known in the neighborhood. In the future she intends to turn her business into a general grocery store. It is for this reason that she is requesting a loan from WAGES in order to acquire these general food products. This loan will also be used to order 40 cases of drinks of all sorts.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cases of drinks

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is 40 years-old and a married mother of six children. Four of her children are currently in school. She is a very hardworking woman who brings joy to her home through hard work and commitment.

Nana is a food vendor who sells wheat porridge with sliced bread in the market center in the community where she lives. Her porridge is rich and tasty and this is why school children buy it on their way to school in the morning. Wheat porridge is highly nutritious and she prepares it in the morning and in the evening. She uses this business to support her children in school. Nana has seen a down turn in her business due to the high cost of goods and raw materials in the market. She is asking for a loan in order to buy bags of wheat, sugar and bread to better meet the demands of her consumers. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients.

loans.name: Marcia Francisca

texts.es: Marcia Francisca C. R. tiene la actividad económica de una pulpería. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella tiene 53 años de edad. Marcia tiene 2 hijos, y todos estudian por el mayor sacrificio que realiza Doña Marcia. Su negocio se dio porque ella decide vender refrescos por lo que tuvo bastante influencia de clientes, y le genero ciertas ganancias y decide invertir un poco más en este negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de productos como golosinas, jugos, refrescos, pan, detergentes, jabón entre otras cosas. Su mayor sueño es ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes y proporcionarles mejoras a su vivienda.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen, a 30-year-old married father of two children who are all currently in the basic school, has been selling foodstuffs for three years now.  Trading in cereals such maize, groundnut, beans and other food items, he buys directly from farmers at a relatively low price and then sells at the local market in the town where he lives with his family. He also treks with some of his goods to nearby markets to sell.  He is requesting a loan to buy the goods in bulk so that he can distribute to a number of customers. This he believes will reduce the need for frequent traveling.

loans.use: To buy more cereals such as maize, beans etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Vera

texts.en: Vera, 22 years old and the married mother of three children, all currently in school except for her youngest, started her dried and smoked fish business seven years ago at a community market in the town where she lives. She buys stocks of fish from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Many people purchase from her stand in the market due to her business ethics and manners, and the proceeds pay for her children's food, school costs and sometimes their medical bills. She is requesting a loan to increase her stock of assorted fishes in order to improve her profits, thereby enabling her to better support her children's education and grow her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock of smoked fishes and dried fish.

loans.name: Grace Group

texts.en:
“Grace” is a group of five borrowers led by Fatu T., a  33-year-old married woman. Fatu has three children aged 9 to 14 years old and their educational levels are 2nd through 7th grade.

Fatu is illiterate because she is a victim of the belief that only men should be educated and women should be taken care of by their husbands. She lives in New Kru Town, a crowded and poor community north of the Monrovia, the capital of Liberia, that is full of crime. She works in the Dualla Market, a big market where farmers brings their goods from out of town to sell.

Fatu's business is selling used clothing. She buys used clothing wholesale and sells it in the Dualla Market. She has been running this business for ten years and hopes to own a boutique in the future. Fatu sells quality products so that customers can be encouraged to always come back and buy more from her.

Fatu needs this loan in order to purchase more goods. She dreams of building a house for herself and her family and to totally change her family’s life.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing to sell

loans.name: Assiongbon

texts.fr: Ce monsieur a appris le métier de couture ; il a ouvert dans le quartier de Baguida à Lomé son atelier de couture. Depuis un certain temps, son atelier ne reçoit plus de clients comme par le passé ; c’est pour cette raison qu’il a acheté en 2006 une moto pour faire taxi ; il conduit lui-même son taxi-moto et confie la gestion de son atelier à un apprenti tailleur expérimenté. Grâce à cette nouvelle activité bien rentable pour lui, il a ouvert une petite cabine de téléphone cellulaire dans son atelier. Avec ces deux activités, il arrive à s’en sortir. Il voudrait avoir un crédit de WAGES pour acheter des cartes de recharge pour sa cabine cellulaire ; le reste du prêt servira à réparer son taxi moto tombé en panne. Il est marié et a un enfant à sa charge.
texts.en:
This man learned the sewing trade. He opened his own sewing workshop in the neighborhood of Baguida in Lomé. For a while, his store has not received customers from foot-traffic. It is for this reason that in 2006 he purchased a motorcycle to use as a taxi. He drives the moto-taxi himself and has given the management of his workshop over to an experienced tailor's apprentice. Thanks to the profitability of this new business, he opened a small cellular telephone booth in his workshop. With these two businesses, he is able to properly handle his finances. He would like a credit from the micro-finance group WAGES to purchase cell-phone credit re-fill cards; he will use the remainder of the loan for repairs of his moto-taxi. He is married and has on child in his care.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase phone credit refill cards and to repair his moto-taxi.
